  finally show "p ‚â§ nat ‚åäroot l x‚åã" using pi l x by (simp add: le_nat_iff' le_floor_iff)

  from pi have "2 ^ i ‚â§ real p ^ i" using l
    by (intro power_mono) (auto dest: prime_gt_1_nat)
  also have "‚Ä¶ ‚â§ x" using pi by simp
  finally show "i ‚â§ nat ‚åälog 2 x‚åã" using pi x
    by (auto simp: le_nat_iff' le_floor_iff le_log_iff powr_realpow)
qed

lemma mangoldt_non_primepow: "¬¨primepow n ‚üπ mangoldt n = 0"
  by (auto simp: mangoldt_def)

lemma le_imp_bigo_real:
  assumes "c ‚â• 0" "eventually (Œªx. f x ‚â§ c * (g x :: real)) F" "eventually (Œªx. 0 ‚â§ f x) F"
  shows   "f ‚àà O[F](g)"
proof -
  have "eventually (Œªx. norm (f x) ‚â§ c * norm (g x)) F"
    using assms(2,3)
  proof eventually_elim
    case (elim x)
    have "norm (f x) ‚â§ c * g x" using elim by simp
    also have "‚Ä¶ ‚â§ c * norm (g x)" by (intro mult_left_mono assms) auto
    finally show ?case .
  qed
  thus ?thesis by (intro bigoI[of _ c]) auto
qed

(* TODO: unneeded. But why does real_asymp not work? *)
lemma ln_minus_ln_floor_bigo: "(Œªx. ln x - ln (real (nat ‚åäx‚åã))) ‚àà O(Œª_. 1)"
proof (intro le_imp_bigo_real[of 1] eventually_mono[OF eventually_ge_at_top[of 1]])
  fix x :: real assume x: "x ‚â• 1"
  from x have *: "x - real (nat ‚åäx‚åã) ‚â§ 1" by linarith
  from x have "ln x - ln (real (nat ‚åäx‚åã)) ‚â§ (x - real (nat ‚åäx‚åã)) / real (nat ‚åäx‚åã)"
    by (intro ln_diff_le) auto
  also have "‚Ä¶ ‚â§ 1 / 1" using x * by (intro frac_le) auto
  finally show "ln x - ln (real (nat ‚åäx‚åã)) ‚â§ 1 * 1" by simp
qed auto

lemma cos_geD:
  assumes "cos x ‚â• cos a" "0 ‚â§ a" "a ‚â§ pi" "-pi ‚â§ x" "x ‚â§ pi"
  shows   "x ‚àà {-a..a}"
proof (cases "x ‚â• 0")
  case True
  with assms show ?thesis
    by (subst (asm) cos_mono_le_eq) auto
next
  case False
  with assms show ?thesis using cos_mono_le_eq[of a "-x"]
    by auto
qed

(* TODO: Could be generalised *)
lemma path_image_part_circlepath_same_Re:
  assumes "0 ‚â§ b" "b ‚â§ pi" "a = -b" "r ‚â• 0"
  shows   "path_image (part_circlepath c r a b) = sphere c r ‚à© {s. Re s ‚â• Re c + r * cos a}"
proof safe
  fix z assume "z ‚àà path_image (part_circlepath c r a b)"
  with assms obtain t where t: "t ‚àà {a..b}" "z = c + of_real r * cis t"
    by (auto simp: path_image_part_circlepath exp_eq_polar)
  from t and assms show "z ‚àà sphere c r"
    by (auto simp: dist_norm norm_mult)
  from t and assms show "Re z ‚â• Re c + r * cos a"
    using cos_monotone_0_pi_le[of t b] cos_monotone_minus_pi_0'[of a t]
    by (cases "t ‚â• 0") (auto intro!: mult_left_mono)
next
  fix z assume z: "z ‚àà sphere c r" "Re z ‚â• Re c + r * cos a"
  show "z ‚àà path_image (part_circlepath c r a b)"
  proof (cases "r = 0")
    case False
    with assms have r: "r > 0" by simp
    with z have z_eq: "z = c + r * cis (Arg (z - c))"
      using Arg_eq[of "z - c"] by (auto simp: dist_norm exp_eq_polar norm_minus_commute)
  moreover from z(2) r assms have "cos b ‚â§ cos (Arg (z - c))"
    by (subst (asm) z_eq) auto
  with assms have "Arg (z - c) ‚àà {-b..b}"
    using Arg_le_pi[of "z - c"] mpi_less_Arg[of "z - c"] by (intro cos_geD) auto
  ultimately show "z ‚àà path_image (part_circlepath c r a b)"
    using assms by (subst path_image_part_circlepath) (auto simp: exp_eq_polar)
  qed (insert assms z, auto simp: path_image_part_circlepath)
qed

lemma part_circlepath_rotate_left:
  "part_circlepath c r (x + a) (x + b) = (Œªz. c + cis x * (z - c)) ‚àò part_circlepath c r a b"
  by (simp add: part_circlepath_def exp_eq_polar fun_eq_iff
                linepath_translate_left linepath_translate_right cis_mult add_ac)

lemma part_circlepath_rotate_right:
  "part_circlepath c r (a + x) (b + x) = (Œªz. c + cis x * (z - c)) ‚àò part_circlepath c r a b"
  by (simp add: part_circlepath_def exp_eq_polar fun_eq_iff
                linepath_translate_left linepath_translate_right cis_mult add_ac)

lemma path_image_semicircle_Re_ge:
  assumes "r ‚â• 0"
  shows   "path_image (part_circlepath c r (-pi/2) (pi/2)) =
             sphere c r ‚à© {s. Re s ‚â• Re c}"
  by (subst path_image_part_circlepath_same_Re) (simp_all add: assms)

lemma sphere_rotate: "(Œªz. c + cis x * (z - c)) ` sphere c r = sphere c r"
proof safe
  fix z assume z: "z ‚àà sphere c r"
  hence "z = c + cis x * (c + cis (-x) * (z - c) - c)"
        "c + cis (-x) * (z - c) ‚àà sphere c r"
    by (auto simp: dist_norm norm_mult norm_minus_commute
                   cis_conv_exp exp_minus field_simps norm_divide)
  with z show "z ‚àà (Œªz. c + cis x * (z - c)) ` sphere c r" by blast
qed (auto simp: dist_norm norm_minus_commute norm_mult)


lemma path_image_semicircle_Re_le:
  assumes "r ‚â• 0"
  shows   "path_image (part_circlepath c r (pi/2) (3/2*pi)) =
             sphere c r ‚à© {s. Re s ‚â§ Re c}"
proof -
  let ?f = "(Œªz. c + cis pi * (z - c))"
  have *: "part_circlepath c r (pi/2) (3/2*pi) = part_circlepath c r (pi + (-pi/2)) (pi + pi/2)"
    by simp
  have "path_image (part_circlepath c r (pi/2) (3/2*pi)) =
          ?f ` sphere c r ‚à© ?f ` {s. Re c ‚â§ Re s}"
    unfolding * part_circlepath_rotate_left path_image_compose path_image_semicircle_Re_ge[OF assms]
    by auto
  also have "?f ` sphere c r = sphere c r"
    by (rule sphere_rotate)
  also have "?f ` {s. Re c ‚â§ Re s} = {s. Re c ‚â• Re s}"
    by (auto simp: image_iff intro!: exI[of _ "2 * c - x" for x])
  finally show ?thesis .
qed

lemma path_image_semicircle_Im_ge:
  assumes "r ‚â• 0"
  shows   "path_image (part_circlepath c r 0 pi) =
             sphere c r ‚à© {s. Im s ‚â• Im c}"
proof -
  let ?f = "(Œªz. c + cis (pi/2) * (z - c))"
  have *: "part_circlepath c r 0 pi = part_circlepath c r (pi / 2 + (-pi/2)) (pi / 2 + pi/2)"
    by simp
  have "path_image (part_circlepath c r 0 pi) =
          ?f ` sphere c r ‚à© ?f ` {s. Re c ‚â§ Re s}"
    unfolding * part_circlepath_rotate_left path_image_compose path_image_semicircle_Re_ge[OF assms]
    by auto
  also have "?f ` sphere c r = sphere c r"
    by (rule sphere_rotate)
  also have "?f ` {s. Re c ‚â§ Re s} = {s. Im c ‚â§ Im s}"
    by (auto simp: image_iff intro!: exI[of _ "c - ùóÇ * (x - c)" for x])
  finally show ?thesis .
qed

lemma path_image_semicircle_Im_le:
  assumes "r ‚â• 0"
  shows   "path_image (part_circlepath c r pi (2 * pi)) =
             sphere c r ‚à© {s. Im s ‚â§ Im c}"
proof -
  let ?f = "(Œªz. c + cis (3*pi/2) * (z - c))"
  have *: "part_circlepath c r pi (2*pi) = part_circlepath c r (3*pi/2 + (-pi/2)) (3*pi/2 + pi/2)"
    by simp
  have "path_image (part_circlepath c r pi (2 * pi)) =
          ?f ` sphere c r ‚à© ?f ` {s. Re c ‚â§ Re s}"
    unfolding * part_circlepath_rotate_left path_image_compose path_image_semicircle_Re_ge[OF assms]
    by auto
  also have "?f ` sphere c r = sphere c r"
    by (rule sphere_rotate)
  also have "cis (3 * pi / 2) = -ùóÇ"
    using cis_mult[of pi "pi / 2"] by simp
  hence "?f ` {s. Re c ‚â§ Re s} = {s. Im c ‚â• Im s}"
    by (auto simp: image_iff intro!: exI[of _ "c + ùóÇ * (x - c)" for x])
  finally show ?thesis .
qed

lemma powr_numeral [simp]: "x ‚â• 0 ‚üπ (x::real) powr numeral y = x ^ numeral y"
  using powr_numeral[of x y] by (cases "x = 0") auto

lemma eval_fds_logderiv_zeta_real:
  assumes "x > (1 :: real)"
  shows  "(Œªp. ln (real p) / (p powr x - 1)) abs_summable_on {p. prime p}" (is ?th1)
    and  "deriv zeta (of_real x) / zeta (of_real x) =
            -of_real (‚àë‚á©ap | prime p. ln (real p) / (p powr x - 1))" (is ?th2)
proof -
  have "(Œªp. Re (of_real (ln (real p)) / (of_nat p powr of_real x - 1)))
          abs_summable_on {p. prime p}" using assms
    by (intro abs_summable_Re eval_fds_logderiv_zeta) auto
  also have "?this ‚ü∑ ?th1"
    by (intro abs_summable_on_cong) (auto simp: powr_Reals_eq)
  finally show ?th1 .
  show ?th2 using assms
    by (subst eval_fds_logderiv_zeta) (auto simp: infsetsum_of_real [symmetric] powr_Reals_eq)
qed

lemma
  fixes a b c d :: real
  assumes ab: "d * a + b ‚â• 1" and c: "c < -1" and d: "d > 0"
  defines "C ‚â° - ((ln (d * a + b) - 1 / (c + 1)) * (d * a + b) powr (c + 1) / (d * (c + 1)))"
  shows set_integrable_ln_powr_at_top:
          "(Œªx. (ln (d * x + b) * ((d * x + b) powr c))) absolutely_integrable_on {a<..}" (is ?th1)
  and   set_lebesgue_integral_ln_powr_at_top:
          "(‚à´x‚àà{a<..}. (ln (d * x + b) * ((d * x + b) powr c)) ‚àÇlborel) = C" (is ?th2)
  and   ln_powr_has_integral_at_top:
          "((Œªx. ln (d * x + b) * (d * x + b) powr c) has_integral C) {a<..}" (is ?th3)
proof -
  define f where "f = (Œªx. ln (d * x + b) * (d * x + b) powr c)"
  define F where "F = (Œªx. (ln (d * x + b) - 1 / (c + 1)) * (d * x + b) powr (c + 1) / (d * (c + 1)))"

  have *: "(F has_field_derivative f x) (at x)" "isCont f x" "f x ‚â• 0" if "x > a" for x
  proof -
    have "1 ‚â§ d * a + b" by fact
    also have "‚Ä¶ < d * x + b" using that assms
      by (intro add_strict_right_mono mult_strict_left_mono)
    finally have gt_1: "d * x + b > 1" .
    show "(F has_field_derivative f x) (at x)" "isCont f x" using ab c d gt_1
    by (auto simp: F_def f_def divide_simps intro!: derivative_eq_intros continuous_intros)
       (auto simp: algebra_simps powr_add)?
    show "f x ‚â• 0" using gt_1 by (auto simp: f_def)
  qed

  have limits: "((F ‚àò real_of_ereal) ‚§è F a) (at_right (ereal a))"
               "((F ‚àò real_of_ereal) ‚§è 0) (at_left ‚àû)"
    using c ab d unfolding ereal_tendsto_simps1 F_def  by (real_asymp; simp add: field_simps)+
  have 1: "set_integrable lborel (einterval a ‚àû) f" using ab c limits
    by (intro interval_integral_FTC_nonneg) (auto intro!: * AE_I2)
  thus 2: "f absolutely_integrable_on {a<..}"
    by (auto simp: set_integrable_def integrable_completion)
  have "(LBINT x=ereal a..‚àû. f x) = 0 - F a" using ab c limits
    by (intro interval_integral_FTC_nonneg) (auto intro!: *)
  thus 3: ?th2
    by (simp add: interval_integral_to_infinity_eq F_def f_def C_def)
  show ?th3
    using set_borel_integral_eq_integral[OF 1] 3 by (simp add: has_integral_iff f_def C_def)
qed

lemma ln_fact_conv_sum_upto: "ln (fact n) = sum_upto ln n"
  by (induction n) (auto simp: sum_upto_plus1 add.commute[of 1] ln_mult)

lemma sum_upto_ln_conv_ln_fact: "sum_upto ln x = ln (fact (nat ‚åäx‚åã))"
  by (simp add: ln_fact_conv_sum_upto sum_upto_altdef)

lemma real_of_nat_div: "real (a div b) = real_of_int ‚åäreal a / real b‚åã"
  by (subst floor_divide_of_nat_eq) auto

lemma integral_subset_negligible:
  fixes f :: "'a :: euclidean_space ‚áí 'b :: banach"
  assumes "S ‚äÜ T" "negligible (T - S)"
  shows   "integral S f = integral T f"
proof -
  have "integral T f = integral T (Œªx. if x ‚àà S then f x else 0)"
    by (rule integral_spike[of "T - S"]) (use assms in auto)
  also have "‚Ä¶ = integral (S ‚à© T) f"
    by (subst integral_restrict_Int) auto
  also have "S ‚à© T = S" using assms by auto
  finally show ?thesis ..
qed

lemma integrable_on_cong [cong]:
  assumes "‚ãÄx. x ‚àà A ‚üπ f x = g x" "A = B"
  shows   "f integrable_on A ‚ü∑ g integrable_on B"
  using has_integral_cong[of A f g, OF assms(1)] assms(2)
  by (auto simp: integrable_on_def)

lemma measurable_sum_upto [measurable]:
  fixes f :: "'a ‚áí nat ‚áí real"
  assumes [measurable]: "‚ãÄy. (Œªt. f t y) ‚àà M ‚Üí‚á©M borel"
  assumes [measurable]: "x ‚àà M ‚Üí‚á©M borel"
  shows "(Œªt. sum_upto (f t) (x t)) ‚àà M ‚Üí‚á©M borel"
proof -
  have meas: "(Œªt. set_lebesgue_integral lborel {y. y ‚â• 0 ‚àß y - real (nat ‚åäx t‚åã) ‚â§ 0} (Œªy. f t (nat ‚åày‚åâ)))
          ‚àà M ‚Üí‚á©M borel" (is "?f ‚àà _") unfolding set_lebesgue_integral_def
    by measurable
  also have "?f = (Œªt. sum_upto (f t) (x t))"
  proof
    fix t :: 'a
    show "?f t = sum_upto (f t) (x t)"
    proof (cases "x t < 1")
      case True
      hence "{y. y ‚â• 0 ‚àß y - real (nat ‚åäx t‚åã) ‚â§ 0} = {0}" by auto
      thus ?thesis using True
        by (simp add: set_integral_at_point sum_upto_altdef)
    next
      case False
      define n where "n = nat ‚åäx t‚åã"
      from False have "n > 0" by (auto simp: n_def)

      have *: "((Œªx. f t (nat ‚åàx‚åâ)) has_integral sum (f t) {0<..n}) {real 0..real n}"
        using ‚Äπn > 0‚Ä∫ by (intro nat_sum_has_integral_ceiling) auto

      have **: "(Œªx. f t (nat ‚åàx‚åâ)) absolutely_integrable_on {real 0..real n}"
      proof (rule absolutely_integrable_absolutely_integrable_ubound)
        show "(Œª_. MAX n‚àà{0..n}. ¬¶f t n¬¶) absolutely_integrable_on {real 0..real n}"
          using ‚Äπn > 0‚Ä∫ by (subst absolutely_integrable_on_iff_nonneg)
                           (auto simp: Max_ge_iff intro!: exI[of _ "f t 0"])
        show "(Œªx. f t (nat ‚åàx‚åâ)) integrable_on {real 0..real n}"
          using * by (simp add: has_integral_iff)
      next
        fix y :: real assume y: "y ‚àà {real 0..real n}"
        have "f t (nat ‚åày‚åâ) ‚â§ ¬¶f t (nat ‚åày‚åâ)¬¶"
          by simp
        also have "‚Ä¶ ‚â§ (MAX n‚àà{0..n}. ¬¶f t n¬¶)"
          using y by (intro Max.coboundedI) auto
        finally show "f t (nat ‚åày‚åâ) ‚â§ (MAX n‚àà{0..n}. ¬¶f t n¬¶)" .
      qed
      have "sum (f t) {0<..n} = (‚à´x‚àà{real 0..real n}. f t (nat ‚åàx‚åâ) ‚àÇlebesgue)"
        using has_integral_set_lebesgue[OF **] * by (simp add: has_integral_iff)
      also have "‚Ä¶ = (‚à´x‚àà{real 0..real n}. f t (nat ‚åàx‚åâ) ‚àÇlborel)"
        unfolding set_lebesgue_integral_def by (subst integral_completion) auto
      also have "{real 0..real n} = {y. 0 ‚â§ y ‚àß y - real (nat ‚åäx t‚åã) ‚â§ 0}"
        by (auto simp: n_def)
      also have "sum (f t) {0<..n} = sum_upto (f t) (x t)"
        by (simp add: sum_upto_altdef n_def)
      finally show ?thesis ..
    qed
  qed
  finally show ?thesis .
qed

end

Theory Newman_Ingham_Tauberian

(*
  File:     Newman_Ingham_Tauberian.thy
  Author:   Manuel Eberl (TU M√ºnchen)

  A proof of Newman's "analytic theorem", originally stated by Ingham
*)
section ‚ÄπIngham's Tauberian Theorem‚Ä∫
theory Newman_Ingham_Tauberian
imports
  "HOL-Real_Asymp.Real_Asymp"
  Prime_Number_Theorem_Library
begin

text ‚Äπ
  In his proof of the Prime Number Theorem, Newman~\cite{newman1998analytic} uses a Tauberian 
  theorem that was first proven by Ingham. Newman gives a nice and straightforward proof of this
  theorem based on contour integration. This section will be concerned with proving this theorem.
  
  This Tauberian theorem is probably the part of the Newman's proof of the Prime Number Theorem
  where most of the ``heavy lifting'' is done. Its purpose is to extend the summability of a 
  Dirichlet series with bounded coefficients from the region $\mathfrak{R}(s)>1$ to 
  $\mathfrak{R}(s)\geq 1$.

  In order to show it, we first require a number of auxiliary bounding lemmas.
‚Ä∫
lemma newman_ingham_aux1:
  fixes R :: real and z :: complex
  assumes R: "R > 0" and z : "norm z = R"
  shows   "norm (1 / z + z / R‚áß2) = 2 * ¬¶Re z¬¶ / R‚áß2"
proof -
  from z and R have [simp]: "z ‚â† 0" by auto
  have "1 / z + z / R‚áß2 = (R‚áß2 + z‚áß2) * (1 / R‚áß2 / z)" using R
    by (simp add: field_simps power2_eq_square)
  also have "norm ‚Ä¶ = norm (R‚áß2 + z‚áß2) / R ^ 3"
    by (simp add: numeral_3_eq_3 z norm_divide norm_mult power2_eq_square)
  also have "R‚áß2 + z‚áß2 = z * (z + cnj z)" using complex_norm_square[of z]
    by (simp add: z power2_eq_square algebra_simps)
  also have "norm ‚Ä¶ = 2 * ¬¶Re z¬¶ * R"
    by (subst complex_add_cnj) (simp_all add: z norm_mult)
  also have "‚Ä¶ / R ^ 3 = 2 * ¬¶Re z¬¶ / R‚áß2"
    using R by (simp add: field_simps numeral_3_eq_3 power2_eq_square)
  finally show ?thesis .
qed

lemma newman_ingham_aux2:
  fixes m :: nat and w z :: complex
  assumes "1 ‚â§ m" "1 ‚â§ Re w" "0 < Re z" and f: "‚ãÄn. 1 ‚â§ n ‚üπ norm (f n) ‚â§ C"
  shows "norm (‚àën=1..m. f n / n powr (w - z)) ‚â§ C * (m powr Re z) * (1 / m + 1 / Re z)"
proof -
  have [simp]: "C ‚â• 0" by (rule order.trans[OF _ f[of 1]]) auto
  have "norm (‚àën=1..m. f n / n powr (w - z)) ‚â§ (‚àën=1..m. C / n powr (1 - Re z))"
    by (rule sum_norm_le)
       (insert assms, auto simp: norm_divide norm_powr_real_powr intro!: frac_le assms powr_mono)
  also have "‚Ä¶ = C * (‚àën=1..m. n powr (Re z - 1))"
    by (subst sum_distrib_left) (simp_all add: powr_diff)
  also have "‚Ä¶ ‚â§ C * (m powr Re z * (1 / Re z + 1 / m))"
    using zeta_partial_sum_le'[of "Re z" m] assms by (intro mult_left_mono) auto
  finally show ?thesis by (simp add: mult_ac add_ac)
qed

lemma hurwitz_zeta_real_bound_aux:
  fixes a x :: real
  assumes ax: "a > 0" "x > 1"
  shows "(‚àëi. (a + real (Suc i)) powr (-x)) ‚â§ a powr (1 - x) / (x - 1)"
proof (rule decreasing_sum_le_integral, goal_cases)
  have "((Œªt. (a + t) powr -x) has_integral -(a powr (-x + 1)) / (-x + 1)) (interior {0..})"
    using powr_has_integral_at_top[of 0 a "-x"] using ax by (simp add: interior_real_atLeast)
  also have "-(a powr (- x + 1)) / (- x + 1) = a powr (1 - x) / (x - 1)"
    using ax by (simp add: field_simps)
  finally show "((Œªt. (a + t) powr -x) has_integral a powr (1 - x) / (x - 1)) {0..}"
    by (subst (asm) has_integral_interior) auto
qed (insert ax, auto intro!: powr_mono2')


text ‚Äπ
  Given a function that is analytic on some vertical line segment, we can find a rectangle
  around that line segment on which the function is also analytic.
‚Ä∫
lemma analytic_on_axis_extend:
  fixes y1 y2 x :: real
  defines "S ‚â° {z. Re z = x ‚àß Im z ‚àà {y1..y2}}"
  assumes "y1 ‚â§ y2"
  assumes "f analytic_on S"
  obtains x1 x2 :: real where "x1 < x" "x2 > x" "f analytic_on cbox (Complex x1 y1) (Complex x2 y2)"
proof -
  define C where "C = {box a b |a b z. f analytic_on box a b ‚àß z ‚àà box a b ‚àß z ‚àà S}"
  have "S = cbox (Complex x y1) (Complex x y2)"
    by (auto simp: S_def in_cbox_complex_iff)
  also have "compact ‚Ä¶" by simp
  finally have 1: "compact S" .

  have 2: "S ‚äÜ ‚ãÉC"
  proof (intro subsetI)
    fix z assume "z ‚àà S"
    from ‚Äπf analytic_on S‚Ä∫ and this obtain a b where "z ‚àà box a b" "f analytic_on box a b"
      by (blast elim: analytic_onE_box)
    with ‚Äπz ‚àà S‚Ä∫ show "z ‚àà ‚ãÉC" unfolding C_def by blast
  qed

  have 3: "open X" if "X ‚àà C" for X using that by (auto simp: C_def)
  from compactE[OF 1 2 3] obtain T where T: "T ‚äÜ C" "finite T" "S ‚äÜ ‚ãÉT"
    by blast

  define x1 where "x1 = Max (insert (x - 1) ((ŒªX. x + (Inf (Re ` X) - x) / 2) ` T))"
  define x2 where "x2 = Min (insert (x + 1) ((ŒªX. x + (Sup (Re ` X) - x) / 2) ` T))"

  have *: "x + (Inf (Re ` X) - x) / 2 < x ‚àß x + (Sup (Re ` X) - x) / 2 > x" if "X ‚àà T" for X
  proof -
    from that and T obtain a b s where [simp]: "X = box a b" and s: "s ‚àà box a b" "s ‚àà S"
      by (force simp: C_def)
    hence le: "Re a < Re b" "Im a < Im b" by (auto simp: in_box_complex_iff)
    show ?thesis using le s
      unfolding ‚ÄπX = box a b‚Ä∫ Re_image_box[OF le] Im_image_box[OF le]
      by (auto simp: S_def in_box_complex_iff)
  qed
  from * T have "x1 < x" unfolding x1_def by (subst Max_less_iff) auto
  from * T have "x2 > x" unfolding x2_def by (subst Min_gr_iff) auto

  have "f analytic_on (‚ãÉT)"
    using T by (subst analytic_on_Union) (auto simp: C_def)
  moreover have "z ‚àà ‚ãÉT" if "z ‚àà cbox (Complex x1 y1) (Complex x2 y2)" for z
  proof -
    from that have "Complex x (Im z) ‚àà S"
      by (auto simp: in_cbox_complex_iff S_def)
    with T obtain X where X: "X ‚àà T" "Complex x (Im z) ‚àà X"
      by auto
    with T obtain a b where [simp]: "X = box a b" by (auto simp: C_def)
    from X have le: "Re a < Re b" "Im a < Im b" by (auto simp: in_box_complex_iff)

    from that have "Re z ‚â§ x2" by (simp add: in_cbox_complex_iff)
    also have "‚Ä¶ ‚â§ x + (Sup (Re ` X) - x) / 2"
      unfolding x2_def by (rule Min.coboundedI)(use T X in auto)
    also have "‚Ä¶ = (x + Re b) / 2"
      using le unfolding ‚ÄπX = box a b‚Ä∫ Re_image_box[OF le] by (simp add: field_simps)
    also have "‚Ä¶ < (Re b + Re b) / 2"
      using X by (intro divide_strict_right_mono add_strict_right_mono)
                 (auto simp: in_box_complex_iff)
    also have "‚Ä¶ = Re b" by simp
    finally have [simp]: "Re z < Re b" .

    have "Re a = (Re a + Re a) / 2" by simp
    also have "‚Ä¶ < (x + Re a) / 2"
      using X by (intro divide_strict_right_mono add_strict_right_mono)
                 (auto simp: in_box_complex_iff)
    also have "‚Ä¶ = x + (Inf (Re ` X) - x) / 2"
      using le unfolding ‚ÄπX = box a b‚Ä∫ Re_image_box[OF le] by (simp add: field_simps)
    also have "‚Ä¶ ‚â§ x1" unfolding x1_def by (rule Max.coboundedI)(use T X in auto)
    also have "‚Ä¶ ‚â§ Re z" using that by (simp add: in_cbox_complex_iff)
    finally have [simp]: "Re z > Re a" .

    from X have "z ‚àà X" by (simp add: in_box_complex_iff)
    with T X show ?thesis by blast
  qed
  hence "cbox (Complex x1 y1) (Complex x2 y2) ‚äÜ ‚ãÉT" by blast
  ultimately have "f analytic_on cbox (Complex x1 y1) (Complex x2 y2)"
    by (rule analytic_on_subset)

  with ‚Äπx1 < x‚Ä∫ and ‚Äπx2 > x‚Ä∫ and that[of x1 x2] show ?thesis by blast
qed


text ‚Äπ
  We will now prove the theorem. The precise setting is this:
  Consider a Dirichlet series $F(s) = \sum a_n n^{-s}$ with bounded coefficients. Clearly,
  this converges to an analytic function $f(s)$ on $\{s\mid \mathfrak R(s)>1\}$.

  If $f(s)$ is analytic on the larger set $\{s\mid \mathfrak R(s)\geq 1\}$, $F$ converges
  to $f(s)$ for all $\mathfrak R(s) \geq 1$.

  The proof follows Newman's argument very closely, but some of the precise bounds we use
  are a bit different from his. Also, like Harrison, we choose a combination of a semicircle
  and a rectangle as our contour, whereas Newman uses a circle with a vertical cut-off. The result
  of the Residue theorem is the same in both cases, but the bounding of the contributions of the
  different parts is somewhat different.

  The reason why we picked Harrison's contour over Newman's is because we could not understand how
  his bounding of the different contributions fits to his contour, and it seems likely that this
  is also the reason why Harrison altered the contour in the first place.
‚Ä∫
lemma Newman_Ingham_1:
  fixes F :: "complex fds" and f :: "complex ‚áí complex"
  assumes coeff_bound:   "fds_nth F ‚àà O(Œª_. 1)"
  assumes f_analytic:    "f analytic_on {s. Re s ‚â• 1}"
  assumes F_conv_f:      "‚ãÄs. Re s > 1 ‚üπ eval_fds F s = f s"
  assumes w:             "Re w ‚â• 1"
  shows   "fds_converges F w" and "eval_fds F w = f w"
proof -
  ‚Äï ‚ÄπWe get a bound on our coefficients and call it ‚ÄπC‚Ä∫.‚Ä∫
  obtain C where C: "C ‚â• 1" "‚ãÄn. norm (fds_nth F n) ‚â§ C"
    using natfun_bigo_1E[OF coeff_bound, where lb = 1] by blast
  write contour_integral ("‚àÆ[_]")

  ‚Äï ‚ÄπWe show convergence directly by showing that the difference between the 
      partial sums and the limit vanishes.‚Ä∫
  have "(ŒªN. eval_fds (fds_truncate N F) w) ‚á¢ f w"
    unfolding tendsto_iff dist_norm norm_minus_commute[of "eval_fds F s" for F s]
  proof safe
    fix Œµ :: real assume Œµ: "Œµ > 0"
    ‚Äï ‚ÄπWe choose an integration radius that is big enough for the error to be sufficiently small.‚Ä∫
    define R where "R = max 1 (3 * C / Œµ)"
    have R: "R ‚â• 3 * C / Œµ" "R ‚â• 1" by (auto simp: R_def)

    ‚Äï ‚ÄπNext, we extend the analyticity of ‚Äπf (w + z)‚Ä∫ to the left of the complex plane
        within a thin rectangle that is at least as high as the circle.‚Ä∫
    obtain l where l: "l > 0"
      "(Œªz. f (w + z)) analytic_on {s. Re s > 0 ‚à® Im s ‚àà {-R-1<..<R+1} ‚àß Re s > -l}"
    proof -
      have f_analytic': "(Œªz. f (w + z)) analytic_on {s. Re s ‚â• 0}"
        by (rule analytic_on_compose_gen[OF _ f_analytic, unfolded o_def])
           (insert w, auto intro: analytic_intros)
      hence "(Œªz. f (w + z)) analytic_on {s. Re s = 0 ‚àß Im s ‚àà {-R-1..R+1}}"
        by (rule analytic_on_subset) auto
      from analytic_on_axis_extend[OF _ this] obtain x1 x2 where x12: 
        "x1 < 0" "x2 > 0" "(Œªz. f (w + z)) analytic_on cbox (Complex x1 (-R-1)) (Complex x2 (R+1))"
        using ‚ÄπR ‚â• 1‚Ä∫ by auto
      from this(3) have "(Œªz. f (w + z)) analytic_on {s. Re s ‚àà {x1..0} ‚àß Im s ‚àà {-R-1..R+1}}"
        by (rule analytic_on_subset) (insert x12, auto simp: in_cbox_complex_iff)
      with f_analytic' have "(Œªz. f (w + z)) analytic_on
                               ({s. Re s ‚â• 0} ‚à™ {s. Re s ‚àà {x1..0} ‚àß Im s ‚àà {-R-1..R+1}})"
        by (subst analytic_on_Un) auto
      hence "(Œªz. f (w + z)) analytic_on {s. Re s > 0 ‚à® Im s ‚àà {-R-1<..<R+1} ‚àß Re s > x1}"
        by (rule analytic_on_subset) auto
      with ‚Äπx1 < 0‚Ä∫ and that[of "-x1"] show ?thesis by auto
    qed

    ‚Äï ‚ÄπThe function ‚Äπf (w + z)‚Ä∫ is now analytic on the open box $(-l; R+1) + i(-R+1; R+1)$.
        We call this region ‚ÄπX‚Ä∫.‚Ä∫
    define X where "X = box (Complex (-l) (-R-1)) (Complex (R+1) (R+1))"
    have [simp, intro]: "open X" "convex X" by (simp_all add: X_def open_box)
    from R l have [simp]: "0 ‚àà X" by (auto simp: X_def in_box_complex_iff)
    have analytic: "(Œªz. f (w + z)) analytic_on X"
      by (rule analytic_on_subset[OF l(2)]) (auto simp: X_def in_box_complex_iff)
    note f_analytic' [analytic_intros] = analytic_on_compose_gen[OF _ analytic, unfolded o_def]
    note f_holo [holomorphic_intros] =
      holomorphic_on_compose_gen[OF _ analytic_imp_holomorphic[OF analytic], unfolded o_def]
    note f_cont [continuous_intros] = continuous_on_compose2[OF 
      holomorphic_on_imp_continuous_on[OF analytic_imp_holomorphic[OF analytic]]]

    ‚Äï ‚ÄπWe now pick a smaller closed box ‚ÄπX'‚Ä∫ inside the big open box ‚ÄπX‚Ä∫. This is because
        we need a compact set for the next step. our integration path still lies entirely
        within ‚ÄπX'‚Ä∫, and since ‚ÄπX'‚Ä∫ is compact, ‚Äπf (w + z)‚Ä∫ is bounded on it,
        so we obtain such a bound and call it ‚ÄπM‚Ä∫.‚Ä∫
    define Œ¥ where "Œ¥ = min (1/2) (l/2)"
    from l have Œ¥: "Œ¥ > 0" "Œ¥ ‚â§ 1/2" "Œ¥ < l" by (auto simp: Œ¥_def)
    define X' where "X' = cbox (Complex (-Œ¥) (-R)) (Complex R R)"
    have "X' ‚äÜ X" unfolding X'_def X_def using l(1) R Œ¥
      by (intro subset_box_imp) (auto simp: Basis_complex_def)
    have [intro]: "compact X'" by (simp add: X'_def)
    moreover have "continuous_on X' (Œªz. f (w + z))"
      using w ‚ÄπX' ‚äÜ X‚Ä∫ by (auto intro!: continuous_intros)
    ultimately obtain M where M: "M ‚â• 0" "‚ãÄz. z ‚àà X' ‚üπ norm (f (w + z)) ‚â§ M"
      using continuous_on_compact_bound by blast

    ‚Äï ‚ÄπOur objective is now to show that the difference between the ‚ÄπN‚Ä∫-th partial sum
        and the limit is below a certain bound (depending on ‚ÄπN‚Ä∫) which tends to ‚Äπ0‚Ä∫ 
        for ‚ÄπN ‚Üí ‚àû‚Ä∫. We use the following bound:‚Ä∫
    define bound where
      "bound = (ŒªN::nat. (2*C/R + C/N + 3*M / (pi*R*ln N) + 3*R*M / (Œ¥*pi * N powr Œ¥)))"
    have "2 * C / R < Œµ" using M(1) R C(1) Œ¥(1) Œµ
      by (auto simp: field_simps)
    ‚Äï ‚ÄπEvidently this is below @{term Œµ} for sufficiently large ‚ÄπN‚Ä∫.‚Ä∫
    hence "eventually (ŒªN::nat. bound N < Œµ) at_top"
      using M(1) R C(1) Œ¥(1) Œµ unfolding bound_def by real_asymp

    ‚Äï ‚ÄπIt now only remains to show that the difference is indeed less than the claimed bound.‚Ä∫
    thus "eventually (ŒªN. norm (f w - eval_fds (fds_truncate N F) w) < Œµ) at_top"
      using eventually_gt_at_top[of 1]
    proof eventually_elim
      case (elim N)
      note N = this

      ‚Äï ‚ÄπLike Harrison (and unlike Newman), our integration path ‚ÄπŒì‚Ä∫ consists of a semicircle ‚ÄπA‚Ä∫
          of radius ‚ÄπR‚Ä∫ in the right-halfplane and a box of width ‚ÄπŒ¥‚Ä∫ and height ‚Äπ2R‚Ä∫ on
          the left halfplane. The latter consists of three straight lines, which we call ‚ÄπB1‚Ä∫
          to ‚ÄπB3‚Ä∫.‚Ä∫
      define A where "A = part_circlepath 0 R (-pi/2) (pi/2)"
      define B2 where "B2 = linepath (Complex (-Œ¥) R) (Complex (-Œ¥) (-R))"
      define B1 where "B1 = linepath (R * ùóÇ) (R * ùóÇ - Œ¥)"
      define B3 where "B3 = linepath (-R * ùóÇ - Œ¥) (-R * ùóÇ)"
      define Œì where "Œì = A +++ B1 +++ B2 +++ B3"

      ‚Äï ‚ÄπWe first need to show some basic facts about the geometry of our integration path.‚Ä∫
      have [simp, intro]:
        "path A" "path B1" "path B3" "path B2"
        "valid_path A" "valid_path B1" "valid_path B3" "valid_path B2"
        "arc A" "arc B1" "arc B3" "arc B2"
        "pathstart A = -ùóÇ * R" "pathfinish A = ùóÇ * R"
        "pathstart B1 = ùóÇ * R" "pathfinish B1 = R * ùóÇ - Œ¥"
        "pathstart B3 = -R * ùóÇ - Œ¥" "pathfinish B3 = -ùóÇ * R"
        "pathstart B2 = R * ùóÇ - Œ¥" "pathfinish B2 = -R * ùóÇ - Œ¥" using R Œ¥
        by (simp_all add: A_def B1_def B3_def exp_eq_polar B2_def Complex_eq arc_part_circlepath)
      hence [simp, intro]: "valid_path Œì" 
        by (simp add: Œì_def A_def B1_def B3_def B2_def exp_eq_polar Complex_eq)
      hence [simp, intro]: "path Œì" using valid_path_imp_path by blast
      have [simp]: "pathfinish Œì = pathstart Œì" by (simp add: Œì_def exp_eq_polar)
    
      have image_B2: "path_image B2 = {s. Re s = -Œ¥ ‚àß Im s ‚àà {-R..R}}"
        using R by (auto simp: closed_segment_same_Re closed_segment_eq_real_ivl B2_def)
      have image_B1: "path_image B1 = {s. Re s ‚àà {-Œ¥..0} ‚àß Im s = R}"
       and image_B3: "path_image B3 = {s. Re s ‚àà {-Œ¥..0} ‚àß Im s = -R}"
        using Œ¥ by (auto simp: B1_def B3_def closed_segment_same_Im closed_segment_eq_real_ivl)
      have image_A: "path_image A = {s. Re s ‚â• 0 ‚àß norm s = R}"
        unfolding A_def using R by (subst path_image_semicircle_Re_ge) auto
      also have "z ‚àà ‚Ä¶ ‚ü∂ z ‚àà X' - {0}" for z
        using complex_Re_le_cmod[of z] abs_Im_le_cmod[of z] Œ¥ R
        by (auto simp: X'_def in_cbox_complex_iff)
      hence "{s. Re s ‚â• 0 ‚àß norm s = R} ‚äÜ X' - {0}" by auto
      finally have "path_image B2 ‚äÜ X' - {0}" "path_image A ‚äÜ X' - {0}"
           "path_image B1 ‚äÜ X' - {0}" "path_image B3 ‚äÜ X' - {0}" using ‚ÄπŒ¥ > 0‚Ä∫
        by (auto simp: X'_def in_cbox_complex_iff image_B2 image_B1 image_B3)
      note path_images = this ‚ÄπX' ‚äÜ X‚Ä∫

      ‚Äï ‚Äπ‚ÄπŒì‚Ä∫ is a simple path, which, combined with its simple geometric shape, makes
          reasoning about its winding numbers trivial.‚Ä∫
      from R have "simple_path A" unfolding A_def
        by (subst simple_path_part_circlepath) auto
      have "simple_path Œì" unfolding Œì_def
      proof (intro simple_path_join_loop subsetI arc_join, goal_cases)
        fix z assume z: "z ‚àà path_image A ‚à© path_image (B1 +++ B2 +++ B3)"
        with image_A have "Re z ‚â• 0" "norm z = R" by auto
        with z R Œ¥ show "z ‚àà {pathstart A, pathstart (B1 +++ B2 +++ B3)}"
          by (auto simp: path_image_join image_B1 image_B2 image_B3 complex_eq_iff)
      qed (insert R, auto simp: image_B1 image_B3 path_image_join image_B2 complex_eq_iff)
    
      ‚Äï ‚ÄπWe define the integrands in the same fashion as Newman:‚Ä∫
      define g where "g = (Œªz::complex. f (w + z) * N powr z * (1 / z + z / R‚áß2))"
      define S where "S = eval_fds (fds_truncate N F)"
      define g_S where "g_S = (Œªz::complex. S (w + z) * N powr z * (1 / z + z / R‚áß2))"
      define rem where "rem = (Œªz::complex. f z - S z)"
      define g_rem where "g_rem = (Œªz::complex. rem (w + z) * N powr z * (1 / z + z / R‚áß2))"

      have g_holo: "g holomorphic_on X - {0}" unfolding g_def
        by (auto intro!: holomorphic_intros analytic_imp_holomorphic'[OF analytic])

      have rem_altdef: "rem z = eval_fds (fds_remainder N F) z" if "Re z > 1" for z
      proof -
      have abscissa: "abs_conv_abscissa F ‚â§ 1"
        using assms by (intro bounded_coeffs_imp_abs_conv_abscissa_le_1)
                       (simp_all add: natfun_bigo_iff_Bseq)
        from assms and that have "f z = eval_fds F z" by auto
        also have "F = fds_truncate N F + fds_remainder N F" 
          by (rule fds_truncate_plus_remainder [symmetric])
        also from that have "eval_fds ‚Ä¶ z = S z + eval_fds (fds_remainder N F) z" unfolding S_def
          by (subst eval_fds_add) (auto intro!: fds_abs_converges_imp_converges 
                                                fds_abs_converges[OF le_less_trans[OF abscissa]])
        finally show ?thesis by (simp add: rem_def)
      qed

      ‚Äï ‚ÄπWe now come to the first application of the residue theorem along the path ‚ÄπŒì‚Ä∫:‚Ä∫
      have "‚àÆ[Œì] g = 2 * pi * ùóÇ * winding_number Œì 0 * residue g 0"
      proof (subst Residue_theorem)
        show "g holomorphic_on X - {0}" by fact
        show "path_image Œì ‚äÜ X - {0}" using path_images
          by (auto simp: Œì_def path_image_join)
        thus "‚àÄz. z ‚àâ X ‚ü∂ winding_number Œì z = 0"
          by (auto intro!: simply_connected_imp_winding_number_zero[of X]
                           convex_imp_simply_connected)
      qed (insert path_images, auto intro: convex_connected)
      also have "winding_number Œì 0 = 1"
      proof (rule simple_closed_path_winding_number_pos)
        from R Œ¥ have "‚àÄg‚àà{A, B1, B2, B3}. Re (winding_number g 0) > 0"
          unfolding A_def B1_def B2_def B3_def
          by (auto intro!: winding_number_linepath_pos_lt winding_number_part_circlepath_pos_less)
        hence "valid_path Œì ‚àß 0 ‚àâ path_image Œì ‚àß Re (winding_number Œì 0) > 0"
          unfolding Œì_def using path_images(1-4) by (intro winding_number_join_pos_combined') auto
        thus "Re (winding_number Œì 0) > 0" by simp
      qed (insert path_images ‚Äπsimple_path Œì‚Ä∫, auto simp: Œì_def path_image_join)
      also have "residue g 0 = f w"
      proof -
        have "g = (Œªz::complex. f (w + z) * N powr z * (1 + z‚áß2 / R‚áß2) / z)"
          by (auto simp: g_def divide_simps fun_eq_iff power2_eq_square
                   simp del: div_mult_self3 div_mult_self4 div_mult_self2 div_mult_self1)
        moreover from N have "residue ‚Ä¶ 0 = f w"
          by (subst residue_simple'[of X])
             (auto intro!: holomorphic_intros analytic_imp_holomorphic[OF analytic])
        ultimately show ?thesis by (simp only:)
      qed
      finally have "2 * pi * ùóÇ * f w = ‚àÆ[Œì] g" by simp
      also have "‚Ä¶ = ‚àÆ[A] g + ‚àÆ[B2] g + ‚àÆ[B1] g + ‚àÆ[B3] g" unfolding Œì_def
        by (subst contour_integral_join, (insert path_images,
            auto intro!: contour_integral_join contour_integrable_holomorphic_simple g_holo)[4])+
           (simp_all add: add_ac)
      finally have integral1: "2 * pi * ùóÇ * f w = ‚àÆ[A] g + ‚àÆ[B2] g + ‚àÆ[B1] g + ‚àÆ[B3] g" .

      ‚Äï ‚ÄπNext, we apply the residue theorem along a circle of radius ‚ÄπR‚Ä∫ to another
          integrand that is related to the partial sum:‚Ä∫
      have "‚àÆ[circlepath 0 R] g_S = 2 * pi * ùóÇ * residue g_S 0"
      proof (subst Residue_theorem)
        show "g_S holomorphic_on UNIV - {0}"
          by (auto simp: g_S_def S_def intro!: holomorphic_intros)
      qed (insert R, auto simp: winding_number_circlepath_centre)
      also have "residue g_S 0 = S w"
      proof -
        have "g_S = (Œªz::complex. S (w + z) * N powr z * (1 + z‚áß2 / R‚áß2) / z)"
          by (auto simp: g_S_def divide_simps fun_eq_iff power2_eq_square
                   simp del: div_mult_self3 div_mult_self4 div_mult_self2 div_mult_self1)
        moreover from N have "residue ‚Ä¶ 0 = S w"
          by (subst residue_simple'[of X])
             (auto intro!: holomorphic_intros simp: S_def)
        ultimately show ?thesis by (simp only:)
      qed
      finally have "2 * pi * ùóÇ * S w = ‚àÆ[circlepath 0 R] g_S" ..

      ‚Äï ‚ÄπWe split this integral into integrals along two semicircles in the left and right
          half-plane, respectively:‚Ä∫
      also have "‚Ä¶ = ‚àÆ[part_circlepath 0 R (-pi/2) (3*pi/2)] g_S"
      proof (rule Cauchy_theorem_homotopic_loops)
        show "homotopic_loops (-{0}) (circlepath 0 R)
                (part_circlepath 0 R (- pi / 2) (3 * pi / 2))" unfolding circlepath_def using R
          by (intro homotopic_loops_part_circlepath[where k = 1]) auto
      qed (auto simp: g_S_def S_def intro!: holomorphic_intros)
      also have "‚Ä¶ = ‚àÆ[A +++ -A] g_S"
      proof (rule Cauchy_theorem_homotopic_paths)
        have *: "-A = part_circlepath 0 R (pi/2) (3*pi/2)" unfolding A_def
          by (intro part_circlepath_mirror[where k = 0]) auto
        from R show "homotopic_paths (-{0}) (part_circlepath 0 R (-pi/2) (3*pi/2)) (A +++ -A)"
          unfolding * unfolding A_def
          by (intro homotopic_paths_part_circlepath) (auto dest!: in_path_image_part_circlepath)
      qed (auto simp: g_S_def S_def A_def exp_eq_polar intro!: holomorphic_intros)
      also have "‚Ä¶ = ‚àÆ[A] g_S + ‚àÆ[-A] g_S" using R
        by (intro contour_integral_join contour_integrable_holomorphic_simple[of _ "-{0}"])
           (auto simp: A_def g_S_def S_def path_image_mirror dest!: in_path_image_part_circlepath
                 intro!: holomorphic_intros)
      also have "‚àÆ[-A] g_S = -‚àÆ[A] (Œªx. g_S (-x))"
        by (simp add: A_def contour_integral_mirror contour_integral_neg)
      finally have integral2: "2 * pi * ùóÇ * S w = ‚àÆ[A] g_S - ‚àÆ[A] (Œªx. g_S (-x))"
        by simp

      ‚Äï ‚ÄπNext, we show a small bounding lemma that we will need for the final estimate:‚Ä∫
      have circle_bound: "norm (1 / z + z / R‚áß2) ‚â§ 2 / R" if [simp]: "norm z = R" for z :: complex
      proof -
        have "norm (1 / z + z / R‚áß2) ‚â§ 1 / R + 1 / R"
          by (intro order.trans[OF norm_triangle_ineq] add_mono)
             (insert R, simp_all add: norm_divide norm_mult power2_eq_square)
        thus ?thesis by simp
      qed

      ‚Äï ‚ÄπThe next bound differs somewhat from Newman's, but it works just as well.
          Its purpose is to bound the contribution of the two short horizontal line segments.‚Ä∫
      have B12_bound: "norm (integral {- Œ¥..0} (Œªx. g (x + R' * ùóÇ))) ‚â§ 3 * M / R / ln N"
        (is "?I ‚â§ _") if "¬¶R'¬¶ = R" for R' 
      proof -
        have "?I ‚â§ integral {-Œ¥..0} (Œªx. 3 * M / R * N powr x)"
        proof (rule integral_norm_bound_integral)
          fix x assume x: "x ‚àà {-Œ¥..0}"
          define z where "z = x + ùóÇ * R'"
          from R that have [simp]: "z ‚â† 0" "Re z = x" "Im z = R'"
            by (auto simp: z_def complex_eq_iff)
          from x R that have "z ‚àà X'" by (auto simp: z_def X'_def in_cbox_complex_iff)
          from x R that have "norm z ‚â§ Œ¥ + R"
            by (intro order.trans[OF cmod_le add_mono]) auto
      
          hence "norm (1 / z + z / R‚áß2) ‚â§ 1 / R + (Œ¥ / R + 1) / R"
            using R that abs_Im_le_cmod[of z]
            by (intro order.trans[OF norm_triangle_ineq add_mono])
               (auto simp: norm_divide norm_mult power2_eq_square field_simps )
          also have "Œ¥ / R ‚â§ 1" using Œ¥ R by auto
          finally have "norm (1 / z + z / R‚áß2) ‚â§ 3 / R"
            using R by (simp add: divide_right_mono)
          hence "norm (g z) ‚â§ M * N powr x * (3 / R)"
            unfolding g_def norm_mult using ‚ÄπM ‚â• 0‚Ä∫ ‚Äπz ‚àà X'‚Ä∫
            by (intro mult_mono mult_nonneg_nonneg M) (auto simp: norm_powr_real_powr)
          thus "norm (g (x + R' * ùóÇ)) ‚â§ 3 * M / R * N powr x" by (simp add: mult_ac z_def)
        qed (insert N R l that Œ¥, auto intro!: integrable_continuous_real continuous_intros
                                  simp: g_def X_def complex_eq_iff in_box_complex_iff)
        also have "‚Ä¶ = 3 * M / R * integral {-Œ¥..0} (Œªx. N powr x)" by simp
        also have "((Œªx. N powr x) has_integral (N powr 0 / ln N - N powr (-Œ¥) / ln N)) {-Œ¥..0}"
          using Œ¥ N
          by (intro fundamental_theorem_of_calculus)
             (auto simp: has_field_derivative_iff_has_vector_derivative [symmetric] powr_def
                   intro!: derivative_eq_intros)
        hence "integral {-Œ¥..0} (Œªx. N powr x) = 1 / ln (real N) - real N powr - Œ¥ / ln (real N)"
          using N by (simp add: has_integral_iff)
        also have "‚Ä¶ ‚â§ 1 / ln (real N)" using N by simp
        finally show ?thesis using M R by (simp add: mult_left_mono divide_right_mono)
      qed

      ‚Äï ‚ÄπWe combine the two results from the residue theorem and obtain an integral
          representation of the difference between the partial sums and the limit:‚Ä∫
      have "2 * pi * ùóÇ * (f w - S w) =
              ‚àÆ[A] g - ‚àÆ[A] g_S + ‚àÆ[A] (Œªx. g_S (-x)) + ‚àÆ[B1] g + ‚àÆ[B3] g + ‚àÆ[B2] g"
        unfolding ring_distribs integral1 integral2 by (simp add: algebra_simps)
      also have "‚àÆ[A] g - ‚àÆ[A] g_S = ‚àÆ[A] (Œªx. g x - g_S x)" using path_images
        by (intro contour_integral_diff [symmetric])
           (auto intro!: contour_integrable_holomorphic_simple[of _ "X - {0}"] holomorphic_intros
                 simp: g_S_def g_holo S_def)
      also have "‚Ä¶ = ‚àÆ[A] g_rem"
        by (simp add: g_rem_def g_def g_S_def algebra_simps rem_def)
      finally have "2 * pi * ùóÇ * (f w - S w) =
                      ‚àÆ[A] g_rem + ‚àÆ[A] (Œªx. g_S (- x)) + ‚àÆ[B1] g + ‚àÆ[B3] g + ‚àÆ[B2] g" .

      ‚Äï ‚ÄπWe now bound each of these integrals individually:‚Ä∫
      also have "norm ‚Ä¶ ‚â§ 2 * C * pi / R  +  2 * C * pi * (1 / N + 1 / R)  +  3 * M / R / ln N  +
                             3 * M / R / ln N  +  6 * R * M * N powr (-Œ¥) / Œ¥"
      proof (rule order.trans[OF norm_triangle_ineq] add_mono)+
        have "‚àÆ[B1] g = -‚àÆ[reversepath B1] g" by (simp add: contour_integral_reversepath)
        also have "‚àÆ[reversepath B1] g = integral {-Œ¥..0} (Œªx. g (x + R * ùóÇ))"
          unfolding B1_def reversepath_linepath using Œ¥
          by (subst contour_integral_linepath_same_Im) auto
        also have "norm (-‚Ä¶) = norm ‚Ä¶" by simp
        also have "‚Ä¶ ‚â§ 3 * M / R / ln N" using R by (intro B12_bound) auto
        finally show "norm (‚àÆ[B1] g) ‚â§ ‚Ä¶" .
      next
        have "‚àÆ[B3] g = integral {-Œ¥..0} (Œªx. g (x + (-R) * ùóÇ))" unfolding B3_def using Œ¥
          by (subst contour_integral_linepath_same_Im) auto
        also have "norm ‚Ä¶ ‚â§ 3 * M / R / ln N" using R by (intro B12_bound) auto
        finally show "norm (‚àÆ[B3] g) ‚â§ ‚Ä¶" .
      next
        have "norm (‚àÆ[B2] g) ‚â§ M * N powr (-Œ¥) * (3 / Œ¥) *
                norm (Complex (- Œ¥) (-R) - Complex (- Œ¥) R)" unfolding B2_def
        proof ((rule contour_integral_bound_linepath; (fold B2_def)?), goal_cases)
          case (3 z)
          from 3 Œ¥ R have [simp]: "z ‚â† 0" and Re_z: "Re z = -Œ¥" and Im_z: "Im z ‚àà {-R..R}"
            by (auto simp: closed_segment_same_Re closed_segment_eq_real_ivl)
          from 3 have "z ‚àà X'" using R Œ¥ path_images by (auto simp: B2_def)
          from 3 Œ¥ R have "norm z ‚â§ sqrt (Œ¥^2 + R^2)" unfolding cmod_def using Re_z Im_z
            by (intro real_sqrt_le_mono add_mono) (auto simp: power2_le_iff_abs_le)
          from power_mono[OF this, of 2] have norm_sqr: "norm z ^ 2 ‚â§ Œ¥‚áß2 + R‚áß2" by simp
    
          have "norm (1 / z + z / R‚áß2) ‚â§ (1 + (norm z)‚áß2 / R‚áß2) / Œ¥"
            unfolding add_divide_distrib using Œ¥ R abs_Re_le_cmod[of z]
            by (intro order.trans[OF norm_triangle_ineq] add_mono)
               (auto simp: norm_divide norm_mult field_simps power2_eq_square Re_z)
          also have "‚Ä¶ ‚â§ (1 + (1 + Œ¥‚áß2 / R‚áß2)) / Œ¥" using Œ¥ R ‚Äπz ‚àà X'‚Ä∫ norm_sqr unfolding X'_def
            by (intro divide_right_mono add_left_mono)
               (auto simp: field_simps in_cbox_complex_iff intro!: power_mono)
          also have "Œ¥‚áß2 / R‚áß2 ‚â§ 1"
            using Œ¥ R by (auto simp: field_simps intro!: power_mono)
          finally have "norm (1 / z + z / R‚áß2) ‚â§ 3 / Œ¥" using Œ¥ by(simp add: divide_right_mono)
          with ‚Äπz ‚àà X'‚Ä∫ show "norm (g z) ‚â§ M * N powr (-Œ¥) * (3 / Œ¥)" unfolding g_def norm_mult
            by (intro mult_mono mult_nonneg_nonneg M) (auto simp: norm_powr_real_powr Re_z)
        qed (insert path_images M Œ¥, auto intro!: contour_integrable_holomorphic_simple[OF g_holo])
        thus "norm (‚àÆ[B2] g) ‚â§ 6 * R * M * N powr (-Œ¥) / Œ¥"
          using R by (simp add: field_simps cmod_def real_sqrt_mult)
      next
        have "norm (‚àÆ[A] (Œªx. g_S (- x))) ‚â§ (2 * C / (real N * R) + 2 * C / R‚áß2) * 
                                R * ((pi/2) - (-pi/2))" unfolding A_def
        proof ((rule contour_integral_bound_part_circlepath_strong[where k = "{R * ùóÇ, -R*ùóÇ}"];
               (fold A_def)?), goal_cases)
          case (6 z)
          hence [simp]: "z ‚â† 0" and "norm z = R" using R
            by (auto simp: A_def dest!: in_path_image_part_circlepath)
          from 6 have "Re z ‚â† 0"
            using ‚Äπnorm z = R‚Ä∫ by (auto simp: cmod_def abs_if complex_eq_iff split: if_splits)
          with 6 have "Re z > 0" using image_A by auto
          have "S (w - z) = (‚àëk = 1..N. fds_nth F k / of_nat k powr (w - z))"
            by (simp add: S_def eval_fds_truncate)
          also have "norm ‚Ä¶ ‚â§ C * N powr Re z * (1 / N + 1 / Re z)"
            using ‚ÄπRe z > 0‚Ä∫ w N by (intro newman_ingham_aux2 C) auto
          finally have "norm (S (w - z)) ‚â§ ‚Ä¶" .
          hence "norm (g_S (-z)) ‚â§
                   (C * N powr (Re z) * (1 / N + 1 / Re z)) * N powr (-Re z) * (2 * Re z / R‚áß2)"
            unfolding g_S_def norm_mult 
            using newman_ingham_aux1[OF _ ‚Äπnorm z = R‚Ä∫] ‚ÄπRe z > 0‚Ä∫ ‚ÄπC ‚â• 1‚Ä∫ R
            by (intro mult_mono mult_nonneg_nonneg circle_bound)
               (auto simp: norm_powr_real_powr norm_uminus_minus)
          also have "‚Ä¶ = 2 * C * (Re z / N + 1) / R‚áß2" using R N ‚ÄπRe z > 0‚Ä∫
            by (simp add: powr_minus algebra_simps)
          also have "‚Ä¶ ‚â§ 2 * C / (N * R) + 2 * C / R‚áß2" unfolding add_divide_distrib ring_distribs
            using R N abs_Re_le_cmod[of z] ‚Äπnorm z = R‚Ä∫ ‚ÄπRe z > 0‚Ä∫ ‚ÄπC ‚â• 1‚Ä∫
            by (intro add_mono) (auto simp: power2_eq_square field_simps mult_mono)
          finally show ?case .
        qed (insert R N image_A C, auto intro!: contour_integrable_holomorphic_simple[of _ "-{0}"]
                                                holomorphic_intros simp: g_S_def S_def)
        also have "‚Ä¶ = 2 * C * pi * (1 / N + 1 / R)" using R N
          by (simp add: power2_eq_square field_simps)
        finally show "norm (‚àÆ[A] (Œªx. g_S (- x))) ‚â§ ‚Ä¶" .
      next
        have "norm (‚àÆ[A] g_rem) ‚â§ (2 * C / R‚áß2) * R * ((pi/2) - (-pi/2))" unfolding A_def
        proof ((rule contour_integral_bound_part_circlepath_strong[where k = "{R * ùóÇ, -R*ùóÇ}"];
               (fold A_def)?), goal_cases)
          case (6 z)
          hence [simp]: "z ‚â† 0" and "norm z = R" using R
            by (auto simp: A_def dest!: in_path_image_part_circlepath)
          from 6 have "Re z ‚â† 0"
            using ‚Äπnorm z = R‚Ä∫ by (auto simp: cmod_def abs_if complex_eq_iff split: if_splits)
          with 6 have "Re z > 0" using image_A by auto
    
          have summable: "summable (Œªn. C * (1 / (Suc n + N) powr (Re w + Re z)))"
            using summable_hurwitz_zeta_real[of "Re w + Re z" "Suc N"] ‚ÄπRe z > 0‚Ä∫ w
            unfolding powr_minus by (intro summable_mult) (auto simp: field_simps)
          have "rem (w + z) = (‚àën. fds_nth F (Suc n + N) / (Suc n + N) powr (w + z))"
            using ‚ÄπRe z > 0‚Ä∫ w by (simp add: rem_altdef eval_fds_remainder)
          also have "norm ‚Ä¶ ‚â§ (‚àën. C / (Suc n + N) powr Re (w + z))" using summable
            by (intro norm_suminf_le)
               (auto simp: norm_divide norm_powr_real_powr intro!: divide_right_mono C)
          also have "‚Ä¶ = (‚àën. C * (Suc n + N) powr -Re (w + z))"
            unfolding powr_minus by (simp add: field_simps)
          also have "‚Ä¶ = C * (‚àën. (Suc n + N) powr -Re (w + z))"
            using summable_hurwitz_zeta_real[of "Re w + Re z" "Suc N"] ‚ÄπRe z > 0‚Ä∫ w
            by (subst suminf_mult) (auto simp: add_ac)
          also have "(‚àën. (Suc n + N) powr -Re (w + z)) ‚â§
                       N powr (1 - Re (w + z)) / (Re (w + z) - 1)"
            using ‚ÄπRe z > 0‚Ä∫ w N hurwitz_zeta_real_bound_aux[of N "Re (w + z)"]
            by (auto simp: add_ac)
          also have "‚Ä¶ ‚â§ N powr -Re z / Re z"
            using w N ‚ÄπRe z > 0‚Ä∫ by (intro frac_le powr_mono) auto
          finally have "norm (rem (w + z)) ‚â§ C / (Re z * N powr Re z)"
            using C by (simp add: mult_left_mono mult_right_mono powr_minus field_simps)
          hence "norm (g_rem z) ‚â§ (C / (Re z * N powr Re z)) * N powr (Re z) * (2 * Re z / R‚áß2)"
            unfolding g_rem_def norm_mult
            using newman_ingham_aux1[OF _ ‚Äπnorm z = R‚Ä∫] R ‚ÄπRe z > 0‚Ä∫ C
            by (intro mult_mono mult_nonneg_nonneg circle_bound)
               (auto simp: norm_powr_real_powr norm_uminus_minus)
          also have "‚Ä¶ = 2 * C / R‚áß2" using R N ‚ÄπRe z > 0‚Ä∫
            by (simp add: powr_minus field_simps)
          finally show ?case .
        next
          show "g_rem contour_integrable_on A" using path_images
            by (auto simp: g_rem_def rem_def S_def
                     intro!: contour_integrable_holomorphic_simple[of _ "X-{0}"] holomorphic_intros)
        qed (insert R N C, auto)
        also have "(2 * C / R‚áß2) * R * ((pi/2) - (-pi/2)) = 2 * C * pi / R"
          using R by (simp add: power2_eq_square field_simps)
        finally show "norm (‚àÆ[A] g_rem) ‚â§ ‚Ä¶" .
      qed
      also have "‚Ä¶ = 4*C*pi/R + 2*C*pi/N + 6*M/R / ln N + 6*R*M*N powr - Œ¥ / Œ¥"
        by (simp add: algebra_simps)
      also have "‚Ä¶ = 2*pi * (2*C/R + C/N + 3*M / (pi*R*ln N) + 3*R*M / (Œ¥*pi * N powr Œ¥))"
        by (simp add: field_simps powr_minus )
      also have "norm (2 * pi * ùóÇ * (f w - S w)) = 2 * pi * norm (f w - S w)"
        by (simp add: norm_mult)
      finally have "norm (f w - S w) ‚â§ bound N" by (simp add: bound_def)
      also have "bound N < Œµ" by fact
      finally show "norm (f w - S w) < Œµ" .
    qed
  qed
  thus "fds_converges F w"
    by (auto simp: fds_converges_altdef2 intro: convergentI)
  thus "eval_fds F w = f w"
    using ‚Äπ(ŒªN. eval_fds (fds_truncate N F) w) ‚á¢ f w‚Ä∫
    by (intro tendsto_unique[OF _ tendsto_eval_fds_truncate]) auto
qed

text ‚Äπ
  The theorem generalises in a trivial way; we can replace the requirement that the
  coefficients of $f(s)$ be $O(1)$ by $O(n^{\sigma-1})$ for some $\sigma\in\mathbb{R}$, then
  $f(s)$ converges for $\mathfrak{R}(s)>\sigma$. If it can be analytically continued to
  $\mathfrak{R}(s)\geq\sigma$, it is also convergent there.
‚Ä∫
theorem Newman_Ingham:
  fixes F :: "complex fds" and f :: "complex ‚áí complex"
  assumes coeff_bound:   "fds_nth F ‚àà O(Œªn. n powr of_real (œÉ - 1))"
  assumes f_analytic:    "f analytic_on {s. Re s ‚â• œÉ}"
  assumes F_conv_f:      "‚ãÄs. Re s > œÉ ‚üπ eval_fds F s = f s"
  assumes w:             "Re w ‚â• œÉ"
  shows   "fds_converges F w" and "eval_fds F w = f w"
proof -
  define F' where "F' = fds_shift (-of_real (œÉ - 1)) F"
  define f' where "f' = f ‚àò (Œªs. s + of_real (œÉ - 1))"

  have "fds_nth F' = (Œªn. fds_nth F n * of_nat n powr -of_real(œÉ - 1))"
    by (auto simp: fun_eq_iff F'_def)
  also have "‚Ä¶ ‚àà O(Œªn. of_nat n powr of_real (œÉ - 1) * of_nat n powr -of_real(œÉ - 1))"
    by (intro landau_o.big.mult_right assms)
  also have "(Œªn. of_nat n powr of_real (œÉ - 1) * of_nat n powr -of_real (œÉ - 1)) ‚àà Œò(Œª_. 1)"
    by (intro bigthetaI_cong eventually_mono[OF eventually_gt_at_top[of 0]])
       (auto simp: powr_minus powr_diff)
  finally have bigo: "fds_nth F' ‚àà O(Œª_. 1)" .

  from f_analytic have analytic: "f' analytic_on {s. Re s ‚â• 1}" unfolding f'_def
    by (intro analytic_on_compose_gen[OF _ f_analytic]) (auto intro!: analytic_intros)

  have F'_f: "eval_fds F' s = f' s" if "Re s > 1" for s
    using assms that by (auto simp: F'_def f'_def algebra_simps)

  have w': "1 ‚â§ Re (w - of_real (œÉ - 1))"
    using w by simp
  
  have 1: "fds_converges F' (w - of_real (œÉ - 1))"
    using bigo analytic F'_f w' by (rule Newman_Ingham_1)
  thus "fds_converges F w" by (auto simp: F'_def)

  have 2: "eval_fds F' (w - of_real (œÉ - 1)) = f' (w - of_real (œÉ - 1))"
    using bigo analytic F'_f w' by (rule Newman_Ingham_1)
  thus "eval_fds F w = f w"
    using assms by (simp add: F'_def f'_def)
qed

end

Theory Prime_Counting_Functions

(*
  File:     Prime_Counting_Functions.thy
  Author:   Manuel Eberl (TU M√ºnchen)

  Definitions and basic properties of prime-counting functions like pi, theta, and psi
*)
section ‚ÄπPrime-Counting Functions‚Ä∫
theory Prime_Counting_Functions
  imports Prime_Number_Theorem_Library
begin

text ‚Äπ
  We will now define the basic prime-counting functions ‚ÄπœÄ‚Ä∫, ‚ÄπŒ∏‚Ä∫, and ‚Äπœà‚Ä∫. Additionally, we 
  shall define a function M that is related to Mertens' theorems and Newman's proof of the
  Prime Number Theorem. Most of the results in this file are not actually required to prove 
  the Prime Number Theorem, but are still nice to have.
‚Ä∫

subsection ‚ÄπDefinitions‚Ä∫

definition prime_sum_upto :: "(nat ‚áí 'a) ‚áí real ‚áí 'a :: semiring_1" where
  "prime_sum_upto f x = (‚àëp | prime p ‚àß real p ‚â§ x. f p)"

lemma prime_sum_upto_altdef1:
  "prime_sum_upto f x = sum_upto (Œªp. ind prime p * f p) x"
  unfolding sum_upto_def prime_sum_upto_def
  by (intro sum.mono_neutral_cong_left finite_subset[OF _ finite_Nats_le_real[of x]])
     (auto dest: prime_gt_1_nat simp: ind_def)

lemma prime_sum_upto_altdef2:
  "prime_sum_upto f x = (‚àëp | prime p ‚àß p ‚â§ nat ‚åäx‚åã. f p)"
  unfolding sum_upto_altdef prime_sum_upto_altdef1
  by (intro sum.mono_neutral_cong_right) (auto simp: ind_def dest: prime_gt_1_nat)

lemma prime_sum_upto_altdef3:
  "prime_sum_upto f x = (‚àëp‚Üêprimes_upto (nat ‚åäx‚åã). f p)"
proof -
  have "(‚àëp‚Üêprimes_upto (nat ‚åäx‚åã). f p) = (‚àëp | prime p ‚àß p ‚â§ nat ‚åäx‚åã. f p)"
    by (subst sum_list_distinct_conv_sum_set) (auto simp: set_primes_upto conj_commute)
  thus ?thesis by (simp add: prime_sum_upto_altdef2)
qed

lemma prime_sum_upto_eqI:
  assumes "a ‚â§ b" "‚ãÄk. k ‚àà {nat ‚åäa‚åã<..nat‚åäb‚åã} ‚üπ ¬¨prime k"
  shows   "prime_sum_upto f a = prime_sum_upto f b"
proof -
  have *: "k ‚â§ nat ‚åäa‚åã" if "k ‚â§ nat ‚åäb‚åã" "prime k" for k
    using that assms(2)[of k] by (cases "k ‚â§ nat ‚åäa‚åã") auto
  from assms(1) have "nat ‚åäa‚åã ‚â§ nat ‚åäb‚åã" by linarith
  hence "(‚àëp | prime p ‚àß p ‚â§ nat ‚åäa‚åã. f p) = (‚àëp | prime p ‚àß p ‚â§ nat ‚åäb‚åã. f p)"
    using assms by (intro sum.mono_neutral_left) (auto dest: *)
  thus ?thesis by (simp add: prime_sum_upto_altdef2)
qed

lemma prime_sum_upto_eqI':
  assumes "a' ‚â§ nat ‚åäa‚åã" "a ‚â§ b" "nat ‚åäb‚åã ‚â§ b'" "‚ãÄk. k ‚àà {a'<..b'} ‚üπ ¬¨prime k"
  shows   "prime_sum_upto f a = prime_sum_upto f b"
  by (rule prime_sum_upto_eqI) (use assms in auto)

lemmas eval_prime_sum_upto = prime_sum_upto_altdef3[unfolded primes_upto_sieve]

lemma of_nat_prime_sum_upto: "of_nat (prime_sum_upto f x) = prime_sum_upto (Œªp. of_nat (f p)) x"
  by (simp add: prime_sum_upto_def)

lemma prime_sum_upto_mono:
  assumes "‚ãÄn. n > 0 ‚üπ f n ‚â• (0::real)" "x ‚â§ y"
  shows   "prime_sum_upto f x ‚â§ prime_sum_upto f y"
  using assms unfolding prime_sum_upto_altdef1 sum_upto_altdef
  by (intro sum_mono2) (auto simp: le_nat_iff' le_floor_iff ind_def)

lemma prime_sum_upto_nonneg:
  assumes "‚ãÄn. n > 0 ‚üπ f n ‚â• (0 :: real)"
  shows   "prime_sum_upto f x ‚â• 0"
  unfolding prime_sum_upto_altdef1 sum_upto_altdef
  by (intro sum_nonneg) (auto simp: ind_def assms)

lemma prime_sum_upto_eq_0:
  assumes "x < 2"
  shows   "prime_sum_upto f x = 0"
proof -
  from assms have "nat ‚åäx‚åã = 0 ‚à® nat ‚åäx‚åã = 1" by linarith
  thus ?thesis by (auto simp: eval_prime_sum_upto)
qed

lemma measurable_prime_sum_upto [measurable]:
  fixes f :: "'a ‚áí nat ‚áí real"
  assumes [measurable]: "‚ãÄy. (Œªt. f t y) ‚àà M ‚Üí‚á©M borel"
  assumes [measurable]: "x ‚àà M ‚Üí‚á©M borel"
  shows "(Œªt. prime_sum_upto (f t) (x t)) ‚àà M ‚Üí‚á©M borel"
  unfolding prime_sum_upto_altdef1 by measurable

text ‚Äπ
  The following theorem breaks down a sum over all prime powers no greater than
  fixed bound into a nicer form.
‚Ä∫
lemma sum_upto_primepows:
  fixes f :: "nat ‚áí 'a :: comm_monoid_add"
  assumes "‚ãÄn. ¬¨primepow n ‚üπ f n = 0" "‚ãÄp i. prime p ‚üπ i > 0 ‚üπ f (p ^ i) = g p i"
  shows   "sum_upto f x = (‚àë(p, i) | prime p ‚àß i > 0 ‚àß real (p ^ i) ‚â§ x. g p i)"
proof -
  let ?d = aprimedivisor
  have g: "g (?d n) (multiplicity (?d n) n) = f n" if "primepow n" for n using that 
      by (subst assms(2) [symmetric])
         (auto simp: primepow_decompose aprimedivisor_prime_power primepow_gt_Suc_0
               intro!: aprimedivisor_nat multiplicity_aprimedivisor_gt_0_nat)
  have "sum_upto f x = (‚àën | primepow n ‚àß real n ‚â§ x. f n)"
    unfolding sum_upto_def using assms
    by (intro sum.mono_neutral_cong_right) (auto simp: primepow_gt_0_nat)
  also have "‚Ä¶ = (‚àë(p, i) | prime p ‚àß i > 0 ‚àß real (p ^ i) ‚â§ x. g p i)" (is "_ = sum _ ?S")
    by (rule sum.reindex_bij_witness[of _ "Œª(p,i). p ^ i" "Œªn. (?d n, multiplicity (?d n) n)"])
       (auto simp: aprimedivisor_prime_power primepow_decompose primepow_gt_Suc_0 g
             simp del: of_nat_power intro!: aprimedivisor_nat multiplicity_aprimedivisor_gt_0_nat)
  finally show ?thesis .
qed


definition primes_pi    where "primes_pi = prime_sum_upto (Œªp. 1 :: real)"
definition primes_theta where "primes_theta = prime_sum_upto (Œªp. ln (real p))"
definition primes_psi   where "primes_psi = sum_upto (mangoldt :: nat ‚áí real)"
definition primes_M     where "primes_M = prime_sum_upto (Œªp. ln (real p) / real p)"

text ‚Äπ
  Next, we define some nice optional notation for these functions.
‚Ä∫

bundle prime_counting_notation
begin

notation primes_pi    ("œÄ")
notation primes_theta ("Œ∏")
notation primes_psi   ("œà")
notation primes_M     ("ùîê")

end

bundle no_prime_counting_notation
begin

no_notation primes_pi    ("œÄ")
no_notation primes_theta ("Œ∏")
no_notation primes_psi   ("œà")
no_notation primes_M     ("ùîê")

end

(*<*)
unbundle prime_counting_notation
(*>*)

lemmas œÄ_def = primes_pi_def
lemmas Œ∏_def = primes_theta_def
lemmas œà_def = primes_psi_def

lemmas eval_œÄ = primes_pi_def[unfolded eval_prime_sum_upto]
lemmas eval_Œ∏ = primes_theta_def[unfolded eval_prime_sum_upto]
lemmas eval_ùîê = primes_M_def[unfolded eval_prime_sum_upto]


subsection ‚ÄπBasic properties‚Ä∫

text ‚Äπ
  The proofs in this section are mostly taken from Apostol~\cite{apostol1976analytic}.
‚Ä∫

lemma measurable_œÄ [measurable]: "œÄ ‚àà borel ‚Üí‚á©M borel"
  and measurable_Œ∏ [measurable]: "Œ∏ ‚àà borel ‚Üí‚á©M borel"
  and measurable_œà [measurable]: "œà ‚àà borel ‚Üí‚á©M borel"
  and measurable_primes_M [measurable]: "ùîê ‚àà borel ‚Üí‚á©M borel"
  unfolding primes_M_def œÄ_def Œ∏_def œà_def by measurable

lemma œÄ_eq_0 [simp]: "x < 2 ‚üπ œÄ x = 0"
  and Œ∏_eq_0 [simp]: "x < 2 ‚üπ Œ∏ x = 0"
  and primes_M_eq_0 [simp]: "x < 2 ‚üπ ùîê x = 0"
  unfolding primes_pi_def primes_theta_def primes_M_def
  by (rule prime_sum_upto_eq_0; simp)+

lemma œÄ_nat_cancel [simp]: "œÄ (nat x) = œÄ x"
  and Œ∏_nat_cancel [simp]: "Œ∏ (nat x) = Œ∏ x"
  and primes_M_nat_cancel [simp]: "ùîê (nat x) = ùîê x"
  and œà_nat_cancel [simp]: "œà (nat x) = œà x"
  and œÄ_floor_cancel [simp]: "œÄ (of_int ‚åäy‚åã) = œÄ y"
  and Œ∏_floor_cancel [simp]: "Œ∏ (of_int ‚åäy‚åã) = Œ∏ y"
  and primes_M_floor_cancel [simp]: "ùîê (of_int ‚åäy‚åã) = ùîê y"
  and œà_floor_cancel [simp]: "œà (of_int ‚åäy‚åã) = œà y"
  by (simp_all add: œÄ_def Œ∏_def œà_def primes_M_def prime_sum_upto_altdef2 sum_upto_altdef)

lemma œÄ_nonneg [intro]: "œÄ x ‚â• 0"
  and Œ∏_nonneg [intro]: "Œ∏ x ‚â• 0"
  and primes_M_nonneg [intro]: "ùîê x ‚â• 0"
  unfolding primes_pi_def primes_theta_def primes_M_def
  by (rule prime_sum_upto_nonneg; simp)+

lemma œÄ_mono [intro]: "x ‚â§ y ‚üπ œÄ x ‚â§ œÄ y"
  and Œ∏_mono [intro]: "x ‚â§ y ‚üπ Œ∏ x ‚â§ Œ∏ y"
  and primes_M_mono [intro]: "x ‚â§ y ‚üπ ùîê x ‚â§ ùîê y"
  unfolding primes_pi_def primes_theta_def primes_M_def
  by (rule prime_sum_upto_mono; simp)+

lemma œÄ_pos_iff: "œÄ x > 0 ‚ü∑ x ‚â• 2"
proof
  assume x: "x ‚â• 2"
  show "œÄ x > 0"
    by (rule less_le_trans[OF _ œÄ_mono[OF x]]) (auto simp: eval_œÄ)
next
  assume "œÄ x > 0"
  hence "¬¨(x < 2)" by auto
  thus "x ‚â• 2" by simp
qed

lemma œÄ_pos: "x ‚â• 2 ‚üπ œÄ x > 0"
  by (simp add: œÄ_pos_iff)

lemma œà_eq_0 [simp]:
  assumes "x < 2"
  shows   "œà x = 0"
proof -
  from assms have "nat ‚åäx‚åã ‚â§ 1" by linarith
  hence "mangoldt n = (0 :: real)" if "n ‚àà {0<..nat ‚åäx‚åã}" for n
    using that by (auto simp: mangoldt_def dest!: primepow_gt_Suc_0)
  thus ?thesis unfolding œà_def sum_upto_altdef by (intro sum.neutral) auto
qed

lemma œà_nonneg [intro]: "œà x ‚â• 0"
  unfolding œà_def sum_upto_def by (intro sum_nonneg mangoldt_nonneg)

lemma œà_mono: "x ‚â§ y ‚üπ œà x ‚â§ œà y"
  unfolding œà_def sum_upto_def by (intro sum_mono2 mangoldt_nonneg) auto


subsection ‚ÄπThe $n$-th prime number‚Ä∫

text ‚Äπ
  Next we define the $n$-th prime number, where counting starts from 0. In traditional
  mathematics, it seems that counting usually starts from 1, but it is more natural to
  start from 0 in HOL and the asymptotics of the function are the same.
‚Ä∫
definition nth_prime :: "nat ‚áí nat" where
  "nth_prime n = (THE p. prime p ‚àß card {q. prime q ‚àß q < p} = n)"

lemma finite_primes_less [intro]: "finite {q::nat. prime q ‚àß q < p}"
  by (rule finite_subset[of _ "{..<p}"]) auto

lemma nth_prime_unique_aux:
  fixes p p' :: nat
  assumes "prime p"  "card {q. prime q ‚àß q < p} = n"
  assumes "prime p'" "card {q. prime q ‚àß q < p'} = n"
  shows   "p = p'"
  using assms
proof (induction p p' rule: linorder_wlog)
  case (le p p')
  have "finite {q. prime q ‚àß q < p'}" by (rule finite_primes_less)
  moreover from le have "{q. prime q ‚àß q < p} ‚äÜ {q. prime q ‚àß q < p'}"
    by auto
  moreover from le have "card {q. prime q ‚àß q < p} = card {q. prime q ‚àß q < p'}"
    by simp
  ultimately have "{q. prime q ‚àß q < p} = {q. prime q ‚àß q < p'}"
    by (rule card_subset_eq)
  with ‚Äπprime p‚Ä∫ have "¬¨(p < p')" by blast
  with ‚Äπp ‚â§ p'‚Ä∫ show "p = p'" by auto
qed auto

lemma œÄ_smallest_prime_beyond:
  "œÄ (real (smallest_prime_beyond m)) = œÄ (real (m - 1)) + 1"
proof (cases m)
  case 0
  have "smallest_prime_beyond 0 = 2"
    by (rule smallest_prime_beyond_eq) (auto dest: prime_gt_1_nat)
  with 0 show ?thesis by (simp add: eval_œÄ)
next
  case (Suc n) 
  define n' where "n' = smallest_prime_beyond (Suc n)"
  have "n < n'"
    using smallest_prime_beyond_le[of "Suc n"] unfolding n'_def by linarith
  have "prime n'" by (simp add: n'_def)
  have "n' ‚â§ p" if "prime p" "p > n" for p
    using that smallest_prime_beyond_smallest[of p "Suc n"] by (auto simp: n'_def)
  note n' = ‚Äπn < n'‚Ä∫ ‚Äπprime n'‚Ä∫ this

  have "œÄ (real n') = real (card {p. prime p ‚àß p ‚â§ n'})"
    by (simp add: œÄ_def prime_sum_upto_def)
  also have "Suc n ‚â§ n'" unfolding n'_def by (rule smallest_prime_beyond_le)
  hence "{p. prime p ‚àß p ‚â§ n'} = {p. prime p ‚àß p ‚â§ n} ‚à™ {p. prime p ‚àß p ‚àà {n<..n'}}"
    by auto
  also have "real (card ‚Ä¶) = œÄ (real n) + real (card {p. prime p ‚àß p ‚àà {n<..n'}})"
    by (subst card_Un_disjoint) (auto simp: œÄ_def prime_sum_upto_def)
  also have "{p. prime p ‚àß p ‚àà {n<..n'}} = {n'}"
    using n' by (auto intro: antisym)
  finally show ?thesis using Suc by (simp add: n'_def)
qed

lemma œÄ_inverse_exists: "‚àÉn. œÄ (real n) = real m"
proof (induction m)
  case 0
  show ?case by (intro exI[of _ 0]) auto
next
  case (Suc m)
  from Suc.IH obtain n where n: "œÄ (real n) = real m"
    by auto
  hence "œÄ (real (smallest_prime_beyond (Suc n))) = real (Suc m)"
    by (subst œÄ_smallest_prime_beyond) auto
  thus ?case by blast
qed

lemma nth_prime_exists: "‚àÉp::nat. prime p ‚àß card {q. prime q ‚àß q < p} = n"
proof -
  from œÄ_inverse_exists[of n] obtain m where "œÄ (real m) = real n" by blast
  hence card: "card {q. prime q ‚àß q ‚â§ m} = n"
    by (auto simp: œÄ_def prime_sum_upto_def)

  define p where "p = smallest_prime_beyond (Suc m)"
  have "m < p" using smallest_prime_beyond_le[of "Suc m"] unfolding p_def by linarith
  have "prime p" by (simp add: p_def)
  have "p ‚â§ q" if "prime q" "q > m" for q
    using smallest_prime_beyond_smallest[of q "Suc m"] that by (simp add: p_def)
  note p = ‚Äπm < p‚Ä∫ ‚Äπprime p‚Ä∫ this

  have "{q. prime q ‚àß q < p} = {q. prime q ‚àß q ‚â§ m}"
  proof safe
    fix q assume "prime q" "q < p"
    hence "¬¨(q > m)" using p(1,2) p(3)[of q] by auto
    thus "q ‚â§ m" by simp
  qed (insert p, auto)
  also have "card ‚Ä¶ = n" by fact
  finally show ?thesis using ‚Äπprime p‚Ä∫ by blast
qed

lemma nth_prime_exists1: "‚àÉ!p::nat. prime p ‚àß card {q. prime q ‚àß q < p} = n"
  by (intro ex_ex1I nth_prime_exists) (blast intro: nth_prime_unique_aux)

lemma prime_nth_prime [intro]:    "prime (nth_prime n)"
  and card_less_nth_prime [simp]: "card {q. prime q ‚àß q < nth_prime n} = n"
  using theI'[OF nth_prime_exists1[of n]] by (simp_all add: nth_prime_def)

lemma card_le_nth_prime [simp]: "card {q. prime q ‚àß q ‚â§ nth_prime n} = Suc n"
proof -
  have "{q. prime q ‚àß q ‚â§ nth_prime n} = insert (nth_prime n) {q. prime q ‚àß q < nth_prime n}"
    by auto
  also have "card ‚Ä¶ = Suc n" by simp
  finally show ?thesis .
qed

lemma œÄ_nth_prime [simp]: "œÄ (real (nth_prime n)) = real n + 1"
  by (simp add: œÄ_def prime_sum_upto_def)

lemma nth_prime_eqI:
  assumes "prime p" "card {q. prime q ‚àß q < p} = n"
  shows   "nth_prime n = p"
  unfolding nth_prime_def
  by (rule the1_equality[OF nth_prime_exists1]) (use assms in auto)

lemma nth_prime_eqI':
  assumes "prime p" "card {q. prime q ‚àß q ‚â§ p} = Suc n"
  shows   "nth_prime n = p"
proof (rule nth_prime_eqI)
  have "{q. prime q ‚àß q ‚â§ p} = insert p {q. prime q ‚àß q < p}"
    using assms by auto
  also have "card ‚Ä¶ = Suc (card {q. prime q ‚àß q < p})"
    by simp
  finally show "card {q. prime q ‚àß q < p} = n" using assms by simp
qed (use assms in auto)

lemma nth_prime_eqI'':
  assumes "prime p" "œÄ (real p) = real n + 1"
  shows   "nth_prime n = p"
proof (rule nth_prime_eqI')
  have "real (card {q. prime q ‚àß q ‚â§ p}) = œÄ (real p)"
    by (simp add: œÄ_def prime_sum_upto_def)
  also have "‚Ä¶ = real (Suc n)" by (simp add: assms)
  finally show "card {q. prime q ‚àß q ‚â§ p} = Suc n"
    by (simp only: of_nat_eq_iff)
qed fact+

lemma nth_prime_0 [simp]: "nth_prime 0 = 2"
  by (intro nth_prime_eqI) (auto dest: prime_gt_1_nat)

lemma nth_prime_Suc: "nth_prime (Suc n) = smallest_prime_beyond (Suc (nth_prime n))"
  by (rule nth_prime_eqI'') (simp_all add: œÄ_smallest_prime_beyond)

lemmas nth_prime_code [code] = nth_prime_0 nth_prime_Suc

lemma strict_mono_nth_prime: "strict_mono nth_prime"
proof (rule strict_monoI_Suc)
  fix n :: nat
  have "Suc (nth_prime n) ‚â§ smallest_prime_beyond (Suc (nth_prime n))" by simp
  also have "‚Ä¶ = nth_prime (Suc n)" by (simp add: nth_prime_Suc)
  finally show "nth_prime n < nth_prime (Suc n)" by simp
qed

lemma nth_prime_le_iff [simp]: "nth_prime m ‚â§ nth_prime n ‚ü∑ m ‚â§ n"
  using strict_mono_less_eq[OF strict_mono_nth_prime] by blast

lemma nth_prime_less_iff [simp]: "nth_prime m < nth_prime n ‚ü∑ m < n"
  using strict_mono_less[OF strict_mono_nth_prime] by blast

lemma nth_prime_eq_iff [simp]: "nth_prime m = nth_prime n ‚ü∑ m = n"
  using strict_mono_eq[OF strict_mono_nth_prime] by blast

lemma nth_prime_ge_2: "nth_prime n ‚â• 2"
  using nth_prime_le_iff[of 0 n] by (simp del: nth_prime_le_iff)

lemma nth_prime_lower_bound: "nth_prime n ‚â• Suc (Suc n)"
proof -
  have "n = card {q. prime q ‚àß q < nth_prime n}"
    by simp
  also have "‚Ä¶ ‚â§ card {2..<nth_prime n}"
    by (intro card_mono) (auto dest: prime_gt_1_nat)
  also have "‚Ä¶ = nth_prime n - 2" by simp
  finally show ?thesis using nth_prime_ge_2[of n] by linarith
qed

lemma nth_prime_at_top: "filterlim nth_prime at_top at_top"
proof (rule filterlim_at_top_mono)
  show "filterlim (Œªn::nat. n + 2) at_top at_top" by real_asymp
qed (auto simp: nth_prime_lower_bound)

lemma œÄ_at_top: "filterlim œÄ at_top at_top"
  unfolding filterlim_at_top
proof safe
  fix C :: real
  define x0 where "x0 = real (nth_prime (nat ‚åàmax 0 C‚åâ))"
  show "eventually (Œªx. œÄ x ‚â• C) at_top"
    using eventually_ge_at_top
  proof eventually_elim
    fix x assume "x ‚â• x0"
    have "C ‚â§ real (nat ‚åàmax 0 C‚åâ + 1)" by linarith
    also have "real (nat ‚åàmax 0 C‚åâ + 1) = œÄ x0"
      unfolding x0_def by simp
    also have "‚Ä¶ ‚â§ œÄ x" by (rule œÄ_mono) fact
    finally show "œÄ x ‚â• C" .
  qed
qed

text‚Äπ
  An unbounded, strictly increasing sequence $a_n$ partitions $[a_0; \infty)$ into
  segments of the form $[a_n; a_{n+1})$.
‚Ä∫
lemma strict_mono_sequence_partition:
  assumes "strict_mono (f :: nat ‚áí 'a :: {linorder, no_top})"
  assumes "x ‚â• f 0"
  assumes "filterlim f at_top at_top"
  shows   "‚àÉk. x ‚àà {f k..<f (Suc k)}"
proof -
  define k where "k = (LEAST k. f (Suc k) > x)"
  {
    obtain n where "x ‚â§ f n"
      using assms by (auto simp: filterlim_at_top eventually_at_top_linorder)
    also have "f n < f (Suc n)"
      using assms by (auto simp: strict_mono_Suc_iff)
    finally have "‚àÉn. f (Suc n) > x" by auto
  }
  from LeastI_ex[OF this] have "x < f (Suc k)"
    by (simp add: k_def)
  moreover have "f k ‚â§ x"
  proof (cases k)
    case (Suc k')
    have "k ‚â§ k'" if "f (Suc k') > x"
      using that unfolding k_def by (rule Least_le)
    with Suc show "f k ‚â§ x" by (cases "f k ‚â§ x") (auto simp: not_le)
  qed (use assms in auto)
  ultimately show ?thesis by auto
qed

lemma nth_prime_partition:
  assumes "x ‚â• 2"
  shows   "‚àÉk. x ‚àà {nth_prime k..<nth_prime (Suc k)}"
  using strict_mono_sequence_partition[OF strict_mono_nth_prime, of x] assms nth_prime_at_top
  by simp

lemma nth_prime_partition':
  assumes "x ‚â• 2"
  shows   "‚àÉk. x ‚àà {real (nth_prime k)..<real (nth_prime (Suc k))}"
  by (rule strict_mono_sequence_partition)
     (auto simp: strict_mono_Suc_iff assms
           intro!: filterlim_real_sequentially filterlim_compose[OF _ nth_prime_at_top])

lemma between_nth_primes_imp_nonprime:
  assumes "n > nth_prime k" "n < nth_prime (Suc k)"
  shows   "¬¨prime n"
  using assms by (metis Suc_leI not_le nth_prime_Suc smallest_prime_beyond_smallest)

lemma nth_prime_partition'':
  assumes "x ‚â• (2 :: real)"
  shows "x ‚àà {real (nth_prime (nat ‚åäœÄ x‚åã - 1))..<real (nth_prime (nat ‚åäœÄ x‚åã))}"
proof -
  obtain n where n: "x ‚àà {nth_prime n..<nth_prime (Suc n)}"
    using nth_prime_partition' assms by auto
  have "œÄ (nth_prime n) = œÄ x"
    unfolding œÄ_def using between_nth_primes_imp_nonprime n
    by (intro prime_sum_upto_eqI) (auto simp: le_nat_iff le_floor_iff)
  hence "real n = œÄ x - 1"
    by simp
  hence n_eq: "n = nat ‚åäœÄ x‚åã - 1" "Suc n = nat ‚åäœÄ x‚åã"
    by linarith+
  with n show ?thesis 
    by simp
qed


subsection ‚ÄπRelations between different prime-counting functions‚Ä∫

text ‚Äπ
  The ‚Äπœà‚Ä∫ function can be expressed as a sum of ‚ÄπŒ∏‚Ä∫.
‚Ä∫
lemma œà_altdef:
  assumes "x > 0"
  shows   "œà x = sum_upto (Œªm. prime_sum_upto ln (root m x)) (log 2 x)" (is "_ = ?rhs")
proof -
  have finite: "finite {p. prime p ‚àß real p ‚â§ y}" for y
    by (rule finite_subset[of _ "{..nat ‚åäy‚åã}"]) (auto simp: le_nat_iff' le_floor_iff)
  define S where "S = (SIGMA i:{i. 0 < i ‚àß real i ‚â§ log 2 x}. {p. prime p ‚àß real p ‚â§ root i x})"
  have "œà x = (‚àë(p, i) | prime p ‚àß 0 < i ‚àß real (p ^ i) ‚â§ x. ln (real p))"  unfolding œà_def
    by (subst sum_upto_primepows[where g = "Œªp i. ln (real p)"])
       (auto simp: case_prod_unfold mangoldt_non_primepow)
  also have "‚Ä¶ = (‚àë(i, p) | prime p ‚àß 0 < i ‚àß real (p ^ i) ‚â§ x. ln (real p))"
    by (intro sum.reindex_bij_witness[of _ "Œª(x,y). (y,x)" "Œª(x,y). (y,x)"]) auto
  also have "{(i, p). prime p ‚àß 0 < i ‚àß real (p ^ i) ‚â§ x} = S"
    unfolding S_def
  proof safe
    fix i p :: nat assume ip: "i > 0" "real i ‚â§ log 2 x" "prime p" "real p ‚â§ root i x"
    hence "real (p ^ i) ‚â§ root i x ^ i" unfolding of_nat_power by (intro power_mono) auto
    with ip assms show "real (p ^ i) ‚â§ x" by simp
  next
    fix i p assume ip: "prime p" "i > 0" "real (p ^ i) ‚â§ x"
    from ip have "2 ^ i ‚â§ p ^ i" by (intro power_mono) (auto dest: prime_gt_1_nat)
    also have "‚Ä¶ ‚â§ x" using ip by simp
    finally show "real i ‚â§ log 2 x"
      using assms by (simp add: le_log_iff powr_realpow)
    have "root i (real p ^ i) ‚â§ root i x" using ip assms
      by (subst real_root_le_iff) auto
    also have "root i (real p ^ i) = real p"
      using assms ip by (subst real_root_pos2) auto
    finally show "real p ‚â§ root i x" .
  qed
  also have "(‚àë(i,p)‚ààS. ln p) = sum_upto (Œªm. prime_sum_upto ln (root m x)) (log 2 x)"
    unfolding sum_upto_def prime_sum_upto_def S_def using finite by (subst sum.Sigma) auto
  finally show ?thesis .
qed

lemma œà_conv_Œ∏_sum: "x > 0 ‚üπ œà x = sum_upto (Œªm. Œ∏ (root m x)) (log 2 x)"
  by (simp add: œà_altdef Œ∏_def)

lemma œà_minus_Œ∏:
  assumes x: "x ‚â• 2"
  shows   "œà x - Œ∏ x = (‚àëi | 2 ‚â§ i ‚àß real i ‚â§ log 2 x. Œ∏ (root i x))"
proof -
  have finite: "finite {i. 2 ‚â§ i ‚àß real i ‚â§ log 2 x}"
    by (rule finite_subset[of _ "{2..nat ‚åälog 2 x‚åã}"]) (auto simp: le_nat_iff' le_floor_iff)
  have "œà x = (‚àëi | 0 < i ‚àß real i ‚â§ log 2 x. Œ∏ (root i x))" using x
    by (simp add: œà_conv_Œ∏_sum sum_upto_def)
  also have "{i. 0 < i ‚àß real i ‚â§ log 2 x} = insert 1 {i. 2 ‚â§ i ‚àß real i ‚â§ log 2 x}" using x
    by (auto simp: le_log_iff)
  also have "(‚àëi‚àà‚Ä¶. Œ∏ (root i x)) - Œ∏ x =
               (‚àëi | 2 ‚â§ i ‚àß real i ‚â§ log 2 x. Œ∏ (root i x))" using finite
    by (subst sum.insert) auto
  finally show ?thesis .
qed

text ‚Äπ
  The following theorems use summation by parts to relate different prime-counting functions to
  one another with an integral as a remainder term.
‚Ä∫
lemma Œ∏_conv_œÄ_integral:
  assumes "x ‚â• 2"
  shows   "((Œªt. œÄ t / t) has_integral (œÄ x * ln x - Œ∏ x)) {2..x}"
proof (cases "x = 2")
  case False
  note [intro] = finite_vimage_real_of_nat_greaterThanAtMost
  from False and assms have x: "x > 2" by simp
  have "((Œªt. sum_upto (ind prime) t * (1 / t)) has_integral
          sum_upto (ind prime) x * ln x - sum_upto (ind prime) 2 * ln 2 -
          (‚àën‚ààreal -` {2<..x}. ind prime n * ln (real n))) {2..x}" using x
    by (intro partial_summation_strong[where X = "{}"])
       (auto intro!: continuous_intros derivative_eq_intros
             simp flip: has_field_derivative_iff_has_vector_derivative)
  hence "((Œªt. œÄ t / t) has_integral (œÄ x * ln x -
           (œÄ 2 * ln 2 + (‚àën‚ààreal -` {2<..x}. ind prime n * ln n)))) {2..x}"
    by (simp add: œÄ_def prime_sum_upto_altdef1 algebra_simps)
  also have "œÄ 2 * ln 2 + (‚àën‚ààreal -` {2<..x}. ind prime n * ln n) =
               (‚àën‚ààinsert 2 (real -` {2<..x}). ind prime n * ln n)"
    by (subst sum.insert) (auto simp: eval_œÄ)
  also have "‚Ä¶ = Œ∏ x" unfolding Œ∏_def prime_sum_upto_def using x
    by (intro sum.mono_neutral_cong_right) (auto simp: ind_def dest: prime_gt_1_nat)
  finally show ?thesis .
qed (auto simp: has_integral_refl eval_œÄ eval_Œ∏)

lemma œÄ_conv_Œ∏_integral:
  assumes "x ‚â• 2"
  shows   "((Œªt. Œ∏ t / (t * ln t ^ 2)) has_integral (œÄ x - Œ∏ x / ln x)) {2..x}"
proof (cases "x = 2")
  case False
  define b where "b = (Œªp. ind prime p * ln (real p))"
  note [intro] = finite_vimage_real_of_nat_greaterThanAtMost
  from False and assms have x: "x > 2" by simp
  have "((Œªt. -(sum_upto b t * (-1 / (t * (ln t)‚áß2)))) has_integral
          -(sum_upto b x * (1 / ln x) - sum_upto b 2 * (1 / ln 2) -
              (‚àën‚ààreal -` {2<..x}. b n * (1 / ln (real n))))) {2..x}" using x
    by (intro has_integral_neg partial_summation_strong[where X = "{}"])
       (auto intro!: continuous_intros derivative_eq_intros
             simp flip: has_field_derivative_iff_has_vector_derivative simp add: power2_eq_square)
  also have "sum_upto b = Œ∏"
    by (simp add: Œ∏_def b_def prime_sum_upto_altdef1 fun_eq_iff)
  also have "Œ∏ x * (1 / ln x) - Œ∏ 2 * (1 / ln 2) - 
                   (‚àën‚ààreal -` {2<..x}. b n * (1 / ln (real n))) =
               Œ∏ x * (1 / ln x) - (‚àën‚ààinsert 2 (real -` {2<..x}). b n * (1 / ln (real n)))"
    by (subst sum.insert) (auto simp: b_def eval_Œ∏)
  also have "(‚àën‚ààinsert 2 (real -` {2<..x}). b n * (1 / ln (real n))) = œÄ x" using x
    unfolding œÄ_def prime_sum_upto_altdef1 sum_upto_def
  proof (intro sum.mono_neutral_cong_left ballI, goal_cases)
    case (3 p)
    hence "p = 1" by auto
    thus ?case by auto
  qed (auto simp: b_def)
  finally show ?thesis by simp
qed (auto simp: has_integral_refl eval_œÄ eval_Œ∏)

lemma integrable_weighted_Œ∏:
  assumes "2 ‚â§ a" "a ‚â§ x"
  shows   "((Œªt. Œ∏ t / (t * ln t ^ 2)) integrable_on {a..x})"
proof (cases "a < x")
  case True
  hence "((Œªt. Œ∏ t * (1 / (t * ln t ^ 2))) integrable_on {a..x})" using assms
    unfolding Œ∏_def prime_sum_upto_altdef1
    by (intro partial_summation_integrable_strong[where X = "{}" and f = "Œªx. -1 / ln x"])
       (auto simp flip: has_field_derivative_iff_has_vector_derivative
             intro!: derivative_eq_intros continuous_intros simp: power2_eq_square field_simps)
  thus ?thesis by simp
qed (insert has_integral_refl[of _ a] assms, auto simp: has_integral_iff)

lemma Œ∏_conv_ùîê_integral:
  assumes "x ‚â• 2"
  shows  "(ùîê has_integral (ùîê x * x - Œ∏ x)) {2..x}"
proof (cases "x = 2")
  case False
  with assms have x: "x > 2" by simp
  define b :: "nat ‚áí real" where "b = (Œªp. ind prime p * ln p / p)"
  note [intro] = finite_vimage_real_of_nat_greaterThanAtMost
  have prime_le_2: "p = 2" if "p ‚â§ 2" "prime p" for p :: nat
    using that by (auto simp: prime_nat_iff)

  have "((Œªt. sum_upto b t * 1) has_integral sum_upto b x * x - sum_upto b 2 * 2 -
          (‚àën‚ààreal -` {2<..x}. b n * real n)) {2..x}" using x
    by (intro partial_summation_strong[of "{}"])
       (auto simp flip: has_field_derivative_iff_has_vector_derivative
             intro!: derivative_eq_intros continuous_intros)
  also have "sum_upto b = ùîê"
    by (simp add: fun_eq_iff primes_M_def b_def prime_sum_upto_altdef1)
  also have "ùîê x * x - ùîê 2 * 2 - (‚àën‚ààreal -` {2<..x}. b n * real n) =
               ùîê x * x - (‚àën‚ààinsert 2 (real -` {2<..x}). b n * real n)"
    by (subst sum.insert) (auto simp: eval_ùîê b_def)
  also have "(‚àën‚ààinsert 2 (real -` {2<..x}). b n * real n) = Œ∏ x"
    unfolding Œ∏_def prime_sum_upto_def using x
    by (intro sum.mono_neutral_cong_right) (auto simp: b_def ind_def not_less prime_le_2)
  finally show ?thesis by simp
qed (auto simp: eval_Œ∏ eval_ùîê)

lemma ùîê_conv_Œ∏_integral:
  assumes "x ‚â• 2"
  shows  "((Œªt. Œ∏ t / t‚áß2) has_integral (ùîê x - Œ∏ x / x)) {2..x}"
proof (cases "x = 2")
  case False
  with assms have x: "x > 2" by simp
  define b :: "nat ‚áí real" where "b = (Œªp. ind prime p * ln p)"
  note [intro] = finite_vimage_real_of_nat_greaterThanAtMost
  have prime_le_2: "p = 2" if "p ‚â§ 2" "prime p" for p :: nat
    using that by (auto simp: prime_nat_iff)

  have "((Œªt. sum_upto b t * (1 / t^2)) has_integral
          sum_upto b x * (-1 / x) - sum_upto b 2 * (-1 / 2) -
          (‚àën‚ààreal -` {2<..x}. b n * (-1 / real n))) {2..x}" using x
    by (intro partial_summation_strong[of "{}"])
       (auto simp flip: has_field_derivative_iff_has_vector_derivative simp: power2_eq_square
             intro!: derivative_eq_intros continuous_intros)
  also have "sum_upto b = Œ∏"
    by (simp add: fun_eq_iff Œ∏_def b_def prime_sum_upto_altdef1)
  also have "Œ∏ x * (-1 / x) - Œ∏ 2 * (-1 / 2) - (‚àën‚ààreal -` {2<..x}. b n * (-1 / real n)) =
               -(Œ∏ x / x - (‚àën‚ààinsert 2 (real -` {2<..x}). b n / real n))"
    by (subst sum.insert) (auto simp: eval_Œ∏ b_def sum_negf)
  also have "(‚àën‚ààinsert 2 (real -` {2<..x}). b n / real n) = ùîê x"
    unfolding primes_M_def prime_sum_upto_def using x
