    by (intro sum.mono_neutral_cong_right) (auto simp: b_def ind_def not_less prime_le_2)
  finally show ?thesis by simp
qed (auto simp: eval_Œ∏ eval_ùîê)

lemma integrable_primes_M: "ùîê integrable_on {x..y}" if "2 ‚â§ x" for x y :: real
proof -
  have "(Œªx. ùîê x * 1) integrable_on {x..y}" if "2 ‚â§ x" "x < y" for x y :: real
    unfolding primes_M_def prime_sum_upto_altdef1 using that
    by (intro partial_summation_integrable_strong[where X = "{}" and f = "Œªx. x"])
       (auto simp flip: has_field_derivative_iff_has_vector_derivative
             intro!: derivative_eq_intros continuous_intros)
  thus ?thesis using that has_integral_refl(2)[of ùîê x] by (cases x y rule: linorder_cases) auto
qed


subsection ‚ÄπBounds‚Ä∫

lemma Œ∏_upper_bound_coarse:
  assumes "x ‚â• 1"
  shows   "Œ∏ x ‚â§ x * ln x"
proof -
  have "Œ∏ x ‚â§ sum_upto (Œª_. ln x) x" unfolding Œ∏_def prime_sum_upto_altdef1 sum_upto_def
    by (intro sum_mono) (auto simp: ind_def)
  also have "‚Ä¶ ‚â§ real_of_int ‚åäx‚åã * ln x" using assms
    by (simp add: sum_upto_altdef)
  also have "‚Ä¶ ‚â§ x * ln x" using assms by (intro mult_right_mono) auto
  finally show ?thesis .
qed

lemma Œ∏_le_œà: "Œ∏ x ‚â§ œà x"
proof (cases "x ‚â• 2")
  case False
  hence "nat ‚åäx‚åã = 0 ‚à® nat ‚åäx‚åã = 1" by linarith
  thus ?thesis by (auto simp: eval_Œ∏)
next
  case True
  hence "œà x - Œ∏ x = (‚àëi | 2 ‚â§ i ‚àß real i ‚â§ log 2 x. Œ∏ (root i x))"
    by (rule œà_minus_Œ∏)
  also have "‚Ä¶ ‚â• 0" by (intro sum_nonneg) auto
  finally show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma œÄ_upper_bound_coarse:
  assumes "x ‚â• 0"
  shows   "œÄ x ‚â§ x / 3 + 2"
proof -
  have "{p. prime p ‚àß p ‚â§ nat ‚åäx‚åã} ‚äÜ {2, 3} ‚à™ {p. p ‚â† 1 ‚àß odd p ‚àß ¬¨3 dvd p ‚àß p ‚â§ nat ‚åäx‚åã}"
    using primes_dvd_imp_eq[of "2 :: nat"] primes_dvd_imp_eq[of "3 :: nat"] by auto
  also have "‚Ä¶ ‚äÜ {2, 3} ‚à™ ((Œªk. 6*k+1) ` {0<..<nat ‚åä(x+5)/6‚åã} ‚à™ (Œªk. 6*k+5) ` {..<nat ‚åä(x+1)/6‚åã})"
    (is "_ ‚à™ ?lhs ‚äÜ _ ‚à™ ?rhs")
  proof (intro Un_mono subsetI)
    fix p :: nat assume "p ‚àà ?lhs"
    hence p: "p ‚â† 1" "odd p" "¬¨3 dvd p" "p ‚â§ nat ‚åäx‚åã" by auto
    from p (1-3) have "(‚àÉk. k > 0 ‚àß p = 6 * k + 1 ‚à® p = 6 * k + 5)" by presburger
    then obtain k where "k > 0 ‚àß p = 6 * k + 1 ‚à® p = 6 * k + 5" by blast
    hence "p = 6 * k + 1 ‚àß k > 0 ‚àß k < nat ‚åä(x+5)/6‚åã ‚à® p = 6*k+5 ‚àß k < nat ‚åä(x+1)/6‚åã"
      unfolding add_divide_distrib using p(4) by linarith
    thus "p ‚àà ?rhs" by auto
  qed
  finally have subset: "{p. prime p ‚àß p ‚â§ nat ‚åäx‚åã} ‚äÜ ‚Ä¶" (is "_ ‚äÜ ?A") .

  have "œÄ x = real (card {p. prime p ‚àß p ‚â§ nat ‚åäx‚åã})"
    by (simp add: œÄ_def prime_sum_upto_altdef2)
  also have "card {p. prime p ‚àß p ‚â§ nat ‚åäx‚åã} ‚â§ card ?A"
    by (intro card_mono subset) auto
  also have "‚Ä¶ ‚â§ 2 + (nat ‚åä(x+5)/6‚åã - 1 + nat ‚åä(x+1)/6‚åã)"
    by (intro order.trans[OF card_Un_le] add_mono order.trans[OF card_image_le]) auto
  also have "‚Ä¶ ‚â§ x / 3 + 2"
    using assms unfolding add_divide_distrib by (cases "x ‚â• 1", linarith, simp)
  finally show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma le_numeral_iff: "m ‚â§ numeral n ‚ü∑ m = numeral n ‚à® m ‚â§ pred_numeral n"
  using numeral_eq_Suc by presburger

text ‚Äπ
  The following nice proof for the upper bound $\theta(x) \leq \ln 4 \cdot x$ is taken
  from Otto Forster's lecture notes on Analytic Number Theory~\cite{forsteranalytic}.
‚Ä∫
lemma prod_primes_upto_less:
  defines "F ‚â° (Œªn. (‚àè{p::nat. prime p ‚àß p ‚â§ n}))"
  shows   "n > 0 ‚üπ F n < 4 ^ n"
proof (induction n rule: less_induct)
  case (less n)
  have "n = 0 ‚à® n = 1 ‚à® n = 2 ‚à® n = 3 ‚à® even n ‚àß n ‚â• 4 ‚à® odd n ‚àß n ‚â• 4"
    by presburger
  then consider "n = 0" | "n = 1" | "n = 2" | "n = 3" | "even n" "n ‚â• 4" | "odd n" "n ‚â• 4"
    by metis
  thus ?case
  proof cases
    assume [simp]: "n = 1"
    have *: "{p. prime p ‚àß p ‚â§ Suc 0} = {}" by (auto dest: prime_gt_1_nat)
    show ?thesis by (simp add: F_def *)
  next
    assume [simp]: "n = 2"
    have *: "{p. prime p ‚àß p ‚â§ 2} = {2 :: nat}"
      by (auto simp: le_numeral_iff dest: prime_gt_1_nat)
    thus ?thesis by (simp add: F_def *)
  next
    assume [simp]: "n = 3"
    have *: "{p. prime p ‚àß p ‚â§ 3} = {2, 3 :: nat}"
      by (auto simp: le_numeral_iff dest: prime_gt_1_nat)
    thus ?thesis by (simp add: F_def *)
  next
    assume n: "even n" "n ‚â• 4"
    from n have "F (n - 1) < 4 ^ (n - 1)" by (intro less.IH) auto
    also have "prime p ‚àß p ‚â§ n ‚ü∑ prime p ‚àß p ‚â§ n - 1" for p
      using n prime_odd_nat[of n] by (cases "p = n") auto
    hence "F (n - 1) = F n" by (simp add: F_def)
    also have "4 ^ (n - 1) ‚â§ (4 ^ n :: nat)" by (intro power_increasing) auto
    finally show ?case .
  next
    assume n: "odd n" "n ‚â• 4"
    then obtain k where k_eq: "n = Suc (2 * k)" by (auto elim: oddE)
    from n have k: "k ‚â• 2" unfolding k_eq by presburger
    have prime_dvd: "p dvd (n choose k)" if p: "prime p" "p ‚àà {k+1<..n}" for p
    proof -
      from p k n have "p dvd pochhammer (k + 2) k"
        unfolding pochhammer_prod
        by (subst prime_dvd_prod_iff)
           (auto intro!: bexI[of _ "p - k - 2"] simp: k_eq numeral_2_eq_2 Suc_diff_Suc)
      also have "pochhammer (real (k + 2)) k = real ((n choose k) * fact k)"
        by (simp add: binomial_gbinomial gbinomial_pochhammer' k_eq field_simps)
      hence "pochhammer (k + 2) k = (n choose k) * fact k"
        unfolding pochhammer_of_nat of_nat_eq_iff .
      finally show "p dvd (n choose k)" using p
        by (auto simp: prime_dvd_fact_iff prime_dvd_mult_nat)
    qed

    have "‚àè{p. prime p ‚àß p ‚àà {k+1<..n}} dvd (n choose k)"
    proof (rule multiplicity_le_imp_dvd, goal_cases)
      case (2 p)
      thus ?case
      proof (cases "p ‚àà {k+1<..n}")
        case False
        hence "multiplicity p (‚àè{p. prime p ‚àß p ‚àà {k+1<..n}}) = 0" using 2
          by (subst prime_elem_multiplicity_prod_distrib) (auto simp: prime_multiplicity_other)
        thus ?thesis by auto
      next
        case True
        hence "multiplicity p (‚àè{p. prime p ‚àß p ‚àà {k+1<..n}}) =
                 sum (multiplicity p) {p. prime p ‚àß Suc k < p ‚àß p ‚â§ n}" using 2
          by (subst prime_elem_multiplicity_prod_distrib) auto
        also have "‚Ä¶ = sum (multiplicity p) {p}" using True 2
        proof (intro sum.mono_neutral_right ballI)
          fix q :: nat assume "q ‚àà {p. prime p ‚àß Suc k < p ‚àß p ‚â§ n} - {p}"
          thus "multiplicity p q = 0" using 2
            by (cases "p = q") (auto simp: prime_multiplicity_other)
        qed auto
        also have "‚Ä¶ = 1" using 2 by simp
        also have "1 ‚â§ multiplicity p (n choose k)"
          using prime_dvd[of p] 2 True by (intro multiplicity_geI) auto
        finally show ?thesis .
      qed
    qed auto
    hence "‚àè{p. prime p ‚àß p ‚àà {k+1<..n}} ‚â§ (n choose k)"
      by (intro dvd_imp_le) (auto simp: k_eq)
    also have "‚Ä¶ = 1 / 2 * (‚àëi‚àà{k, Suc k}. n choose i)"
      using central_binomial_odd[of n] by (simp add: k_eq)
    also have "(‚àëi‚àà{k, Suc k}. n choose i) < (‚àëi‚àà{0, k, Suc k}. n choose i)"
      using k by simp
    also have "‚Ä¶ ‚â§ (‚àëi‚â§n. n choose i)"
      by (intro sum_mono2) (auto simp: k_eq)
    also have "‚Ä¶ = (1 + 1) ^ n"
      using binomial[of 1 1 n] by simp
    also have "1 / 2 * ‚Ä¶ = real (4 ^ k)"
      by (simp add: k_eq power_mult)
    finally have less: "(‚àè{p. prime p ‚àß p ‚àà {k + 1<..n}}) < 4 ^ k"
      unfolding of_nat_less_iff by simp

    have "F n = F (Suc k) * (‚àè{p. prime p ‚àß p ‚àà {k+1<..n}})" unfolding F_def
      by (subst prod.union_disjoint [symmetric]) (auto intro!: prod.cong simp: k_eq)
    also have "‚Ä¶ < 4 ^ Suc k * 4 ^ k" using n
      by (intro mult_strict_mono less less.IH) (auto simp: k_eq)
    also have "‚Ä¶ = 4 ^ (Suc k + k)"
      by (simp add: power_add)
    also have "Suc k + k = n" by (simp add: k_eq)
    finally show ?case .
  qed (insert less.prems, auto)
qed

lemma Œ∏_upper_bound:
  assumes x: "x ‚â• 1"
  shows   "Œ∏ x < ln 4 * x"
proof -
  have "4 powr (Œ∏ x / ln 4) = (‚àèp | prime p ‚àß p ‚â§ nat ‚åäx‚åã. 4 powr (log 4 (real p)))"
    by (simp add: Œ∏_def powr_sum prime_sum_upto_altdef2 sum_divide_distrib log_def)
  also have "‚Ä¶ = (‚àèp | prime p ‚àß p ‚â§ nat ‚åäx‚åã. real p)"
    by (intro prod.cong) (auto dest: prime_gt_1_nat)
  also have "‚Ä¶ = real (‚àèp | prime p ‚àß p ‚â§ nat ‚åäx‚åã. p)"
    by simp
  also have "(‚àèp | prime p ‚àß p ‚â§ nat ‚åäx‚åã. p) < 4 ^ nat ‚åäx‚åã"
    using x by (intro prod_primes_upto_less) auto
  also have "‚Ä¶ = 4 powr real (nat ‚åäx‚åã)"
    using x by (subst powr_realpow) auto
  also have "‚Ä¶ ‚â§ 4 powr x"
    using x by (intro powr_mono) auto
  finally have "4 powr (Œ∏ x / ln 4) < 4 powr x"
    by simp
  thus "Œ∏ x < ln 4 * x"
    by (subst (asm) powr_less_cancel_iff) (auto simp: field_simps)
qed

lemma Œ∏_bigo: "Œ∏ ‚àà O(Œªx. x)"
  by (intro le_imp_bigo_real[of "ln 4"] eventually_mono[OF eventually_ge_at_top[of 1]]
            less_imp_le[OF Œ∏_upper_bound]) auto

lemma œà_minus_Œ∏_bound:
  assumes x: "x ‚â• 2"
  shows   "œà x - Œ∏ x ‚â§ 2 * ln x * sqrt x"
proof -
  have "œà x - Œ∏ x = (‚àëi | 2 ‚â§ i ‚àß real i ‚â§ log 2 x. Œ∏ (root i x))" using x
    by (rule œà_minus_Œ∏)
  also have "‚Ä¶ ‚â§ (‚àëi | 2 ‚â§ i ‚àß real i ‚â§ log 2 x. ln 4 * root i x)"
    using x by (intro sum_mono less_imp_le[OF Œ∏_upper_bound]) auto
  also have "‚Ä¶ ‚â§ (‚àëi | 2 ‚â§ i ‚àß real i ‚â§ log 2 x. ln 4 * root 2 x)" using x
    by (intro sum_mono mult_mono) (auto simp: le_log_iff powr_realpow intro!: real_root_decreasing)
  also have "‚Ä¶ = card {i. 2 ‚â§ i ‚àß real i ‚â§ log 2 x} * ln 4 * sqrt x"
    by (simp add: sqrt_def)
  also have "{i. 2 ‚â§ i ‚àß real i ‚â§ log 2 x} = {2..nat ‚åälog 2 x‚åã}"
    by (auto simp: le_nat_iff' le_floor_iff)
  also have "log 2 x ‚â• 1" using x by (simp add: le_log_iff)
  hence "real (nat ‚åälog 2 x‚åã - 1) ‚â§ log 2 x" using x by linarith
  hence "card {2..nat ‚åälog 2 x‚åã} ‚â§ log 2 x" by simp
  also have "ln (2 * 2 :: real) = 2 * ln 2" by (subst ln_mult) auto
  hence "log 2 x * ln 4 * sqrt x = 2 * ln x * sqrt x" using x
    by (simp add: ln_sqrt log_def power2_eq_square field_simps)
  finally show ?thesis using x by (simp add: mult_right_mono)
qed

lemma œà_minus_Œ∏_bigo: "(Œªx. œà x - Œ∏ x) ‚àà O(Œªx. ln x * sqrt x)"
proof (intro bigoI[of _ "2"] eventually_mono[OF eventually_ge_at_top[of 2]])
  fix x :: real assume "x ‚â• 2"
  thus "norm (œà x - Œ∏ x) ‚â§ 2 * norm (ln x * sqrt x)"
    using œà_minus_Œ∏_bound[of x] Œ∏_le_œà[of x] by simp
qed

lemma œà_bigo: "œà ‚àà O(Œªx. x)"
proof -
  have "(Œªx. œà x - Œ∏ x) ‚àà O(Œªx. ln x * sqrt x)"
    by (rule œà_minus_Œ∏_bigo)
  also have "(Œªx. ln x * sqrt x) ‚àà O(Œªx. x)"
    by real_asymp
  finally have "(Œªx. œà x - Œ∏ x + Œ∏ x) ‚àà O(Œªx. x)"
    by (rule sum_in_bigo) (fact Œ∏_bigo)
  thus ?thesis by simp
qed

text ‚Äπ
  We shall now attempt to get some more concrete bounds on the difference
  between $\pi(x)$ and $\theta(x)/\ln x$ These will be essential in showing the Prime
  Number Theorem later.

  We first need some bounds on the integral
  \[\int\nolimits_2^x \frac{1}{\ln^2 t}\,\mathrm{d}t\]
  in order to bound the contribution of the remainder term. This integral actually has an
  antiderivative in terms of the logarithmic integral $\textrm{li}(x)$, but since we do not have a
  formalisation of it in Isabelle, we will instead use the following ad-hoc bound given by Apostol:
‚Ä∫
lemma integral_one_over_log_squared_bound:
  assumes x: "x ‚â• 4"
  shows   "integral {2..x} (Œªt. 1 / ln t ^ 2) ‚â§ sqrt x / ln 2 ^ 2 + 4 * x / ln x ^ 2"
proof -
  from x have "x * 1 ‚â§ x ^ 2" unfolding power2_eq_square by (intro mult_left_mono) auto
  with x have x': "2 ‚â§ sqrt x" "sqrt x ‚â§ x"
    by (auto simp: real_sqrt_le_iff' intro!: real_le_rsqrt)
  have "integral {2..x} (Œªt. 1 / ln t ^ 2) =
          integral {2..sqrt x} (Œªt. 1 / ln t ^ 2) + integral {sqrt x..x} (Œªt. 1 / ln t ^ 2)"
    (is "_ = ?I1 + ?I2") using x x'
    by (intro Henstock_Kurzweil_Integration.integral_combine [symmetric] integrable_continuous_real)
       (auto intro!: continuous_intros)
  also have "?I1 ‚â§ integral {2..sqrt x} (Œª_. 1 / ln 2 ^ 2)" using x
    by (intro integral_le integrable_continuous_real divide_left_mono
              power_mono continuous_intros) auto
  also have "‚Ä¶ ‚â§ sqrt x / ln 2 ^ 2" using x' by (simp add: field_simps)
  also have "?I2 ‚â§ integral {sqrt x..x} (Œªt. 1 / ln (sqrt x) ^ 2)" using x'
    by (intro integral_le integrable_continuous_real divide_left_mono
              power_mono continuous_intros) auto
  also have "‚Ä¶ ‚â§ 4 * x / ln x ^ 2" using x' by (simp add: ln_sqrt field_simps)
  finally show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma integral_one_over_log_squared_bigo:
  "(Œªx::real. integral {2..x} (Œªt. 1 / ln t ^ 2)) ‚àà O(Œªx. x / ln x ^ 2)"
proof -
  define ub where "ub = (Œªx::real. sqrt x / ln 2 ^ 2 + 4 * x / ln x ^ 2)"
  have "eventually (Œªx. ¬¶integral {2..x} (Œªt. 1 / (ln t)‚áß2)¬¶ ‚â§ ¬¶ub x¬¶) at_top"
    using eventually_ge_at_top[of 4]
  proof eventually_elim
    case (elim x)
    hence "¬¶integral {2..x} (Œªt. 1 / ln t ^ 2)¬¶ = integral {2..x} (Œªt. 1 / ln t ^ 2)"
      by (intro abs_of_nonneg integral_nonneg integrable_continuous_real continuous_intros) auto
    also have "‚Ä¶ ‚â§ ¬¶ub x¬¶"
      using integral_one_over_log_squared_bound[of x] elim by (simp add: ub_def)
    finally show ?case .
  qed
  hence "(Œªx. integral {2..x} (Œªt. 1 / (ln t)‚áß2)) ‚àà O(ub)"
    by (intro landau_o.bigI[of 1]) auto
  also have "ub ‚àà O(Œªx. x / ln x ^ 2)" unfolding ub_def by real_asymp
  finally show ?thesis .
qed

lemma œÄ_Œ∏_bound:
  assumes "x ‚â• (4 :: real)"
  defines "ub ‚â° 2 / ln 2 * sqrt x + 8 * ln 2 * x / ln x ^ 2"
  shows   "œÄ x - Œ∏ x / ln x ‚àà {0..ub}"
proof -
  define r where "r = (Œªx. integral {2..x} (Œªt. Œ∏ t / (t * ln t ^ 2)))"
  have integrable: "(Œªt. c / ln t ^ 2) integrable_on {2..x}" for c
    by (intro integrable_continuous_real continuous_intros) auto

  have "r x ‚â§ integral {2..x} (Œªt. ln 4 / ln t ^ 2)" unfolding r_def
    using integrable_weighted_Œ∏[of 2 x] integrable[of "ln 4"] assms less_imp_le[OF Œ∏_upper_bound]
    by (intro integral_le divide_right_mono) (auto simp: field_simps)
  also have "‚Ä¶ = ln 4 * integral {2..x} (Œªt. 1 / ln t ^ 2)"
    using integrable[of 1] by (subst integral_mult) auto
  also have "‚Ä¶ ‚â§ ln 4 * (sqrt x / ln 2 ^ 2 + 4 * x / ln x ^ 2)"
    using assms by (intro mult_left_mono integral_one_over_log_squared_bound) auto
  also have "ln (4 :: real) = 2 * ln 2"
    using ln_realpow[of 2 2] by simp
  also have "‚Ä¶ * (sqrt x / ln 2 ^ 2 + 4 * x / ln x ^ 2) = ub"
    using assms by (simp add: field_simps power2_eq_square ub_def)
  finally have "r x ‚â§ ‚Ä¶" .
  moreover have "r x ‚â• 0" unfolding r_def using assms
    by (intro integral_nonneg integrable_weighted_Œ∏ divide_nonneg_pos) auto
  ultimately have "r x ‚àà {0..ub}" by auto
  with œÄ_conv_Œ∏_integral[of x] assms(1) show ?thesis
    by (simp add: r_def has_integral_iff)
qed

text ‚Äπ
  The following statement already indicates that the asymptotics of ‚ÄπœÄ‚Ä∫ and ‚ÄπŒ∏‚Ä∫
  are very closely related, since through it, $\pi(x) \sim x / \ln x$ and $\theta(x) \sim x$
  imply each other.
‚Ä∫
lemma œÄ_Œ∏_bigo: "(Œªx. œÄ x - Œ∏ x / ln x) ‚àà O(Œªx. x / ln x ^ 2)"
proof -
  define ub where "ub = (Œªx. 2 / ln 2 * sqrt x + 8 * ln 2 * x / ln x ^ 2)"
  have "(Œªx. œÄ x - Œ∏ x / ln x) ‚àà O(ub)"
  proof (intro le_imp_bigo_real[of 1] eventually_mono[OF eventually_ge_at_top])
    fix x :: real assume "x ‚â• 4"
    from œÄ_Œ∏_bound[OF this] show "œÄ x - Œ∏ x / ln x ‚â• 0" and "œÄ x - Œ∏ x / ln x ‚â§ 1 * ub x"
      by (simp_all add: ub_def)
  qed auto
  also have "ub ‚àà O(Œªx. x / ln x ^ 2)"
    unfolding ub_def by real_asymp
  finally show ?thesis .
qed

text ‚Äπ
  As a foreshadowing of the Prime Number Theorem, we can already show
  the following upper bound on $\pi(x)$:
‚Ä∫
lemma œÄ_upper_bound:
  assumes "x ‚â• (4 :: real)"
  shows   "œÄ x < ln 4 * x / ln x  +  8 * ln 2 * x / ln x ^ 2  +  2 / ln 2 * sqrt x"
proof -
  define ub where "ub = 2 / ln 2 * sqrt x + 8 * ln 2 * x / ln x ^ 2"
  have "œÄ x ‚â§ Œ∏ x / ln x + ub"
    using œÄ_Œ∏_bound[of x] assms unfolding ub_def by simp
  also from assms have "Œ∏ x / ln x < ln 4 * x / ln x"
    by (intro Œ∏_upper_bound divide_strict_right_mono) auto
  finally show ?thesis
    using assms by (simp add: algebra_simps ub_def)
qed

lemma œÄ_bigo: "œÄ ‚àà O(Œªx. x / ln x)"
proof -
  have "(Œªx. œÄ x - Œ∏ x / ln x) ‚àà O(Œªx. x / ln x ^ 2)"
    by (fact œÄ_Œ∏_bigo)
  also have "(Œªx::real. x / ln x ^ 2) ‚àà O(Œªx. x / ln x)"
    by real_asymp
  finally have "(Œªx. œÄ x - Œ∏ x / ln x) ‚àà O(Œªx. x / ln x)" .
  moreover have "eventually (Œªx::real. ln x > 0) at_top" by real_asymp
  hence "eventually (Œªx::real. ln x ‚â† 0) at_top" by eventually_elim auto
  hence "(Œªx. Œ∏ x / ln x) ‚àà O(Œªx. x / ln x)"
    using Œ∏_bigo by (intro landau_o.big.divide_right)
  ultimately have "(Œªx. œÄ x - Œ∏ x / ln x + Œ∏ x / ln x) ‚àà O(Œªx. x / ln x)"
    by (rule sum_in_bigo)
  thus ?thesis by simp
qed


subsection ‚ÄπEquivalence of various forms of the Prime Number Theorem‚Ä∫

text ‚Äπ
  In this section, we show that the following forms of the Prime Number Theorem are
  all equivalent:
    ‚ñ∏ $\pi(x) \sim x / \ln x$
    ‚ñ∏ $\pi(x) \ln \pi(x) \sim x$
    ‚ñ∏ $p_n \sim n \ln n$
    ‚ñ∏ $\vartheta(x) \sim x$
    ‚ñ∏ $\psi(x) \sim x$

  We show the following implication chains:
    ‚ñ™ ‚Äπ(1) ‚Üí (2) ‚Üí (3) ‚Üí (2) ‚Üí (1)‚Ä∫
    ‚ñ™ ‚Äπ(1) ‚Üí (4) ‚Üí (1)‚Ä∫
    ‚ñ™ ‚Äπ(4) ‚Üí (5) ‚Üí (4)‚Ä∫

  All of these proofs are taken from Apostol's book.
‚Ä∫

lemma PNT1_imp_PNT1':
  assumes "œÄ ‚àº[at_top] (Œªx. x / ln x)"
  shows   "(Œªx. ln (œÄ x)) ‚àº[at_top] ln"
proof -
  (* TODO: Tedious Landau sum reasoning *)
  from assms have "((Œªx. œÄ x / (x / ln x)) ‚§è 1) at_top"
    by (rule asymp_equivD_strong[OF _ eventually_mono[OF eventually_gt_at_top[of 1]]]) auto
  hence "((Œªx. ln (œÄ x / (x / ln x))) ‚§è ln 1) at_top"
    by (rule tendsto_ln) auto
  also have "?this ‚ü∑ ((Œªx. ln (œÄ x) - ln x + ln (ln x)) ‚§è 0) at_top"
    by (intro filterlim_cong eventually_mono[OF eventually_gt_at_top[of 2]])
       (auto simp: ln_div field_simps ln_mult œÄ_pos)
  finally have "(Œªx. ln (œÄ x) - ln x + ln (ln x)) ‚àà o(Œª_. 1)"
    by (intro smalloI_tendsto) auto
  also have "(Œª_::real. 1 :: real) ‚àà o(Œªx. ln x)"
    by real_asymp
  finally have "(Œªx. ln (œÄ x) - ln x + ln (ln x) - ln (ln x)) ‚àà o(Œªx. ln x)"
    by (rule sum_in_smallo) real_asymp+
  thus *: "(Œªx. ln (œÄ x)) ‚àº[at_top] ln"
    by (simp add: asymp_equiv_altdef)
qed

lemma PNT1_imp_PNT2:
  assumes "œÄ ‚àº[at_top] (Œªx. x / ln x)"
  shows   "(Œªx. œÄ x * ln (œÄ x)) ‚àº[at_top] (Œªx. x)"
proof -
  have "(Œªx. œÄ x * ln (œÄ x)) ‚àº[at_top] (Œªx. x / ln x * ln x)"
    by (intro asymp_equiv_intros assms PNT1_imp_PNT1')
  also have "‚Ä¶ ‚àº[at_top] (Œªx. x)"
    by (intro asymp_equiv_refl_ev eventually_mono[OF eventually_gt_at_top[of 1]])
       (auto simp: field_simps)
  finally show "(Œªx. œÄ x * ln (œÄ x)) ‚àº[at_top] (Œªx. x)"
    by simp
qed

lemma PNT2_imp_PNT3:
  assumes "(Œªx. œÄ x * ln (œÄ x)) ‚àº[at_top] (Œªx. x)"
  shows   "nth_prime ‚àº[at_top] (Œªn. n * ln n)"
proof -
  have "(Œªn. nth_prime n) ‚àº[at_top] (Œªn. œÄ (nth_prime n) * ln (œÄ (nth_prime n)))"
    using assms
    by (rule asymp_equiv_symI [OF asymp_equiv_compose'])
       (auto intro!: filterlim_compose[OF filterlim_real_sequentially nth_prime_at_top])
  also have "‚Ä¶ = (Œªn. real (Suc n) * ln (real (Suc n)))"
    by (simp add: add_ac)
  also have "‚Ä¶ ‚àº[at_top] (Œªn. real n * ln (real n))"
    by real_asymp
  finally show "nth_prime ‚àº[at_top] (Œªn. n * ln n)" .
qed

lemma PNT3_imp_PNT2:
  assumes "nth_prime ‚àº[at_top] (Œªn. n * ln n)"
  shows   "(Œªx. œÄ x * ln (œÄ x)) ‚àº[at_top] (Œªx. x)"
proof (rule asymp_equiv_symI, rule asymp_equiv_sandwich_real)
  show "eventually (Œªx. x ‚àà {real (nth_prime (nat ‚åäœÄ x‚åã - 1))..real (nth_prime (nat ‚åäœÄ x‚åã))})
          at_top"
    using eventually_ge_at_top[of 2]
  proof eventually_elim
    case (elim x)
    with nth_prime_partition''[of x] show ?case by auto
  qed
next
  have "(Œªx. real (nth_prime (nat ‚åäœÄ x‚åã - 1))) ‚àº[at_top]
           (Œªx. real (nat ‚åäœÄ x‚åã - 1) * ln (real (nat ‚åäœÄ x‚åã - 1)))"
    by (rule asymp_equiv_compose'[OF _ œÄ_at_top], rule asymp_equiv_compose'[OF assms]) real_asymp
  also have "‚Ä¶ ‚àº[at_top] (Œªx. œÄ x * ln (œÄ x))"
    by (rule asymp_equiv_compose'[OF _ œÄ_at_top]) real_asymp
  finally show "(Œªx. real (nth_prime (nat ‚åäœÄ x‚åã - 1))) ‚àº[at_top] (Œªx. œÄ x * ln (œÄ x))" .
next
  have "(Œªx. real (nth_prime (nat ‚åäœÄ x‚åã))) ‚àº[at_top]
           (Œªx. real (nat ‚åäœÄ x‚åã) * ln (real (nat ‚åäœÄ x‚åã)))"
    by (rule asymp_equiv_compose'[OF _ œÄ_at_top], rule asymp_equiv_compose'[OF assms]) real_asymp
  also have "‚Ä¶ ‚àº[at_top] (Œªx. œÄ x * ln (œÄ x))"
    by (rule asymp_equiv_compose'[OF _ œÄ_at_top]) real_asymp
  finally show "(Œªx. real (nth_prime (nat ‚åäœÄ x‚åã))) ‚àº[at_top] (Œªx. œÄ x * ln (œÄ x))" .
qed

lemma PNT2_imp_PNT1:
  assumes "(Œªx. œÄ x * ln (œÄ x)) ‚àº[at_top] (Œªx. x)"
  shows   "(Œªx. ln (œÄ x)) ‚àº[at_top] (Œªx. ln x)"
    and   "œÄ ‚àº[at_top] (Œªx. x / ln x)"
proof -
   have ev: "eventually (Œªx. œÄ x > 0) at_top"
            "eventually (Œªx. ln (œÄ x) > 0) at_top"
            "eventually (Œªx. ln (ln (œÄ x)) > 0) at_top"
    by (rule eventually_compose_filterlim[OF _ œÄ_at_top], real_asymp)+

  let ?f = "Œªx. 1 + ln (ln (œÄ x)) / ln (œÄ x) - ln x / ln (œÄ x)"
  have "((Œªx. ln (œÄ x) * ?f x) ‚§è ln 1) at_top"
  proof (rule Lim_transform_eventually)
    from assms have "((Œªx. œÄ x * ln (œÄ x) / x) ‚§è 1) at_top"
      by (rule asymp_equivD_strong[OF _ eventually_mono[OF eventually_gt_at_top[of 1]]]) auto
    then show "((Œªx. ln (œÄ x * ln (œÄ x) / x)) ‚§è ln 1) at_top"
      by (rule tendsto_ln) auto
    show "‚àÄ‚á©F x in at_top. ln (œÄ x * ln (œÄ x) / x) = ln (œÄ x) * ?f x"
      using eventually_gt_at_top[of 0] ev
      by eventually_elim (simp add: field_simps ln_mult ln_div)
  qed
  moreover have "((Œªx. 1 / ln (œÄ x)) ‚§è 0) at_top"
    by (rule filterlim_compose[OF _ œÄ_at_top]) real_asymp
  ultimately have "((Œªx. ln (œÄ x) * ?f x * (1 / ln (œÄ x))) ‚§è ln 1 * 0) at_top"
    by (rule tendsto_mult)
  moreover have "eventually (Œªx. ln (œÄ x) * ?f x * (1 / ln (œÄ x)) = ?f x) at_top"
    using ev by eventually_elim auto
  ultimately have "(?f ‚§è ln 1 * 0) at_top"
    by (rule Lim_transform_eventually)
  hence "((Œªx. 1 + ln (ln (œÄ x)) / ln (œÄ x) - ?f x) ‚§è 1 + 0 - ln 1 * 0) at_top"
    by (intro tendsto_intros filterlim_compose[OF _ œÄ_at_top]) (real_asymp | simp)+
  hence "((Œªx. ln x / ln (œÄ x)) ‚§è 1) at_top"
    by simp
  thus *: "(Œªx. ln (œÄ x)) ‚àº[at_top] (Œªx. ln x)"
    by (rule asymp_equiv_symI[OF asymp_equivI'])

  have "eventually (Œªx. œÄ x = œÄ x * ln (œÄ x) / ln (œÄ x)) at_top"
    using ev by eventually_elim auto
  hence "œÄ ‚àº[at_top] (Œªx. œÄ x * ln (œÄ x) / ln (œÄ x))"
    by (rule asymp_equiv_refl_ev)
  also from assms and * have "(Œªx. œÄ x * ln (œÄ x) / ln (œÄ x)) ‚àº[at_top] (Œªx. x / ln x)"
    by (rule asymp_equiv_intros)
  finally show "œÄ ‚àº[at_top] (Œªx. x / ln x)" .
qed

lemma PNT4_imp_PNT5:
  assumes "Œ∏ ‚àº[at_top] (Œªx. x)"
  shows   "œà ‚àº[at_top] (Œªx. x)"
proof -
  define r where "r = (Œªx. œà x - Œ∏ x)"
  have "r ‚àà O(Œªx. ln x * sqrt x)"
    unfolding r_def by (fact œà_minus_Œ∏_bigo)
  also have "(Œªx::real. ln x * sqrt x) ‚àà o(Œªx. x)"
    by real_asymp
  finally have r: "r ‚àà o(Œªx. x)" .

  have "(Œªx. Œ∏ x + r x) ‚àº[at_top] (Œªx. x)"
    using assms r by (subst asymp_equiv_add_right) auto
  thus ?thesis by (simp add: r_def)
qed

lemma PNT4_imp_PNT1:
  assumes "Œ∏ ‚àº[at_top] (Œªx. x)"
  shows   "œÄ ‚àº[at_top] (Œªx. x / ln x)"
proof -
  have "(Œªx. (œÄ x - Œ∏ x / ln x) + ((Œ∏ x - x) / ln x)) ‚àà o(Œªx. x / ln x)"
  proof (rule sum_in_smallo)
    have "(Œªx. œÄ x - Œ∏ x / ln x) ‚àà O(Œªx. x / ln x ^ 2)"
      by (rule œÄ_Œ∏_bigo)
    also have "(Œªx. x / ln x ^ 2) ‚àà o(Œªx. x / ln x :: real)"
      by real_asymp
    finally show "(Œªx. œÄ x - Œ∏ x / ln x) ‚àà o(Œªx. x / ln x)" .
  next
    have "eventually (Œªx::real. ln x > 0) at_top" by real_asymp
    hence "eventually (Œªx::real. ln x ‚â† 0) at_top" by eventually_elim auto
    thus "(Œªx. (Œ∏ x - x) / ln x) ‚àà o(Œªx. x / ln x)"
      by (intro landau_o.small.divide_right asymp_equiv_imp_diff_smallo assms)
  qed
  thus ?thesis by (simp add: diff_divide_distrib asymp_equiv_altdef)
qed

lemma PNT1_imp_PNT4:
  assumes "œÄ ‚àº[at_top] (Œªx. x / ln x)"
  shows   "Œ∏ ‚àº[at_top] (Œªx. x)"
proof -
  have "Œ∏ ‚àº[at_top] (Œªx. œÄ x * ln x)"
  proof (rule smallo_imp_asymp_equiv)
    have "(Œªx. Œ∏ x - œÄ x * ln x) ‚àà Œò(Œªx. - ((œÄ x - Œ∏ x / ln x) * ln x))"
      by (intro bigthetaI_cong eventually_mono[OF eventually_gt_at_top[of 1]])
         (auto simp: field_simps)
    also have "(Œªx. - ((œÄ x - Œ∏ x / ln x) * ln x)) ‚àà O(Œªx. x / (ln x)‚áß2 * ln x)"
      unfolding landau_o.big.uminus_in_iff by (intro landau_o.big.mult_right œÄ_Œ∏_bigo)
    also have "(Œªx::real. x / (ln x)‚áß2 * ln x) ‚àà o(Œªx. x / ln x * ln x)"
      by real_asymp
    also have "(Œªx. x / ln x * ln x) ‚àà Œò(Œªx. œÄ x * ln x)"
      by (intro asymp_equiv_imp_bigtheta asymp_equiv_intros asymp_equiv_symI[OF assms])
    finally show "(Œªx. Œ∏ x - œÄ x * ln x) ‚àà o(Œªx. œÄ x * ln x)" .
  qed
  also have "‚Ä¶ ‚àº[at_top] (Œªx. x / ln x * ln x)"
    by (intro asymp_equiv_intros assms)
  also have "‚Ä¶ ‚àº[at_top] (Œªx. x)"
    by real_asymp
  finally show ?thesis .
qed

lemma PNT5_imp_PNT4:
  assumes "œà ‚àº[at_top] (Œªx. x)"
  shows   "Œ∏ ‚àº[at_top] (Œªx. x)"
proof -
  define r where "r = (Œªx. Œ∏ x - œà x)"
  have "(Œªx. œà x - Œ∏ x) ‚àà O(Œªx. ln x * sqrt x)"
    by (fact œà_minus_Œ∏_bigo)
  also have "(Œªx. œà x - Œ∏ x) = (Œªx. -r x)"
    by (simp add: r_def)
  finally have "r ‚àà O(Œªx. ln x * sqrt x)"
    by simp
  also have "(Œªx::real. ln x * sqrt x) ‚àà o(Œªx. x)"
    by real_asymp
  finally have r: "r ‚àà o(Œªx. x)" .

  have "(Œªx. œà x + r x) ‚àº[at_top] (Œªx. x)"
    using assms r by (subst asymp_equiv_add_right) auto
  thus ?thesis by (simp add: r_def)
qed


subsection ‚ÄπThe asymptotic form of Mertens' First Theorem‚Ä∫

text ‚Äπ
  Mertens' first theorem states that $\mathfrak{M}(x) - \ln x$ is bounded, i.\,e.\ 
  $\mathfrak{M}(x) = \ln x + O(1)$.

  With some work, one can also show some absolute bounds for $|\mathfrak{M}(x) - \ln x|$, and we
  will, in fact, do this later. However, this asymptotic form is somewhat easier to obtain and it is
  (as we shall see) enough to prove the Prime Number Theorem, so we prove the weak form here first
  for the sake of a smoother presentation.

  First of all, we need a very weak version of Stirling's formula for the logarithm of
  the factorial, namely:
  \[\ln(\lfloor x\rfloor!) = \sum\limits_{n\leq x} \ln x = x \ln x + O(x)\]
  We show this using summation by parts.
‚Ä∫
lemma stirling_weak:
  assumes x: "x ‚â• 1"
  shows   "sum_upto ln x ‚àà {x * ln x - x - ln x + 1 .. x * ln x}"
proof (cases "x = 1")
  case True
  have "{0<..Suc 0} = {1}" by auto
  with True show ?thesis by (simp add: sum_upto_altdef)
next
  case False
  with assms have x: "x > 1" by simp
  have "((Œªt. sum_upto (Œª_. 1) t * (1 / t)) has_integral
          sum_upto (Œª_. 1) x * ln x - sum_upto (Œª_. 1) 1 * ln 1 -
          (‚àën‚ààreal -` {1<..x}. 1 * ln (real n))) {1..x}" using x
    by (intro partial_summation_strong[of "{}"])
       (auto simp flip: has_field_derivative_iff_has_vector_derivative
             intro!: derivative_eq_intros continuous_intros)
  hence "((Œªt. real (nat ‚åät‚åã) / t) has_integral
           real (nat ‚åäx‚åã) * ln x - (‚àën‚ààreal -` {1<..x}. ln (real n))) {1..x}"
    by (simp add: sum_upto_altdef)
  also have "(‚àën‚ààreal -` {1<..x}. ln (real n)) = sum_upto ln x" unfolding sum_upto_def
    by (intro sum.mono_neutral_left)
       (auto intro!: finite_subset[OF _ finite_vimage_real_of_nat_greaterThanAtMost[of 0 x]])
  finally have *: "((Œªt. real (nat ‚åät‚åã) / t) has_integral ‚åäx‚åã * ln x - sum_upto ln x) {1..x}"
    using x by simp

  have "0 ‚â§ real_of_int ‚åäx‚åã * ln x - sum_upto (Œªn. ln (real n)) x"
    using * by (rule has_integral_nonneg) auto
  also have "‚Ä¶ ‚â§ x * ln x - sum_upto ln x"
    using x by (intro diff_mono mult_mono) auto
  finally have upper: "sum_upto ln x ‚â§ x * ln x" by simp

  have "(x - 1) * ln x - x + 1 ‚â§ ‚åäx‚åã * ln x - x + 1"
    using x by (intro diff_mono mult_mono add_mono) auto
  also have "((Œªt. 1) has_integral (x - 1)) {1..x}"
    using has_integral_const_real[of "1::real" 1 x] x by simp
  from * and this have "‚åäx‚åã * ln x - sum_upto ln x ‚â§ x - 1"
    by (rule has_integral_le) auto
  hence "‚åäx‚åã * ln x - x + 1 ‚â§ sum_upto ln x"
    by simp
  finally have "sum_upto ln x ‚â• x * ln x - x - ln x + 1"
    by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  with upper show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma stirling_weak_bigo: "(Œªx::real. sum_upto ln x - x * ln x) ‚àà O(Œªx. x)"
proof -
  have "(Œªx. sum_upto ln x - x * ln x) ‚àà O(Œªx. -(sum_upto ln x - x * ln x))"
    by (subst landau_o.big.uminus) auto
  also have "(Œªx. -(sum_upto ln x - x * ln x)) ‚àà O(Œªx. x + ln x - 1)"
  proof (intro le_imp_bigo_real[of 2] eventually_mono[OF eventually_ge_at_top[of 1]], goal_cases)
    case (2 x)
    thus ?case using stirling_weak[of x] by (auto simp: algebra_simps)
  next
    case (3 x)
    thus ?case using stirling_weak[of x] by (auto simp: algebra_simps)
  qed auto
  also have "(Œªx. x + ln x - 1) ‚àà O(Œªx::real. x)" by real_asymp
  finally show ?thesis .
qed

lemma floor_floor_div_eq:
  fixes x :: real and d :: nat
  assumes "x ‚â• 0"
  shows   "‚åänat ‚åäx‚åã / real d‚åã = ‚åäx / real d‚åã"
proof -
  have "‚åänat ‚åäx‚åã / real_of_int (int d)‚åã = ‚åäx / real_of_int (int d)‚åã" using assms
    by (subst (1 2) floor_divide_real_eq_div) auto
  thus ?thesis by simp
qed

text ‚Äπ
  The key to showing Mertens' first theorem is the function
  \[h(x) := \sum\limits_{n \leq x} \frac{\Lambda(d)}{d}\]
  where $\Lambda$ is the Mangoldt function, which is equal to $\ln p$ for any prime power
  $p^k$ and $0$ otherwise. As we shall see, $h(x)$ is a good approximation for $\mathfrak M(x)$,
  as the difference between them is bounded by a constant.
‚Ä∫
lemma sum_upto_mangoldt_over_id_minus_phi_bounded:
    "(Œªx. sum_upto (Œªd. mangoldt d / real d) x - ùîê x) ‚àà O(Œª_. 1)"
proof -
  define f where "f = (Œªd. mangoldt d / real d)"
  define C where "C = (‚àëp. ln (real (p + 1)) * (1 / real (p * (p - 1))))"
  have summable: "summable (Œªp::nat. ln (p + 1) * (1 / (p * (p - 1))))"
  proof (rule summable_comparison_test_bigo)
    show "summable (Œªp. norm (p powr (-3/2)))"
      by (simp add: summable_real_powr_iff)
  qed real_asymp

  have diff_bound: "sum_upto f x - ùîê x ‚àà {0..C}" if x: "x ‚â• 4" for x
  proof -
    define S where "S = {(p, i). prime p ‚àß 0 < i ‚àß real (p ^ i) ‚â§ x}"
    define S' where "S' = (SIGMA p:{2..nat ‚åäroot 2 x‚åã}. {2..nat ‚åälog 2 x‚åã})"
    have "S ‚äÜ {..nat ‚åäx‚åã} √ó {..nat ‚åälog 2 x‚åã}" unfolding S_def
      using x primepows_le_subset[of x 1] by (auto simp: Suc_le_eq)
    hence "finite S" by (rule finite_subset) auto
    note fin = finite_subset[OF _ this, unfolded S_def]
  
    have "sum_upto f x = (‚àë(p, i)‚ààS. ln (real p) / real (p ^ i))" unfolding S_def
      by (intro sum_upto_primepows) (auto simp: f_def mangoldt_non_primepow)
    also have "S = {p. prime p ‚àß p ‚â§ x} √ó {1} ‚à™ {(p, i). prime p ‚àß 1 < i ‚àß real (p ^ i) ‚â§ x}"
      by (auto simp: S_def not_less le_Suc_eq not_le intro!: Suc_lessI)
    also have "(‚àë(p,i)‚àà‚Ä¶. ln (real p) / real (p ^ i)) =
                 (‚àë(p, i) ‚àà {p. prime p ‚àß of_nat p ‚â§ x} √ó {1}. ln (real p) / real (p ^ i)) +
                 (‚àë(p, i) | prime p ‚àß real (p ^ i) ‚â§ x ‚àß i > 1. ln (real p) / real (p ^ i))"
      (is "_ = ?S1 + ?S2")
      by (subst sum.union_disjoint[OF fin fin]) (auto simp: conj_commute case_prod_unfold)
    also have "?S1 = ùîê x"
      by (subst sum.cartesian_product [symmetric]) (auto simp: primes_M_def prime_sum_upto_def)
    finally have eq: "sum_upto f x - ùîê x = ?S2" by simp
    have "?S2 ‚â§ (‚àë(p, i)‚ààS'. ln (real p) / real (p ^ i))"
      using primepows_le_subset[of x 2] x unfolding case_prod_unfold of_nat_power
      by (intro sum_mono2 divide_nonneg_pos zero_less_power)
         (auto simp: eval_nat_numeral Suc_le_eq S'_def subset_iff dest: prime_gt_1_nat)+
    also have "‚Ä¶ = (‚àëp=2..nat ‚åäsqrt x‚åã. ln p * (‚àëi‚àà{2..nat ‚åälog 2 x‚åã}. (1 / real p) ^ i))"
      by (simp add: S'_def sum.Sigma case_prod_unfold
                    sum_distrib_left sqrt_def field_simps)
    also have "‚Ä¶ ‚â§ (‚àëp=2..nat ‚åäsqrt x‚åã. ln p * (1 / (p * (p - 1))))"
      unfolding sum_upto_def
    proof (intro sum_mono, goal_cases)
      case (1 p)
      from x have "nat ‚åälog 2 x‚åã ‚â• 2"
        by (auto simp: le_nat_iff' le_log_iff)
      hence "(‚àëi‚àà{2..nat ‚åälog 2 x‚åã}. (1 / real p) ^ i) = 
               ((1 / p)‚áß2 - (1 / p) ^ nat ‚åälog 2 x‚åã / p) / (1 - 1 / p)" using 1
        by (subst sum_gp) (auto dest!: prime_gt_1_nat simp: field_simps power2_eq_square)
      also have "‚Ä¶ ‚â§ ((1 / p) ^ 2 - 0) / (1 - 1 / p)"
        using 1 by (intro divide_right_mono diff_mono power_mono)
                   (auto simp: field_simps dest: prime_gt_0_nat)
      also have "‚Ä¶ = 1 / (p * (p - 1))"
        by (auto simp: divide_simps power2_eq_square dest: prime_gt_0_nat)
      finally show ?case
        using 1 by (intro mult_left_mono) (auto dest: prime_gt_0_nat)
    qed
    also have "‚Ä¶ ‚â§ (‚àëp=2..nat ‚åäsqrt x‚åã. ln (p + 1) * (1 / (p * (p - 1))))"
      by (intro sum_mono mult_mono) auto
    also have "‚Ä¶ ‚â§ C" unfolding C_def
      by (intro sum_le_suminf summable) auto
    finally have "?S2 ‚â§ C" by simp
    moreover have "?S2 ‚â• 0" by (intro sum_nonneg) (auto dest: prime_gt_0_nat)
    ultimately show ?thesis using eq by simp
  qed

  from diff_bound[of 4] have "C ‚â• 0" by auto
  with diff_bound show "(Œªx. sum_upto f x - ùîê x) ‚àà O(Œª_. 1)"
    by (intro le_imp_bigo_real[of C] eventually_mono[OF eventually_ge_at_top[of 4]]) auto
qed

text ‚Äπ
  Next, we show that our $h(x)$ itself is close to $\ln x$, i.\,e.:
  \[\sum\limits_{n \leq x} \frac{\Lambda(d)}{d} = \ln x + O(1)\]
‚Ä∫
lemma sum_upto_mangoldt_over_id_asymptotics:
  "(Œªx. sum_upto (Œªd. mangoldt d / real d) x - ln x) ‚àà O(Œª_. 1)"
proof -
  define r where "r = (Œªn::real. sum_upto (Œªd. mangoldt d * (n / d - real_of_int ‚åän / d‚åã)) n)"
  have r: "r ‚àà O(œà)"
  proof (intro landau_o.bigI[of 1] eventually_mono[OF eventually_ge_at_top[of 0]])
    fix x :: real assume x: "x ‚â• 0"
    have eq: "{1..nat ‚åäx‚åã} = {0<..nat ‚åäx‚åã}" by auto
    hence "r x ‚â• 0" unfolding r_def sum_upto_def
      by (intro sum_nonneg mult_nonneg_nonneg mangoldt_nonneg)
         (auto simp: floor_le_iff)
    moreover have "x / real d ‚â§ 1 + real_of_int ‚åäx / real d‚åã" for d by linarith
    hence "r x ‚â§ sum_upto (Œªd. mangoldt d * 1) x" unfolding sum_upto_altdef eq r_def using x
      by (intro sum_mono mult_mono mangoldt_nonneg)
         (auto simp:  less_imp_le[OF frac_lt_1] algebra_simps)
    ultimately show "norm (r x) ‚â§ 1 * norm (œà x)" by (simp add: œà_def)
  qed auto
  also have "œà ‚àà O(Œªx. x)" by (fact œà_bigo)
  finally have r: "r ‚àà O(Œªx. x)" .

  define r' where "r' = (Œªx::real. sum_upto ln x - x * ln x)"
  have r'_bigo: "r' ‚àà O(Œªx. x)"
    using stirling_weak_bigo unfolding r'_def .
  have ln_fact: "ln (fact n) = (‚àëd=1..n. ln d)" for n
    by (induction n) (simp_all add: ln_mult)
  hence r': "sum_upto ln n = n * ln n + r' n" for n :: real
    unfolding r'_def sum_upto_altdef by (auto intro!: sum.cong)

  have "eventually (Œªn. sum_upto (Œªd. mangoldt d / d) n - ln n = r' n / n + r n / n) at_top"
    using eventually_gt_at_top
  proof eventually_elim
    fix x :: real assume x: "x > 0"
    have "sum_upto ln x = sum_upto (Œªn. mangoldt n * real (nat ‚åäx / n‚åã)) x"
      unfolding sum_upto_ln_conv_sum_upto_mangoldt ..
    also have "‚Ä¶ = sum_upto (Œªd. mangoldt d * (x / d)) x - r x"
      unfolding sum_upto_def by (simp add: algebra_simps sum_subtractf r_def sum_upto_def)
    also have "sum_upto (Œªd. mangoldt d * (x / d)) x = x * sum_upto (Œªd. mangoldt d / d) x"
      unfolding sum_upto_def by (subst sum_distrib_left) (simp add: field_simps)
    finally have "x * sum_upto (Œªd. mangoldt d / real d) x = r' x + r x + x * ln x"
      by (simp add: r' algebra_simps)
    thus "sum_upto (Œªd. mangoldt d / d) x - ln x = r' x / x + r x / x"
      using x by (simp add: field_simps)
  qed
  hence "(Œªx. sum_upto (Œªd. mangoldt d / d) x - ln x) ‚àà Œò(Œªx. r' x / x + r x / x)"
    by (rule bigthetaI_cong)
  also have "(Œªx. r' x / x + r x / x) ‚àà O(Œª_. 1)"
    by (intro sum_in_bigo) (insert r r'_bigo, auto simp: landau_divide_simps)
  finally show ?thesis .
qed

text ‚Äπ
  Combining these two gives us Mertens' first theorem.
‚Ä∫
theorem mertens_bounded: "(Œªx. ùîê x - ln x) ‚àà O(Œª_. 1)"
proof -
  define f where "f = sum_upto (Œªd. mangoldt d / d)"
  have "(Œªx. (f x - ln x) - (f x - ùîê x)) ‚àà O(Œª_. 1)"
    using sum_upto_mangoldt_over_id_asymptotics
          sum_upto_mangoldt_over_id_minus_phi_bounded
    unfolding f_def by (rule sum_in_bigo)
  thus ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma primes_M_bigo: "ùîê ‚àà O(Œªx. ln x)"
proof -
  have "(Œªx. ùîê x - ln x) ‚àà O(Œª_. 1)"
    by (rule mertens_bounded)
  also have "(Œª_::real. 1) ‚àà O(Œªx. ln x)"
    by real_asymp
  finally have "(Œªx. ùîê x - ln x + ln x) ‚àà O(Œªx. ln x)"
    by (rule sum_in_bigo) auto
  thus ?thesis by simp
qed

(*<*)
unbundle no_prime_counting_notation
(*>*)

end

Theory Prime_Number_Theorem

(*
  File:       Prime Number Theorem.thy
  Authors:    Manuel Eberl (TU M√ºnchen), Larry Paulson (University of Cambridge)

  A proof of the Prime Number Theorem and some related properties
*)
section ‚ÄπThe Prime Number Theorem‚Ä∫
theory Prime_Number_Theorem
imports 
  Newman_Ingham_Tauberian
  Prime_Counting_Functions
begin

(*<*)
unbundle prime_counting_notation
(*>*)

subsection ‚ÄπConstructing Newman's function‚Ä∫

text ‚Äπ
  Starting from Mertens' first theorem, i.\,e.\ $\mathfrak M(x) = \ln x + O(1)$, we now 
  want to derive that $\mathfrak M(x) = \ln x + c + o(1)$. This result is considerably stronger
  and it implies the Prime Number Theorem quite directly.

  In order to do this, we define the Dirichlet series
  \[f(s) = \sum_{n=1}^\infty \frac{\mathfrak{M}(n)}{n^s}\ .\]
  We will prove that this series extends meromorphically to $\mathfrak{R}(s)\geq 1$ and
  apply Ingham's theorem to it (after we subtracted its pole at $s = 1$).
‚Ä∫
definition fds_newman where
  "fds_newman = fds (Œªn. complex_of_real (ùîê n))"

lemma fds_nth_newman:
  "fds_nth fds_newman n = of_real (ùîê n)"
  by (simp add: fds_newman_def fds_nth_fds)

lemma norm_fds_nth_newman:
  "norm (fds_nth fds_newman n) = ùîê n"
  unfolding fds_nth_newman norm_of_real
  by (intro abs_of_nonneg sum_nonneg divide_nonneg_pos) (auto dest: prime_ge_1_nat)

text ‚Äπ
  The Dirichlet series $f(s) + \zeta'(s)$ has the coefficients $\mathfrak{M}(n) - \ln n$,
  so by Mertens' first theorem, $f(s) + \zeta'(s)$ has bounded coefficients.
‚Ä∫
lemma bounded_coeffs_newman_minus_deriv_zeta:
  defines "f ‚â° fds_newman + fds_deriv fds_zeta"
  shows   "Bseq (Œªn. fds_nth f n)"
proof -
  have "(Œªn. ùîê (real n) - ln (real n)) ‚àà O(Œª_. 1)"
    using mertens_bounded by (rule landau_o.big.compose) real_asymp
  from natfun_bigo_1E[OF this, of 1]
    obtain c where c: "c ‚â• 1" "‚ãÄn. ¬¶ùîê (real n) - ln (real n)¬¶ ‚â§ c" by auto

  show ?thesis
  proof (intro BseqI[of c] allI)
    fix n :: nat
    show "norm (fds_nth f n) ‚â§ c"
    proof (cases "n = 0")
      case False
      hence "fds_nth f n = of_real (ùîê n - ln n)"
        by (simp add: f_def fds_nth_newman fds_nth_deriv fds_nth_zeta scaleR_conv_of_real)
      also from ‚Äπn ‚â† 0‚Ä∫ have "norm ‚Ä¶ ‚â§ c"
        using c(2)[of n] by (simp add: in_Reals_norm)
      finally show ?thesis .
    qed (insert c, auto)
  qed (insert c, auto)
qed

text ‚Äπ
  A Dirichlet series with bounded coefficients converges for all $s$ with
  $\mathfrak{R}(s)>1$ and so does $\zeta'(s)$, so we can conclude that $f(s)$ does as well.
‚Ä∫
lemma abs_conv_abscissa_newman: "abs_conv_abscissa fds_newman ‚â§ 1"
  and conv_abscissa_newman:     "conv_abscissa fds_newman ‚â§ 1"
proof -
  define f where "f = fds_newman + fds_deriv fds_zeta"
  have "abs_conv_abscissa f ‚â§ 1"
    using bounded_coeffs_newman_minus_deriv_zeta unfolding f_def
    by (rule bounded_coeffs_imp_abs_conv_abscissa_le_1)
  hence "abs_conv_abscissa (f - fds_deriv fds_zeta) ‚â§ 1"
    by (intro abs_conv_abscissa_diff_leI) (auto simp: abs_conv_abscissa_deriv)
  also have "f - fds_deriv fds_zeta = fds_newman" by (simp add: f_def)
  finally show "abs_conv_abscissa fds_newman ‚â§ 1" .
  from conv_le_abs_conv_abscissa and this show "conv_abscissa fds_newman ‚â§ 1"
    by (rule order.trans)
qed

text ‚Äπ
  We now change the order of summation to obtain an alternative form of $f(s)$ in terms of a 
  sum of Hurwitz $\zeta$ functions.
‚Ä∫
lemma eval_fds_newman_conv_infsetsum:
  assumes s: "Re s > 1"
  shows   "eval_fds fds_newman s = (‚àë‚á©ap | prime p. (ln (real p) / real p) * hurwitz_zeta p s)"
          "(Œªp. ln (real p) / real p * hurwitz_zeta p s) abs_summable_on {p. prime p}"
proof -
  from s have conv: "fds_abs_converges fds_newman s"
    by (intro fds_abs_converges le_less_trans[OF abs_conv_abscissa_newman]) auto
  define f where "f = (Œªn p. ln (real p) / real p / of_nat n powr s)"

  have eq: "(‚àë‚á©an‚àà{p..}. f n p) = ln (real p) / real p * hurwitz_zeta p s" if "prime p" for p
  proof -
    have "(‚àë‚á©an‚àà{p..}. f n p) = (‚àë‚á©ax‚àà{p..}. (ln (real p) / of_nat p) * (1 / of_nat x powr s))"
      by (simp add: f_def)
    also have "‚Ä¶ = (ln (real p) / of_nat p) * (‚àë‚á©ax‚àà{p..}. 1 / of_nat x powr s)"
      using abs_summable_hurwitz_zeta[of s 0 p] that s
      by (intro infsetsum_cmult_right) (auto dest: prime_gt_0_nat)
    also have "(‚àë‚á©ax‚àà{p..}. 1 / of_nat x powr s) = hurwitz_zeta p s"
      using s that by (subst hurwitz_zeta_nat_conv_infsetsum(2))
                      (auto dest: prime_gt_0_nat simp: field_simps powr_minus)
    finally show ?thesis .
  qed

  have norm_f: "norm (f n p) = ln p / p / n powr Re s" if "prime p" for n p :: nat
    by (auto simp: f_def norm_divide norm_mult norm_powr_real_powr)
  from conv have "(Œªn. norm (fds_nth fds_newman n / n powr s)) abs_summable_on UNIV"
    by (intro abs_summable_on_normI) (simp add: fds_abs_converges_altdef')
  also have "(Œªn. norm (fds_nth fds_newman n / n powr s)) =
               (Œªn. ‚àëp | prime p ‚àß p ‚â§ n. norm (f n p))"
    by (auto simp: norm_divide norm_fds_nth_newman sum_divide_distrib primes_M_def
                   prime_sum_upto_def norm_mult norm_f norm_powr_real_powr intro!: sum.cong)
  finally have summable1: "(Œª(n,p). f n p) abs_summable_on (SIGMA n:UNIV. {p. prime p ‚àß p ‚â§ n})"
    using conv by (subst abs_summable_on_Sigma_iff) auto
  also have "?this ‚ü∑ (Œª(p,n). f n p) abs_summable_on
                         (Œª(n,p). (p,n)) ` (SIGMA n:UNIV. {p. prime p ‚àß p ‚â§ n})"
    by (subst abs_summable_on_reindex_iff [symmetric]) (auto simp: case_prod_unfold inj_on_def)
  also have "(Œª(n,p). (p,n)) ` (SIGMA n:UNIV. {p. prime p ‚àß p ‚â§ n}) =
               (SIGMA p:{p. prime p}. {p..})" by auto
  finally have summable2: "(Œª(p,n). f n p) abs_summable_on ‚Ä¶" .
  from abs_summable_on_Sigma_project1'[OF this]
    have "(Œªp. ‚àë‚á©an‚àà{p..}. f n p) abs_summable_on {p. prime p}" by auto
  also have "?this ‚ü∑ (Œªp. ln (real p) / real p * hurwitz_zeta p s) abs_summable_on {p. prime p}"
    by (intro abs_summable_on_cong eq) auto
  finally show ‚Ä¶ .

  have "eval_fds fds_newman s =
          (‚àë‚á©an. ‚àëp | prime p ‚àß p ‚â§ n. ln (real p) / real p / of_nat n powr s)"
    using conv by (simp add: eval_fds_altdef fds_nth_newman sum_divide_distrib
                             primes_M_def prime_sum_upto_def)
  also have "‚Ä¶ = (‚àë‚á©an. ‚àë‚á©ap | prime p ‚àß p ‚â§ n. f n p)"
    unfolding f_def by (subst infsetsum_finite) auto
  also have "‚Ä¶ = (‚àë‚á©a(n, p) ‚àà (SIGMA n:UNIV. {p. prime p ‚àß p ‚â§ n}). f n p)"
    using summable1 by (subst infsetsum_Sigma) auto
  also have "‚Ä¶ = (‚àë‚á©a(p, n) ‚àà (Œª(n,p). (p, n)) ` (SIGMA n:UNIV. {p. prime p ‚àß p ‚â§ n}). f n p)"
    by (subst infsetsum_reindex) (auto simp: case_prod_unfold inj_on_def)
  also have "(Œª(n,p). (p, n)) ` (SIGMA n:UNIV. {p. prime p ‚àß p ‚â§ n}) =
               (SIGMA p:{p. prime p}. {p..})" by auto
  also have "(‚àë‚á©a(p,n)‚àà‚Ä¶. f n p) = (‚àë‚á©ap | prime p. ‚àë‚á©an‚àà{p..}. f n p)"
    using summable2 by (subst infsetsum_Sigma) auto
  also have "(‚àë‚á©ap | prime p. ‚àë‚á©an‚àà{p..}. f n p) =
               (‚àë‚á©ap | prime p. ln (real p) / real p * hurwitz_zeta p s)"
    by (intro infsetsum_cong eq) auto
  finally show "eval_fds fds_newman s =
                  (‚àë‚á©ap | prime p. (ln (real p) / real p) * hurwitz_zeta p s)" .
qed


text ‚Äπ
  We now define a meromorphic continuation of $f(s)$ on $\mathfrak{R}(s) > \frac{1}{2}$.

  To construct $f(s)$, we express it as
  \[f(s) = \frac{1}{z-1}\left(\bar f(s) - \frac{\zeta'(s)}{\zeta(s)}\right)\ ,\]
  where $\bar f(s)$ (which we shall call ‚Äπpre_newman‚Ä∫) is a function that is analytic on
  $\Re(s) > \frac{1}{2}$, which can be shown fairly easily using the Weierstra{\ss} M test.
  
  $\zeta'(s)/\zeta(s)$ is meromorphic except for a single pole at $s = 1$ and one $k$-th order
  pole for any $k$-th order zero of $\zeta$, but for the Prime Number Theorem, we are only
  concerned with the area $\mathfrak{R}(s) \geq 1$, where $\zeta$ does not have any zeros.

  Taken together, this means that $f(s)$ is analytic for $\mathfrak{R}(s)\geq 1$ except for a
  double pole at $s = 1$, which we will take care of later.
‚Ä∫

context
  fixes A :: "nat ‚áí complex ‚áí complex" and B :: "nat ‚áí complex ‚áí complex"
  defines "A ‚â° (Œªp s. (s - 1) * pre_zeta (real p) s - 
                         of_nat p / (of_nat p powr s * (of_nat p powr s - 1)))"
  defines "B ‚â° (Œªp s. of_real (ln (real p)) / of_nat p * A p s)"
begin

definition pre_newman :: "complex ‚áí complex" where
  "pre_newman s = (‚àëp. if prime p then B p s else 0)"

definition newman where "newman s = 1 / (s - 1) * (pre_newman s - deriv zeta s / zeta s)"

text ‚Äπ
  The sum used in the definition of ‚Äπpre_newman‚Ä∫ converges uniformly on any disc within the
  half-space with $\mathfrak{R}(s) > \frac{1}{2}$ by the Weierstra{\ss} M test.
‚Ä∫
lemma uniform_limit_pre_newman:
  assumes r: "r ‚â• 0" "Re s - r > 1 / 2"
  shows "uniform_limit (cball s r)
           (Œªn s. ‚àëp<n. if prime p then B p s else 0) pre_newman at_top"
proof -
  from r have Re: "Re z > 1 / 2" if "dist s z ‚â§ r" for z
    using abs_Re_le_cmod[of "s - z"] r that
    by (auto simp: dist_norm abs_if split: if_splits)

  define x where "x = Re s - r" ‚Äï ‚ÄπThe lower bound for the real part in the disc‚Ä∫
  from r Re have "x > 1 / 2" by (auto simp: x_def)

  ‚Äï ‚ÄπThe following sequence ‚ÄπM‚Ä∫ bounds the summand, and it is obviously $O(n^{-1-\epsilon})$
      and therefore summable‚Ä∫
  define C where "C = (norm s + r + 1) * (norm s + r) / x"
  define M where "M = (Œªp::nat. ln p * (C / p powr (x + 1) + 1 / (p powr x * (p powr x - 1))))"

  show ?thesis unfolding pre_newman_def
  proof (intro Weierstrass_m_test_ev[OF eventually_mono[OF eventually_gt_at_top[of 1]]] ballI)
    show "summable M"
    proof (rule summable_comparison_test_bigo)
      define Œµ where "Œµ = min (2 * x - 1) x / 2"
      from ‚Äπx > 1 / 2‚Ä∫ have Œµ: "Œµ > 0" "1 + Œµ < 2 * x" "1 + Œµ < x + 1"
        by (auto simp: Œµ_def min_def field_simps)
      show "M ‚àà O(Œªn. n powr (- 1 - Œµ))" unfolding M_def distrib_left
        by (intro sum_in_bigo) (use Œµ in real_asymp)+
      from Œµ show "summable (Œªn. norm (n powr (- 1 - Œµ)))"
        by (simp add: summable_real_powr_iff)
    qed
  next
    fix p :: nat and z assume p: "p > 1" and z: "z ‚àà cball s r"
    from z r Re[of z] have x: "Re z ‚â• x" "x > 1 / 2" and "Re z > 1 / 2"
      using abs_Re_le_cmod[of "s - z"] by (auto simp: x_def algebra_simps dist_norm)
    have norm_z: "norm z ‚â§ norm s + r"
      using z norm_triangle_ineq2[of z s] r by (auto simp: dist_norm norm_minus_commute)
    from ‚Äπp > 1‚Ä∫ and x and r have "M p ‚â• 0"
      by (auto simp: C_def M_def intro!: mult_nonneg_nonneg add_nonneg_nonneg divide_nonneg_pos)

    have bound: "norm ((z - 1) * pre_zeta p z) ‚â§ 
                   norm (z - 1) * (norm z / (Re z * p powr Re z))"
      using pre_zeta_bound'[of z p] p ‚ÄπRe z > 1 / 2‚Ä∫
      unfolding norm_mult by (intro mult_mono pre_zeta_bound) auto

    have "norm (B p z) = ln p / p * norm (A p z)"
      unfolding B_def using ‚Äπp > 1‚Ä∫ by (simp add: B_def norm_mult norm_divide)
    also have "‚Ä¶ ‚â§ ln p / p * (norm (z - 1) * norm z / Re z / p powr Re z + 
                                 p / (p powr Re z * (p powr Re z - 1)))"
      unfolding A_def using ‚Äπp > 1‚Ä∫ and ‚ÄπRe z > 1 / 2‚Ä∫ and bound
      by (intro mult_left_mono order.trans[OF norm_triangle_ineq4 add_mono] mult_left_mono)
         (auto simp: norm_divide norm_mult norm_powr_real_powr
               intro!: divide_left_mono order.trans[OF _ norm_triangle_ineq2])
    also have "‚Ä¶ = ln p * (norm (z - 1) * norm z / Re z / p powr (Re z + 1) + 
                            1 / (p powr Re z * (p powr Re z - 1)))"
      using ‚Äπp > 1‚Ä∫ by (simp add: field_simps powr_add powr_minus)
    also have "norm (z - 1) * norm z / Re z / p powr (Re z + 1) ‚â§ C / p powr (x + 1)"
      unfolding C_def using r ‚ÄπRe z > 1 / 2‚Ä∫ norm_z p x
      by (intro mult_mono frac_le powr_mono order.trans[OF norm_triangle_ineq4]) auto
    also have "1 / (p powr Re z * (p powr Re z - 1)) ‚â§
                 1 / (p powr x * (p powr x - 1))" using ‚Äπp > 1‚Ä∫ x
      by (intro divide_left_mono mult_mono powr_mono diff_right_mono mult_pos_pos)
         (auto simp: ge_one_powr_ge_zero)
    finally have "norm (B p z) ‚â§ M p"
      using ‚Äπp > 1‚Ä∫ by (simp add: mult_left_mono M_def)
    with ‚ÄπM p ‚â• 0‚Ä∫ show "norm (if prime p then B p z else 0) ‚â§ M p" by simp
  qed
qed

lemma sums_pre_newman: "Re s > 1 / 2 ‚üπ (Œªp. if prime p then B p s else 0) sums pre_newman s"
  using tendsto_uniform_limitI[OF uniform_limit_pre_newman[of 0 s]] by (auto simp: sums_def)

lemma analytic_pre_newman [THEN analytic_on_subset, analytic_intros]:
  "pre_newman analytic_on {s. Re s > 1 / 2}"
proof -
  have holo: "(Œªs::complex. if prime p then B p s else 0) holomorphic_on X"
    if "X ‚äÜ {s. Re s > 1 / 2}" for X and p :: nat using that
    by (cases "prime p")
       (auto intro!: holomorphic_intros simp: B_def A_def dest!: prime_gt_1_nat)
  have holo': "pre_newman holomorphic_on ball s r" if r: "r ‚â• 0" "Re s - r > 1 / 2" for s r
  proof -
    from r have Re: "Re z > 1 / 2" if "dist s z ‚â§ r" for z
      using abs_Re_le_cmod[of "s - z"] r that by (auto simp: dist_norm abs_if split: if_splits)
    show ?thesis
      by (rule holomorphic_uniform_limit[OF _ uniform_limit_pre_newman[of r s]])
         (insert that Re, auto intro!: always_eventually holomorphic_on_imp_continuous_on
                                       holomorphic_intros holo)
  qed
  show ?thesis unfolding analytic_on_def
  proof safe
    fix s assume "Re s > 1 / 2"
    thus "‚àÉr>0. pre_newman holomorphic_on ball s r"
      by (intro exI[of _ "(Re s - 1 / 2) / 2"] conjI holo') (auto simp: field_simps)
  qed
qed

lemma holomorphic_pre_newman [holomorphic_intros]:
  "X ‚äÜ {s. Re s > 1 / 2} ‚üπ pre_newman holomorphic_on X"
  using analytic_pre_newman by (rule analytic_imp_holomorphic)

lemma eval_fds_newman:
  assumes s: "Re s > 1"
  shows   "eval_fds fds_newman s = newman s"
proof -
  have eq: "(ln (real p) / real p) * hurwitz_zeta p s =
              1 / (s - 1) * (ln (real p) / (p powr s - 1) + B p s)"
    if p: "prime p" for p
  proof -
    have "(ln (real p) / real p) * hurwitz_zeta p s =
            ln (real p) / real p * (p powr (1 - s) / (s - 1) + pre_zeta p s)"
      using s by (auto simp add: hurwitz_zeta_def)
    also have "‚Ä¶ = 1 / (s - 1) * (ln (real p) / (p powr s - 1) + B p s)"
      using p s by (simp add: divide_simps powr_diff B_def)
                   (auto simp: A_def field_simps dest: prime_gt_1_nat)?
    finally show ?thesis .
  qed

  have "(Œªp. (ln (real p) / real p) * hurwitz_zeta p s) abs_summable_on {p. prime p}"
    using s by (intro eval_fds_newman_conv_infsetsum)
  hence "(Œªp. 1 / (s - 1) * (ln (real p) / (p powr s - 1) + B p s))
            abs_summable_on {p. prime p}"
    by (subst (asm) abs_summable_on_cong[OF eq refl]) auto
  hence summable:
    "(Œªp. ln (real p) / (p powr s - 1) + B p s) abs_summable_on {p. prime p}"
    using s by (subst (asm) abs_summable_on_cmult_right_iff) auto

  from s have [simp]: "s ‚â† 1" by auto
  have "eval_fds fds_newman s =
          (‚àë‚á©ap | prime p. (ln (real p) / real p) * hurwitz_zeta p s)"
    using s by (rule eval_fds_newman_conv_infsetsum)
  also have "‚Ä¶ = (‚àë‚á©ap | prime p. 1 / (s - 1) * (ln (real p) / (p powr s - 1) + B p s))"
    by (intro infsetsum_cong eq) auto
  also have "‚Ä¶ = 1 / (s - 1) * (‚àë‚á©ap | prime p. ln (real p) / (p powr s - 1) + B p s)"
    (is "_ = _ * ?S") by (rule infsetsum_cmult_right[OF summable])
  also have "?S = (‚àëp. if prime p then 
                      ln (real p) / (p powr s - 1) + B p s else 0)"
    by (subst infsetsum_nat[OF summable]) auto
  also have "‚Ä¶ = (‚àëp. (if prime p then ln (real p) / (p powr s - 1) else 0) + 
                        (if prime p then B p s else 0))"
    by (intro suminf_cong) auto
  also have "‚Ä¶ = pre_newman s - deriv zeta s / zeta s"
    using sums_pre_newman[of s] sums_logderiv_zeta[of s] s
    by (subst suminf_add [symmetric]) (auto simp: sums_iff)
  finally show ?thesis by (simp add: newman_def)
qed

end

text ‚Äπ
  Next, we shall attempt to get rid of the pole by subtracting suitable multiples of $\zeta(s)$
  and $\zeta'(s)$. To this end, we shall first prove the following alternative definition of 
  $\zeta'(s)$:
‚Ä∫
lemma deriv_zeta_eq':
  assumes "0 < Re s" "s ‚â† 1"
  shows "deriv zeta s = deriv (Œªz. pre_zeta 1 z * (z - 1)) s / (s - 1) -
                          (pre_zeta 1 s * (s - 1) + 1) / (s - 1)‚áß2"
    (is "_ = ?rhs")
proof (rule DERIV_imp_deriv)
  have [derivative_intros]: "(pre_zeta 1 has_field_derivative deriv (pre_zeta 1) s) (at s)"
    by (intro holomorphic_derivI[of _ UNIV] holomorphic_intros) auto
  have *: "deriv (Œªz. pre_zeta 1 z * (z - 1)) s = deriv (pre_zeta 1) s * (s - 1) + pre_zeta 1 s"
    by (subst deriv_mult)
       (auto intro!: holomorphic_on_imp_differentiable_at[of _ UNIV] holomorphic_intros)
  hence "((Œªs. pre_zeta 1 s + 1 / (s - 1)) has_field_derivative
           deriv (pre_zeta 1) s - 1 / ((s - 1) * (s - 1))) (at s)"
    using assms by (auto intro!: derivative_eq_intros)
  also have "deriv (pre_zeta 1) s - 1 / ((s - 1) * (s - 1)) = ?rhs"
    using * assms by (simp add: divide_simps power2_eq_square, simp add: field_simps)
  also have "((Œªs. pre_zeta 1 s + 1 / (s - 1)) has_field_derivative ?rhs) (at s) ‚ü∑
               (zeta has_field_derivative ?rhs) (at s)"
    using assms
    by (intro has_field_derivative_cong_ev eventually_mono[OF t1_space_nhds[of _ 1]])
       (auto simp: zeta_def hurwitz_zeta_def)
  finally show ‚Ä¶ .
qed

text ‚Äπ
  From this, it follows that $(s - 1) \zeta'(s) - \zeta'(s) / \zeta(s)$ is analytic 
  for $\mathfrak{R}(s) \geq 1$:
‚Ä∫
lemma analytic_zeta_derivdiff:
  obtains a where
    "(Œªz. if z = 1 then a else (z - 1) * deriv zeta z - deriv zeta z / zeta z)
          analytic_on {s. Re s ‚â• 1}" 
proof 
  have neq: "pre_zeta 1 z * (z - 1) + 1 ‚â† 0" if "Re z ‚â• 1" for z
    using zeta_Re_ge_1_nonzero[of z] that
    by (cases "z = 1") (auto simp: zeta_def hurwitz_zeta_def divide_simps)
  let ?g = "Œªz. (1 - inverse (pre_zeta 1 z * (z - 1) + 1)) * ((z - 1) *
                deriv ((Œªu. pre_zeta 1 u * (u - 1))) z - (pre_zeta 1 z * (z - 1) + 1))"
  show "(Œªz. if z = 1 then deriv ?g 1 else (z - 1) * deriv zeta z - deriv zeta z / zeta z)
          analytic_on {s. Re s ‚â• 1}" (is "?f analytic_on _")
  proof (rule pole_theorem_analytic_0)
    show "?g analytic_on {s. 1 ‚â§ Re s}" using neq
      by (auto intro!: analytic_intros)
  next
    show "‚àÉd>0. ‚àÄw‚ààball z d - {1}. ?g w = (w - 1) * ?f w"
      if z: "z ‚àà {s. 1 ‚â§ Re s}" for z
    proof -
      have *: "isCont (Œªz. pre_zeta 1 z * (z - 1) + 1) z"
        by (auto intro!: continuous_intros)
       obtain e where "e > 0" and e: "‚ãÄy. dist z y < e ‚üπ pre_zeta (Suc 0) y * (y-1) + 1 ‚â† 0"
         using continuous_at_avoid [OF * neq[of z]] z by auto
      show ?thesis
      proof (intro exI ballI conjI)
        fix w
        assume w: "w ‚àà ball z (min e 1) - {1}"
        then have "Re w > 0"
          using complex_Re_le_cmod [of "z-w"] z by (simp add: dist_norm)
        with w show "?g w = (w - 1) * (if w = 1 then deriv ?g 1 else
                        (w - 1) * deriv zeta w - deriv zeta w / zeta w)"
          by (subst (1 2) deriv_zeta_eq', 
              simp_all add: zeta_def hurwitz_zeta_def divide_simps e power2_eq_square)
             (simp_all add: algebra_simps)?
      qed (use ‚Äπe > 0‚Ä∫ in auto)
    qed
  qed auto
qed

text ‚Äπ
  Finally, $f(s) + \zeta'(s) + c\zeta(s)$ is analytic.
‚Ä∫
lemma analytic_newman_variant:
  obtains c a where
     "(Œªz. if z = 1 then a else newman z + deriv zeta z + c * zeta z) analytic_on {s. Re s ‚â• 1}"
proof -
  obtain c where (* -euler_mascheroni *)
    c: "(Œªz. if z = 1 then c else (z - 1) * deriv zeta z - deriv zeta z / zeta z)
        analytic_on {s. Re s ‚â• 1}"
    using analytic_zeta_derivdiff by blast
  let ?g = "Œªz. pre_newman z +
          (if z = 1 then c
           else (z - 1) * deriv zeta z -
                deriv zeta z / zeta z) - (c + pre_newman 1) * (pre_zeta 1 z * (z - 1) + 1)"
  have "(Œªz. if z = 1 then deriv ?g 1 else newman z + deriv zeta z + (-(c + pre_newman 1)) * zeta z)
        analytic_on {s. Re s ‚â• 1}"  (is "?f analytic_on _")
  proof (rule pole_theorem_analytic_0)
    show "?g analytic_on {s. 1 ‚â§ Re s}"
      by (intro c analytic_intros) auto
  next
    show "‚àÉd>0. ‚àÄw‚ààball z d - {1}. ?g w = (w - 1) * ?f w"
      if "z ‚àà {s. 1 ‚â§ Re s}" for z using that
      by (intro exI[of _ 1], simp_all add: newman_def divide_simps zeta_def hurwitz_zeta_def)
         (auto simp: field_simps)?
  qed auto
  with that show ?thesis by blast
qed


subsection ‚ÄπThe asymptotic expansion of ‚Äπùîê‚Ä∫‚Ä∫

text ‚Äπ
  Our next goal is to show the key result that $\mathfrak{M}(x) = \ln n + c + o(1)$.

  As a first step, we invoke Ingham's Tauberian theorem on the function we have
  just defined and obtain that the sum
  \[\sum\limits_{n=1}^\infty \frac{\mathfrak{M}(n) - \ln n + c}{n}\]
  exists.
‚Ä∫
lemma mertens_summable:
  obtains c :: real where "summable (Œªn. (ùîê n - ln n + c) / n)"
proof -
  (* c = euler_mascheroni - pre_newman 1 *)
  from analytic_newman_variant obtain c a where
    analytic: "(Œªz. if z = 1 then a else newman z + deriv zeta z + c * zeta z)
                 analytic_on {s. Re s ‚â• 1}" .
  define f where "f = (Œªz. if z = 1 then a else newman z + deriv zeta z + c * zeta z)"
  have analytic: "f analytic_on {s. Re s ‚â• 1}" using analytic by (simp add: f_def)
  define F where "F = fds_newman + fds_deriv fds_zeta + fds_const c * fds_zeta"

  note le = conv_abscissa_add_leI conv_abscissa_deriv_le conv_abscissa_newman conv_abscissa_mult_const_left
  note intros = le le[THEN le_less_trans] le[THEN order.trans] fds_converges
  have eval_F: "eval_fds F s = f s" if s: "Re s > 1" for s
  proof -
    have "eval_fds F s = eval_fds (fds_newman + fds_deriv fds_zeta) s +
                           eval_fds (fds_const c * fds_zeta) s"
      unfolding F_def using s by (subst eval_fds_add) (auto intro!: intros)
    also have "‚Ä¶ = f s" using s unfolding f_def
      by (subst eval_fds_add)
         (auto intro!: intros simp: eval_fds_newman eval_fds_deriv_zeta eval_fds_mult eval_fds_zeta)
    finally show ?thesis .
  qed

  have conv: "fds_converges F s" if "Re s ‚â• 1" for s
  proof (rule Newman_Ingham_1)
    have "(Œªn. ùîê (real n) - ln (real n)) ‚àà O(Œª_. 1)"
      using mertens_bounded by (rule landau_o.big.compose) real_asymp
    from natfun_bigo_1E[OF this, of 1]
      obtain c' where c': "c' ‚â• 1" "‚ãÄn. ¬¶ùîê (real n) - ln (real n)¬¶ ‚â§ c'" by auto
    have "Bseq (fds_nth F)"
    proof (intro BseqI allI)
      fix n :: nat
      show "norm (fds_nth F n) ‚â§ (c' + norm c)" unfolding F_def using c'
        by (auto simp: fds_nth_zeta fds_nth_deriv fds_nth_newman scaleR_conv_of_real in_Reals_norm
                 intro!: order.trans[OF norm_triangle_ineq] add_mono)
    qed (insert c', auto intro: add_pos_nonneg)
    thus "fds_nth F ‚àà O(Œª_. 1)" by (simp add: natfun_bigo_iff_Bseq)
  next
    show "f analytic_on {s. Re s ‚â• 1}" by fact
  next
    show "eval_fds F s = f s" if "Re s > 1" for s using that by (rule eval_F)
  qed (insert that, auto simp: F_def intro!: intros)
  from conv[of 1] have "summable (Œªn. fds_nth F n / of_nat n)"
    unfolding fds_converges_def by auto
  also have "?this ‚ü∑ summable (Œªn. (ùîê n - Ln n + c) / n)"
    by (intro summable_cong eventually_mono[OF eventually_gt_at_top[of 0]])
       (auto simp: F_def fds_nth_newman fds_nth_deriv fds_nth_zeta scaleR_conv_of_real
             intro!: sum.cong dest: prime_gt_0_nat)
  finally have "summable (Œªn. (ùîê n - Re (Ln (of_nat n)) + Re c) / n)"
    by (auto dest: summable_Re)
  also have "?this ‚ü∑ summable (Œªn. (ùîê n - ln n + Re c) / n)"
    by (intro summable_cong eventually_mono[OF eventually_gt_at_top[of 0]]) (auto intro!: sum.cong)
  finally show ?thesis using that[of "Re c"] by blast
qed

text ‚Äπ
  Next, we prove a lemma given by Newman stating that if the sum $\sum a_n / n$ exists and
  $a_n + \ln n$ is nondecreasing, then $a_n$ must tend to 0. Unfortunately, the proof is
  rather tedious, but so is the paper version by Newman.
‚Ä∫
lemma sum_goestozero_lemma:
  fixes d::real
  assumes d: "¬¶‚àëi = M..N. a i / i¬¶ < d" and le: "‚ãÄn. a n + ln n ‚â§ a (Suc n) + ln (Suc n)"
      and "0 < M" "M < N"
    shows "a M ‚â§ d * N / (real N - real M) + (real N - real M) / M ‚àß
          -a N ‚â§ d * N / (real N - real M) + (real N - real M) / M"
proof -
  have "0 ‚â§ d"
    using assms by linarith+
  then have "0 ‚â§ d * N / (N - M + 1)" by simp
  then have le_dN: "‚ü¶0 ‚â§ x ‚üπ x ‚â§ d * N / (N - M + 1)‚üß ‚üπ x ‚â§ d * N / (N - M + 1)" for x::real
    by linarith
  have le_a_ln: "a m + ln m ‚â§ a n + ln n" if "n ‚â• m" for n m
    by (rule transitive_stepwise_le) (use le that in auto)
  have *: "x ‚â§ b ‚àß y ‚â§ b" if "a ‚â§ b" "x ‚â§ a" "y ‚â§ a" for a b x y::real
    using that by linarith
  show ?thesis
  proof (rule *)
    show "d * N / (N - M) + ln (N / M) ‚â§ d * N / (real N - real M) + (real N - real M) / M"
      using ‚Äπ0 < M‚Ä∫ ‚ÄπM < N‚Ä∫ ln_le_minus_one [of "N / M"]
      by (simp add: of_nat_diff) (simp add: divide_simps)
  next
    have "a M - ln (N / M) ‚â§ (d * N) / (N - M + 1)"
    proof (rule le_dN)
      assume 0: "0 ‚â§ a M - ln (N / M)"
      have "(Suc N - M) * (a M - ln (N / M)) / N = (‚àëi = M..N. (a M - ln (N / M)) / N)"
        by simp
      also have "‚Ä¶ ‚â§ (‚àëi = M..N. a i / i)"
      proof (rule sum_mono)
        fix i
        assume i: "i ‚àà {M..N}"
        with ‚Äπ0 < M‚Ä∫ have "0 < i" by auto
        have "(a M - ln (N / M)) / N ‚â§ (a M - ln (N / M)) / i"
          using 0 using i ‚Äπ0 < M‚Ä∫ by (simp add: frac_le_eq divide_simps mult_left_mono)
        also have "a M + ln (real M) ‚â§ a i + ln (real N)"
          by (rule order.trans[OF le_a_ln[of M i]]) (use i assms in auto)
        hence "(a M - ln (N / M)) / i ‚â§ a i / real i"
          using assms i by (intro divide_right_mono) (auto simp: ln_div field_simps)
        finally show "(a M - ln (N / M)) / real N ‚â§ a i / real i" .
      qed
      finally have "((Suc N) - M) * (a M - ln (N / M)) / N ‚â§ ¬¶‚àëi = M..N. a i / i¬¶"
        by simp
      also have "‚Ä¶ ‚â§ d" using d by simp
      finally have "((Suc N) - M) * (a M - ln (N / M)) / N ‚â§ d" .
      then show ?thesis
        using ‚ÄπM < N‚Ä∫  by (simp add: of_nat_diff field_simps)
    qed
    also have "‚Ä¶ ‚â§ d * N / (N - M)"
      using assms(1,4) by (simp add: field_simps)
    finally show "a M ‚â§ d * N / (N - M) + ln (N / M)" by simp
  next
    have "- a N - ln (N / M) ‚â§ (d * N) / (N - M + 1)"
    proof (rule le_dN)
      assume 0: "0 ‚â§ - a N - ln (N / M)"
      have "(‚àëi = M..N. a i / i) ‚â§ (‚àëi = M..N. (a N + ln (N / M)) / N)"
      proof (rule sum_mono)
        fix i
        assume i: "i ‚àà {M..N}"
        with ‚Äπ0 < M‚Ä∫ have "0 < i" by auto
        have "a i + ln (real M) ‚â§ a N + ln (real N)"
          by (rule order.trans[OF _ le_a_ln[of i N]]) (use i assms in auto)
        hence "a i / i ‚â§ (a N + ln (N / M)) / i"
          using assms(3,4) by (intro divide_right_mono) (auto simp: field_simps ln_div)
        also have "‚Ä¶ ‚â§ (a N + ln (N / M)) / N"
          using i ‚Äπi > 0‚Ä∫ 0 by (intro divide_left_mono_neg) auto
        finally show "a i / i ‚â§ (a N + ln (N / M)) / N" .
      qed
      also have "‚Ä¶ = ((Suc N) - M) * (a N + ln (N / M)) / N"
        by simp
      finally have "(‚àëi = M..N. a i / i) ‚â§ (real (Suc N) - real M) * (a N + ln (N / M)) / N"
        using ‚ÄπM < N‚Ä∫ by (simp add: of_nat_diff)
      then have "-((real (Suc N) - real M) * (a N + ln (N / M)) / N) ‚â§ ¬¶‚àëi = M..N. a i / i¬¶"
        by linarith
      also have "‚Ä¶ ‚â§ d" using d by simp
      finally have "- ((real (Suc N) - real M) * (a N + ln (N / M)) / N) ‚â§ d" .
      then show ?thesis
        using ‚ÄπM < N‚Ä∫  by (simp add: of_nat_diff field_simps)
    qed
    also have "‚Ä¶ ‚â§ d * N / real (N - M)"
      using ‚Äπ0 < M‚Ä∫ ‚ÄπM < N‚Ä∫ ‚Äπ0 ‚â§ d‚Ä∫ by (simp add: field_simps)
    finally show "-a N ‚â§ d * N / real (N - M) + ln (N / M)" by simp
  qed
qed

proposition sum_goestozero_theorem:
  assumes summ: "summable (Œªi. a i / i)"
      and le:   "‚ãÄn. a n + ln n ‚â§ a (Suc n) + ln (Suc n)"
    shows "a ‚á¢ 0"
proof (clarsimp simp: lim_sequentially)
  fix r::real
  assume "r > 0"
  have *: "‚àÉn0. ‚àÄn‚â•n0. ¬¶a n¬¶ < Œµ" if Œµ: "0 < Œµ" "Œµ < 1" for Œµ
  proof -
    have "0 < (Œµ / 8)‚áß2" using ‚Äπ0 < Œµ‚Ä∫  by simp
    then obtain N0 where N0: "‚ãÄm n. m ‚â• N0 ‚üπ norm (‚àëk=m..n. (Œªi. a i / i) k) < (Œµ / 8)‚áß2"
      by (metis summable_partial_sum_bound summ)
    obtain N1 where "real N1 > 4 / Œµ"
      using reals_Archimedean2[of "4 / Œµ"] Œµ by auto
    hence "N1 ‚â† 0" and N1: "1 / real N1 < Œµ / 4" using Œµ
      by (auto simp: divide_simps mult_ac intro: Nat.gr0I)

    have "¬¶a n¬¶ < Œµ" if n: "n ‚â• 2 * N0 + N1 + 7" for n
    proof -
      define k where "k = ‚åän * Œµ/4‚åã"
      have "n * Œµ / 4 > 1" and "n * Œµ / 4 ‚â§ n / 4" and "n / 4 < n"
        using less_le_trans[OF N1, of "n / N1 * Œµ / 4"] ‚ÄπN1 ‚â† 0‚Ä∫ Œµ n by (auto simp: field_simps)
      hence k: "k > 0" "4 * k ‚â§ n" "nat k < n" "(n * Œµ / 4) - 1 < k" "k ‚â§ (n * Œµ / 4)"
        unfolding k_def by linarith+

      have "-a n < Œµ"
      proof -
        have "N0 ‚â§ n - nat k"
          using n k by linarith
        then have *: "¬¶‚àëk = n - nat k .. n. a k / k¬¶ < (Œµ / 8)‚áß2"
          using N0 [of "n - nat k" n] by simp
        have "-a n ‚â§ (Œµ / 8)‚áß2 * n / ‚åän * Œµ / 4‚åã + ‚åän * Œµ / 4‚åã / (n - k)"
          using sum_goestozero_lemma [OF * le, THEN conjunct2] k by (simp add: of_nat_diff k_def)
        also have "‚Ä¶< Œµ"
        proof -
          have "Œµ / 16 * n / k < 2"
            using k by (auto simp: field_simps)
          then have "Œµ * (Œµ / 16 * n / k) < Œµ * 2"
            using Œµ mult_less_cancel_left_pos by blast
          then have "(Œµ / 8)‚áß2 * n / k < Œµ / 2"
            by (simp add: field_simps power2_eq_square)
          moreover have "k / (n - k) < Œµ / 2"
          proof -
            have "(Œµ + 2) * k < 4 * k" using k Œµ by simp
            also have "‚Ä¶ ‚â§ Œµ * real n" using k by (auto simp: field_simps)
            finally show ?thesis using k by (auto simp: field_simps)
          qed
          ultimately show ?thesis unfolding k_def by linarith
        qed
        finally show ?thesis .
      qed
      moreover have "a n < Œµ"
      proof -
        have "N0 ‚â§ n" using n k by linarith
        then have *: "¬¶‚àëk = n .. n + nat k. a k / k¬¶ < (Œµ/8)‚áß2"
          using N0 [of n "n + nat k"] by simp
        have "a n ‚â§ (Œµ/8)‚áß2 * (n + nat k) / k + k / n"
          using sum_goestozero_lemma [OF * le, THEN conjunct1] k by (simp add: of_nat_diff)
        also have "‚Ä¶< Œµ"
        proof -
          have "4 ‚â§ 28 * real_of_int k" using k by linarith
          then have "Œµ/16 * n / k < 2" using k by (auto simp: field_simps)
          have "Œµ * (real n + k) < 32 * k"
          proof -
            have "Œµ * n / 4 < k + 1" by (simp add: mult.commute k_def)
            then have "Œµ * n < 4 * k + 4" by (simp add: divide_simps)
            also have "‚Ä¶ ‚â§ 8 * k" using k by auto
            finally have 1: "Œµ * real n < 8 * k" .
            have 2: "Œµ * k < k" using k Œµ by simp
            show ?thesis using k add_strict_mono [OF 1 2] by (simp add: algebra_simps)
        qed
          then have "(Œµ / 8)‚áß2 * real (n + nat k) / k < Œµ / 2"
            using Œµ k by (simp add: divide_simps mult_less_0_iff power2_eq_square)
          moreover have "k / n < Œµ / 2"
            using k Œµ by (auto simp: k_def field_simps)
          ultimately show ?thesis by linarith
        qed
        finally show ?thesis .
      qed
      ultimately show ?thesis by force
    qed
    then show ?thesis by blast
  qed
  show "‚àÉn0. ‚àÄn‚â•n0. ¬¶a n¬¶ < r"
    using * [of "min r (1/5)"] ‚Äπ0 < r‚Ä∫ by force
qed


text ‚Äπ
  This leads us to the main intermediate result:
‚Ä∫
lemma Mertens_convergent: "convergent (Œªn::nat. ùîê n - ln n)"
proof -
  obtain c where c: "summable (Œªn. (ùîê n - ln n + c) / n)"
    by (blast intro: mertens_summable)
  then obtain l where l: "(Œªn. (ùîê n - ln n + c) / n) sums l"
    by (auto simp: summable_def)
  have *: "(Œªn. ùîê n - ln n + c) ‚á¢ 0"
    by (rule sum_goestozero_theorem[OF c]) auto
  hence "(Œªn. ùîê n - ln n) ‚á¢ -c"
    by (simp add: tendsto_iff dist_norm)
  thus ?thesis by (rule convergentI)
qed

corollary ùîê_minus_ln_limit:
  obtains c where "((Œªx::real. ùîê x - ln x) ‚§è c) at_top"
proof -
  from Mertens_convergent obtain c where "(Œªn. ùîê n - ln n) ‚á¢ c"
    by (auto simp: convergent_def)
  hence 1: "((Œªx::real. ùîê (nat ‚åäx‚åã) - ln (nat ‚åäx‚åã)) ‚§è c) at_top" 
    by (rule filterlim_compose) real_asymp
  have 2: "((Œªx::real. ln (nat ‚åäx‚åã) - ln x) ‚§è 0) at_top"
    by real_asymp
  have 3: "((Œªx. ùîê x - ln x) ‚§è c) at_top"
    using tendsto_add[OF 1 2] by simp
  with that show ?thesis by blast
qed


subsection ‚ÄπThe asymptotics of the prime-counting functions‚Ä∫

text ‚Äπ
  We will now use the above result to prove the asymptotics of the prime-counting functions
  $\vartheta(x) \sim x$, $\psi(x) \sim x$, and $\pi(x) \sim x / \ln x$. The last of these is 
  typically called the Prime Number Theorem, but since these functions can be expressed in terms 
  of one another quite easily, knowing the asymptotics of any of them immediately gives the 
  asymptotics of the other ones.

  In this sense, all of the above are equivalent formulations of the Prime Number Theorem.
  The one we shall tackle first, due to its strong connection to the $\mathfrak{M}$ function, is
  $\vartheta(x) \sim x$.

  We know that $\mathfrak{M}(x)$ has the asymptotic expansion
  $\mathfrak{M}(x) = \ln x + c + o(1)$. We also know that
  \[\vartheta(x) = x\mathfrak{M}(x) - \int\nolimits_2^x \mathfrak{M}(t) \,\mathrm{d}t\ .\]
  Substituting in the above asymptotic equation, we obtain:
  \begin{align*}
  \vartheta(x) &= x\ln x + cx + o(x) - \int\nolimits_2^x \ln t + c + o(1) \,\mathrm{d}t\\
            &= x\ln x + cx + o(x) - (x\ln x - x + cx + o(x))\\
            &= x + o(x)
  \end{align*}
  In conclusion, $\vartheta(x) \sim x$.
‚Ä∫
theorem Œ∏_asymptotics: "Œ∏ ‚àº[at_top] (Œªx. x)"
proof -
  from ùîê_minus_ln_limit obtain c where c: "((Œªx. ùîê x - ln x) ‚§è c) at_top"
    by auto
  define r where "r = (Œªx. ùîê x - ln x - c)"
  have ùîê_expand: "ùîê = (Œªx. ln x + c + r x)"
    by (simp add: r_def)
  have r: "r ‚àà o(Œª_. 1)" unfolding r_def
    using tendsto_add[OF c tendsto_const[of "-c"]] by (intro smalloI_tendsto) auto

  define r' where "r' = (Œªx. integral {2..x} r)"
  have integrable_r: "r integrable_on {x..y}"
    if "2 ‚â§ x" for x y :: real using that unfolding r_def
    by (intro integrable_diff integrable_primes_M)
       (auto intro!: integrable_continuous_real continuous_intros)
  hence integral: "(r has_integral r' x) {2..x}" if "x ‚â• 2" for x
    by (auto simp: has_integral_iff r'_def)
  have r': "r' ‚àà o(Œªx. x)" using integrable_r unfolding r'_def
    by (intro integral_smallo[OF r]) (auto simp: filterlim_ident)

  define C where "C = 2 * (c + ln 2 - 1)"
  have "Œ∏ ‚àº[at_top] (Œªx. x + (r x * x + C - r' x))"
  proof (intro asymp_equiv_refl_ev eventually_mono[OF eventually_gt_at_top])
    fix x :: real assume x: "x > 2"
    have "(ùîê has_integral ((x * ln x - x + c * x) - (2 * ln 2 - 2 + c * 2) + r' x)) {2..x}"
      unfolding ùîê_expand using x
      by (intro has_integral_add[OF fundamental_theorem_of_calculus integral])
         (auto simp flip: has_field_derivative_iff_has_vector_derivative
               intro!: derivative_eq_intros continuous_intros)
    from has_integral_unique[OF Œ∏_conv_ùîê_integral this]
      show "Œ∏ x = x + (r x * x + C - r' x)" using x
      by (simp add: field_simps ùîê_expand C_def)
  qed
  also have "(Œªx. r x * x + C - r' x) ‚àà o(Œªx. x)"
  proof (intro sum_in_smallo r)
    show "(Œª_. C) ‚àà o(Œªx. x)" by real_asymp
  qed (insert landau_o.small_big_mult[OF r, of "Œªx. x"] r', simp_all)
  hence "(Œªx. x + (r x * x + C - r' x)) ‚àº[at_top] (Œªx. x)"
    by (subst asymp_equiv_add_right) auto
  finally show ?thesis by auto
qed

text ‚Äπ
  The various other forms of the Prime Number Theorem follow as simple corollaries.
‚Ä∫
corollary œà_asymptotics: "œà ‚àº[at_top] (Œªx. x)"
  using Œ∏_asymptotics PNT4_imp_PNT5 by simp
  
corollary prime_number_theorem: "œÄ ‚àº[at_top] (Œªx. x / ln x)"
  using Œ∏_asymptotics PNT4_imp_PNT1 by simp

corollary ln_œÄ_asymptotics: "(Œªx. ln (œÄ x)) ‚àº[at_top] ln"
  using prime_number_theorem PNT1_imp_PNT1' by simp

corollary œÄ_ln_œÄ_asymptotics: "(Œªx. œÄ x * ln (œÄ x)) ‚àº[at_top] (Œªx. x)"
  using prime_number_theorem PNT1_imp_PNT2 by simp

corollary nth_prime_asymptotics: "(Œªn. real (nth_prime n)) ‚àº[at_top] (Œªn. real n * ln (real n))"
  using œÄ_ln_œÄ_asymptotics PNT2_imp_PNT3 by simp


text ‚Äπ
  The following versions use a little less notation.
‚Ä∫
corollary prime_number_theorem': "((Œªx. œÄ x / (x / ln x)) ‚§è 1) at_top"
  using prime_number_theorem
  by (rule asymp_equivD_strong[OF _ eventually_mono[OF eventually_gt_at_top[of 1]]]) auto

corollary prime_number_theorem'':
  "(Œªx. card {p. prime p ‚àß real p ‚â§ x}) ‚àº[at_top] (Œªx. x / ln x)"
proof -
  have "œÄ = (Œªx. card {p. prime p ‚àß real p ‚â§ x})"
    by (intro ext) (simp add: œÄ_def prime_sum_upto_def)
  with prime_number_theorem show ?thesis by simp
qed

corollary prime_number_theorem''':
  "(Œªn. card {p. prime p ‚àß p ‚â§ n}) ‚àº[at_top] (Œªn. real n / ln (real n))"
proof -
  have "(Œªn. card {p. prime p ‚àß real p ‚â§ real n}) ‚àº[at_top] (Œªn. real n / ln (real n))"
    using prime_number_theorem''
    by (rule asymp_equiv_compose') (simp add: filterlim_real_sequentially)
  thus ?thesis by simp
qed

(*<*)
unbundle no_prime_counting_notation
(*>*)

end

Theory Mertens_Theorems

(*
  File:     Mertens_Theorems.thy
  Author:   Manuel Eberl (TU M√ºnchen)

*)
section ‚ÄπMertens' Theorems‚Ä∫
theory Mertens_Theorems
imports
  Prime_Counting_Functions
  "Stirling_Formula.Stirling_Formula"
begin

(*<*)
unbundle prime_counting_notation
(*>*)

text ‚Äπ
  In this section, we will prove Mertens' First and Second Theorem. These are weaker results
  than the Prime Number Theorem, and we will derive them without using it.

  However, like Mertens himself, we will not only prove them ‚àó‚Äπasymptotically‚Ä∫, but ‚àó‚Äπabsolutely‚Ä∫.
  This means that we will show that the remainder terms are not only ``Big-O'' of some bound, but
  we will give concrete (and reasonably tight) upper and lower bounds for them that hold on the 
  entire domain. This makes the proofs a bit more tedious.
‚Ä∫

subsection ‚ÄπAbsolute Bounds for Mertens' First Theorem‚Ä∫

text ‚Äπ
  We have already shown the asymptotic form of Mertens' first theorem, i.\,e.\ 
  $\mathfrak{M}(n) = \ln n + O(1)$. We now want to obtain some absolute bounds on the $O(1)$
  remainder term using a more careful derivation than before.

  The precise bounds we will show are
  $\mathfrak {M}(n) - \ln n \in (-1-\frac{9}{\pi^2}; \ln 4] \approx (-1.9119; 1.3863]$ for
  ‚Äπn ‚àà ‚Ñï‚Ä∫.

  First, we need a simple lemma on the finiteness of exponents to consider in a sum
  of all prime powers up to a certain point:
‚Ä∫
lemma exponents_le_finite:
  assumes "p > (1 :: nat)" "k > 0"
  shows   "finite {i. real (p ^ (k * i + l)) ‚â§ x}"
proof (rule finite_subset)
  show "{i. real (p ^ (k * i + l)) ‚â§ x} ‚äÜ {..nat ‚åäx‚åã}"
  proof safe
    fix i assume i: "real (p ^ (k * i + l)) ‚â§ x"
    have "i < 2 ^ i" by (induction i) auto
    also from assms have "i ‚â§ k * i + l" by (cases k) auto
    hence "2 ^ i ‚â§ (2 ^ (k * i + l) :: nat)"
      using assms by (intro power_increasing) auto
    also have "‚Ä¶ ‚â§ p ^ (k * i + l)" using assms by (intro power_mono) auto
    also have "real ‚Ä¶ ‚â§ x" using i by simp
    finally show "i ‚â§ nat ‚åäx‚åã" by linarith
  qed
qed auto

text ‚Äπ
  Next, we need the following bound on $\zeta'(2)$:
‚Ä∫
lemma deriv_zeta_2_bound: "Re (deriv zeta 2) > -1"
proof -
  have "((Œªx::real. ln (x + 3) * (x + 3) powr -2) has_integral (ln 3 + 1) / 3) (interior {0..})"
    using ln_powr_has_integral_at_top[of 1 0 3 "-2"]
    by (simp add: interior_real_atLeast powr_minus)
  hence "((Œªx::real. ln (x + 3) * (x + 3) powr -2) has_integral (ln 3 + 1) / 3) {0..}"
    by (subst (asm) has_integral_interior) auto
  also have "?this ‚ü∑ ((Œªx::real. ln (x + 3) / (x + 3) ^ 2) has_integral (ln 3 + 1) / 3) {0..}"
    by (intro has_integral_cong) (auto simp: powr_minus field_simps) 
  finally have int: ‚Ä¶ .  
  have "exp (1 / 2 :: real) ^ 2 ‚â§ 2 ^ 2"
    using exp_le by (subst exp_double [symmetric]) simp_all
  hence exp_half: "exp (1 / 2 :: real) ‚â§ 2"
    by (rule power2_le_imp_le) auto

  have mono: "ln x / x ^ 2 ‚â§ ln y / y ^ 2" if "y ‚â• exp (1/2)" "x ‚â• y" for x y :: real
  proof (rule DERIV_nonpos_imp_nonincreasing[of _ _ "Œªx. ln x / x ^ 2"])
    fix t assume t: "t ‚â• y" "t ‚â§ x"
    have "y > 0" by (rule less_le_trans[OF _ that(1)]) auto
    with t that have "ln t ‚â• ln (exp (1 / 2))"
      by (subst ln_le_cancel_iff) auto
    hence "ln t ‚â• 1 / 2" by (simp only: ln_exp)
    from t ‚Äπy > 0‚Ä∫ have "((Œªx. ln x / x ^ 2) has_field_derivative ((1 - 2 * ln t) / t ^ 3)) (at t)"
      by (auto intro!: derivative_eq_intros simp: eval_nat_numeral field_simps)
    moreover have "(1 - 2 * ln t) / t ^ 3 ‚â§ 0"
      using t that ‚Äπy > 0‚Ä∫ ‚Äπln t ‚â• 1 / 2‚Ä∫ by (intro divide_nonpos_pos) auto
    ultimately show "‚àÉf'. ((Œªx. ln x / x ^ 2) has_field_derivative f') (at t) ‚àß f' ‚â§ 0" by blast
  qed fact+

  have "fds_converges (fds_deriv fds_zeta) (2 :: complex)"
