    by (intro fds_converges_deriv) auto
  hence "(Œªn. of_real (-ln (real (Suc n)) / (of_nat (Suc n)) ^ 2)) sums deriv zeta 2"
    by (auto simp: fds_converges_altdef add_ac eval_fds_deriv_zeta fds_nth_deriv scaleR_conv_of_real 
             simp del: of_nat_Suc)
  note * = sums_split_initial_segment[OF sums_minus[OF sums_Re[OF this]], of 3]
    have "(Œªn. ln (real (n+4)) / real (n+4) ^ 2) sums (-Re (deriv zeta 2) - (ln 2 / 4 + ln 3 / 9))"
      using * by (simp add: eval_nat_numeral)
  hence "-Re (deriv zeta 2) - (ln 2 / 4 + ln 3 / 9) =
            (‚àën. ln (real (Suc n) + 3) / (real (Suc n) + 3) ^ 2)"
    by (simp_all add: sums_iff algebra_simps)
  also have "‚Ä¶ ‚â§ (ln 3 + 1) / 3" using int exp_half
    by (intro decreasing_sum_le_integral divide_nonneg_pos mono) (auto simp: powr_minus field_simps)
  finally have "-Re (deriv zeta 2) ‚â§ (16 * ln 3 + 9 * ln 2 + 12) / 36"
    by simp
  also have "ln 3 ‚â§ (11 / 10 :: real)"
    using ln_approx_bounds[of 3 2] by (simp add: power_numeral_reduce numeral_2_eq_2)
  hence "(16 * ln 3 + 9 * ln 2 + 12) / 36 ‚â§ (16 * (11 / 10) + 9 * 25 / 36 + 12) / (36 :: real)"
    using ln2_le_25_over_36 by (intro add_mono mult_left_mono divide_right_mono) auto
  also have "‚Ä¶ < 1" by simp
  finally show ?thesis by simp
qed

text ‚Äπ
  Using the logarithmic derivative of Euler's product formula for $\zeta(s)$ at $s = 2$
  and the bound on $\zeta'(2)$ we have just derived, we can obtain the bound
  \[\sum_{p^i \leq x, i \geq 2} \frac{\ln p}{p^i} < \frac{9}{\pi^2}\ .\]
‚Ä∫
lemma mertens_remainder_aux_bound:
  fixes x :: real
  defines "R ‚â° (‚àë(p,i) | prime p ‚àß i > 1 ‚àß real (p ^ i) ‚â§ x. ln (real p) / p ^ i)"
  shows   "R < 9 / pi‚áß2"
proof -
  define S' where "S' = {(p, i). prime p ‚àß i > 1 ‚àß real (p ^ i) ‚â§ x}"
  define S'' where "S'' = {(p, i). prime p ‚àß i > 1 ‚àß real (p ^ Suc i) ‚â§ x}"

  have finite_row: "finite {i. i > 1 ‚àß real (p ^ (i + k)) ‚â§ x}" if p: "prime p" for p k
  proof (rule finite_subset)
    show "{i. i > 1 ‚àß real (p ^ (i + k)) ‚â§ x} ‚äÜ {..nat ‚åäx‚åã}"
    proof safe
      fix i assume i: "i > 1" "real (p ^ (i + k)) ‚â§ x"
      have "i < 2 ^ (i + k)" by (induction i) auto
      also from p have "‚Ä¶ ‚â§ p ^ (i + k)" by (intro power_mono) (auto dest: prime_gt_1_nat) 
      also have "real ‚Ä¶ ‚â§ x" using i by simp
      finally show "i ‚â§ nat ‚åäx‚åã" by linarith
    qed
  qed auto

  have "S'' ‚äÜ S'" unfolding S''_def S'_def
  proof safe
    fix p i assume pi: "prime p" "real (p ^ Suc i) ‚â§ x" "i > 1"
    have "real (p ^ i) ‚â§ real (p ^ Suc i)"
      using pi unfolding of_nat_le_iff by (intro power_increasing) (auto dest: prime_gt_1_nat)
    also have "‚Ä¶ ‚â§ x" by fact
    finally show "real (p ^ i) ‚â§ x" .
  qed

  have S'_alt:  "S' = (SIGMA p:{p. prime p ‚àß real p ‚â§ x}. {i. i > 1 ‚àß real (p ^ i) ‚â§ x})"
    unfolding S'_def
  proof safe
    fix p i assume "prime p" "real (p ^ i) ‚â§ x" "i > 1"
    hence "p ^ 1 ‚â§ p ^ i"
      by (intro power_increasing) (auto dest: prime_gt_1_nat)
    also have "real ‚Ä¶ ‚â§ x" by fact
    finally show "real p ‚â§ x" by simp
  qed

  have finite: "finite {p. prime p ‚àß real p ‚â§ x}"
    by (rule finite_subset[OF _ finite_Nats_le_real[of x]]) (auto dest: prime_gt_0_nat)
  have "finite S'" unfolding S'_alt using finite_row[of _ 0]
    by (intro finite_SigmaI finite) auto

  have "R ‚â§ 3 / 2 * (‚àë(p, i) | (p, i) ‚àà S' ‚àß even i. ln (real p) / real (p ^ i))"
  proof -
    have "R = (‚àëy‚àà{0, 1}. ‚àëz | z ‚àà S' ‚àß snd z mod 2 = y. ln (real (fst z)) / real (fst z ^ snd z))"
      using ‚Äπfinite S'‚Ä∫ by (subst sum.group) (auto simp: case_prod_unfold R_def S'_def)
    also have "‚Ä¶ = (‚àë(p,i) | (p, i) ‚àà S' ‚àß even i. ln (real p) / real (p ^ i)) +
                    (‚àë(p,i) | (p, i) ‚àà S' ‚àß odd i. ln (real p) / real (p ^ i))"
      unfolding even_iff_mod_2_eq_zero odd_iff_mod_2_eq_one by (simp add: case_prod_unfold)
    also have "(‚àë(p,i) | (p, i) ‚àà S' ‚àß odd i. ln (real p) / real (p ^ i)) =
                 (‚àë(p,i) | (p, i) ‚àà S'' ‚àß even i. ln (real p) / real (p ^ Suc i))"
      by (intro sum.reindex_bij_witness[of _ "Œª(p,i). (p, Suc i)" "Œª(p,i). (p, i - 1)"])
         (auto simp: case_prod_unfold S'_def S''_def elim: oddE simp del: power_Suc)
    also have "‚Ä¶ ‚â§ (‚àë(p,i) | (p, i) ‚àà S' ‚àß even i. ln (real p) / real (p ^ Suc i))"
      using ‚ÄπS'' ‚äÜ S'‚Ä∫ unfolding case_prod_unfold
      by (intro sum_mono2 divide_nonneg_pos ln_ge_zero finite_subset[OF _ ‚Äπfinite S'‚Ä∫])
         (auto simp: S'_def S''_def case_prod_unfold dest: prime_gt_0_nat simp del: power_Suc)
    also have "‚Ä¶ ‚â§ (‚àë(p,i) | (p, i) ‚àà S' ‚àß even i. ln (real p) / real (2 * p ^ i))"
      unfolding case_prod_unfold
      by (intro sum_mono divide_left_mono) (auto simp: S'_def dest!: prime_gt_1_nat)
    also have "‚Ä¶ = (1 / 2) * (‚àë(p,i) | (p, i) ‚àà S' ‚àß even i. ln (real p) / real (p ^ i))"
      by (subst sum_distrib_left) (auto simp: case_prod_unfold)
    also have "(‚àë(p,i) | (p, i) ‚àà S' ‚àß even i. ln (real p) / real (p ^ i)) + ‚Ä¶ =
                   3 / 2 * (‚àë(p,i) | (p, i) ‚àà S' ‚àß even i. ln (real p) / real (p ^ i))"
      by simp
    finally show ?thesis by simp
  qed

  also have "(‚àë(p,i) | (p, i) ‚àà S' ‚àß even i. ln (real p) / real (p ^ i)) =
               (‚àëp | prime p ‚àß real p ‚â§ x. ln (real p) * 
                 (‚àëi | i > 0 ‚àß even i ‚àß real (p ^ i) ‚â§ x. (1 / real p) ^ i))"
   unfolding sum_distrib_left
  proof (subst sum.Sigma[OF _ ballI])
    fix p assume p: "p ‚àà {p. prime p ‚àß real p ‚â§ x}"
    thus "finite {i. 0 < i ‚àß even i ‚àß real (p ^ i) ‚â§ x}"
      by (intro finite_subset[OF _ exponents_le_finite[of p 1 0 x]]) (auto dest: prime_gt_1_nat)
  qed (auto intro!: sum.cong finite_subset[OF _ finite_Nats_le_real[of x]]
            dest: prime_gt_0_nat simp: S'_alt power_divide)
  also have "‚Ä¶ ‚â§ (‚àëp | prime p ‚àß real p ‚â§ x. ln (real p) / (real p ^ 2 - 1))"
  proof (rule sum_mono)
    fix p assume p: "p ‚àà {p. prime p ‚àß real p ‚â§ x}"
    have "p > 1" using p by (auto dest: prime_gt_1_nat)
    have "(‚àëi | i > 0 ‚àß even i ‚àß real (p ^ i) ‚â§ x. (1 / real p) ^ i) =
            (‚àëi | real (p ^ (2 * i + 2)) ‚â§ x. (1 / real p) ^ (2 * i)) / real p ^ 2"
      (is "_ = ?S / _") unfolding sum_divide_distrib
      by (rule sum.reindex_bij_witness[of _ "Œªi. 2 * Suc i" "Œªi. (i - 2) div 2"])
         (insert ‚Äπp > 1‚Ä∫, auto simp: numeral_3_eq_3 power2_eq_square power_diff
                 algebra_simps elim!: evenE)
    also have "?S = (‚àëi | real (p ^ (2 * i + 2)) ‚â§ x. (1 / real p ^ 2) ^ i)"
      by (subst power_mult) (simp_all add: algebra_simps power_divide)
    also have "‚Ä¶ ‚â§ (‚àëi. (1 / real p ^ 2) ^ i)"
      using exponents_le_finite[of p 2 2 x] ‚Äπp > 1‚Ä∫
      by (intro sum_le_suminf) (auto simp: summable_geometric_iff)
    also have "‚Ä¶ = real p ^ 2 / (real p ^ 2 - 1)"
      using ‚Äπp > 1‚Ä∫ by (subst suminf_geometric) (auto simp: field_simps)
    also have "‚Ä¶ / real p ^ 2 = 1 / (real p ^ 2 - 1)"
      using ‚Äπp > 1 ‚Ä∫ by (simp add: divide_simps)
    finally have "(‚àëi | 0 < i ‚àß even i ‚àß real (p ^ i) ‚â§ x. (1 / real p) ^ i) ‚â§
                     1 / (real p ^ 2 - 1)" (is "?lhs ‚â§ ?rhs")
      using ‚Äπp > 1‚Ä∫ by (simp add: divide_right_mono)
    thus "ln (real p) * ?lhs ‚â§ ln (real p) / (real p ^ 2 - 1)"
      using ‚Äπp > 1‚Ä∫ by (simp add: divide_simps)
  qed
  also have "‚Ä¶ = (‚àë‚á©a p | prime p ‚àß real p ‚â§ x. ln (real p) / (real p ^ 2 - 1))"
    using finite by (intro infsetsum_finite [symmetric]) auto
  also have "‚Ä¶ ‚â§ (‚àë‚á©a p | prime p. ln (real p) / (real p ^ 2 - 1))"
    using eval_fds_logderiv_zeta_real[of 2] finite
    by (intro infsetsum_mono_neutral_left divide_nonneg_pos) (auto simp: dest: prime_gt_1_nat)
  also have "‚Ä¶ = -Re (deriv zeta (of_real 2) / zeta (of_real 2))"
    by (subst eval_fds_logderiv_zeta_real) auto
  also have "‚Ä¶ = (-Re (deriv zeta 2)) * (6 / pi‚áß2)"
    by (simp add: zeta_even_numeral)
  also have "‚Ä¶ < 1 * (6 / pi‚áß2)"
    using deriv_zeta_2_bound by (intro mult_strict_right_mono) auto
  also have "3 / 2 * ‚Ä¶ = 9 / pi‚áß2" by simp
  finally show ?thesis by simp
qed

text ‚Äπ
  We now consider the equation
  \[\ln (n!) = \sum_{k\leq n} \Lambda(k) \left\lfloor\frac{n}{k}\right\rfloor\]
  and estimate both sides in different ways. The left-hand-side can be estimated
  using Stirling's formula, and we can simplify the right-hand side to
  \[\sum_{k\leq n} \Lambda(k) \left\lfloor\frac{n}{k}\right\rfloor =
      \sum_{p^i \leq x, i \geq 1} \ln p \left\lfloor\frac{n}{p^i}\right\rfloor\]
  and then split the sum into those $p^i$ with $i = 1$ and those with $i \geq 2$.
  Applying the bound we have just shown and some more routine estimates, we obtain the
  following reasonably strong version of Mertens' First Theorem on the naturals:
  $\mathfrak M(n) - \ln(n) \in (-1-\frac{9}{\pi^2}; \ln 4]$
‚Ä∫
theorem mertens_bound_strong:
  fixes n :: nat assumes n: "n > 0"
  shows   "ùîê n - ln n ‚àà {-1 - 9 / pi‚áß2<..ln 4}"
proof (cases "n ‚â• 3")
  case False
  with n consider "n = 1" | "n = 2" by force
  thus ?thesis
  proof cases
    assume [simp]: "n = 1"
    have "-1 + (-9 / pi‚áß2) < 0"
      by (intro add_neg_neg divide_neg_pos) auto
    thus ?thesis by simp
  next
    assume [simp]: "n = 2"
    have eq: "ùîê n - ln n = -ln 2 / 2" by (simp add: eval_ùîê)
    have "-1 - 9 / pi ^ 2 + ln 2 / 2 ‚â§ -1 - 9 / 4 ^ 2 + 25 / 36 / 2"
      using pi_less_4 ln2_le_25_over_36
      by (intro diff_mono add_mono divide_left_mono divide_right_mono power_mono) auto
    also have "‚Ä¶ < 0" by simp
    finally have "-ln 2 / 2 > -1 - 9 / pi‚áß2" by simp
    moreover {
      have "-ln 2 / 2 ‚â§ (0::real)" by (intro divide_nonpos_pos) auto
      also have "‚Ä¶ ‚â§ ln 4" by simp
      finally have "-ln 2 / 2 ‚â§ ln (4 :: real)" by simp
    }
    ultimately show ?thesis unfolding eq by simp
  qed

next
  case True
  hence n: "n ‚â• 3" by simp
  have finite: "finite {(p, i). prime p ‚àß i ‚â• 1 ‚àß p ^ i ‚â§ n}"
  proof (rule finite_subset)
    show "{(p, i). prime p ‚àß i ‚â• 1 ‚àß p ^ i ‚â§ n}
            ‚äÜ {..nat ‚åäroot 1 (real n)‚åã} √ó {..nat ‚åälog 2 (real n)‚åã}"
      using primepows_le_subset[of "real n" 1] n unfolding of_nat_le_iff by auto
  qed auto

  define r where "r = prime_sum_upto (Œªp. ln (real p) * frac (real n / real p)) n"
  define R where "R = (‚àë(p,i) | prime p ‚àß i > 1 ‚àß p ^ i ‚â§ n. ln (real p) * real (n div (p ^ i)))"
  define R' where "R' = (‚àë(p,i) | prime p ‚àß i > 1 ‚àß p ^ i ‚â§ n. ln (real p) / p ^ i)"
  have [simp]: "ln (4 :: real) = 2 * ln 2"
    using ln_realpow[of 2 2] by simp
  from pi_less_4 have "ln pi ‚â§ ln 4" by (subst ln_le_cancel_iff) auto
  also have "‚Ä¶ = 2 * ln 2" by simp
  also have "‚Ä¶ ‚â§ 2 * (25 / 36)" by (intro mult_left_mono ln2_le_25_over_36) auto
  finally have ln_pi: "ln pi ‚â§ 25 / 18" by simp
  have "ln 3 ‚â§ ln (4::nat)" by (subst ln_le_cancel_iff) auto
  also have "‚Ä¶ = 2 * ln 2" by simp
  also have "‚Ä¶ ‚â§ 2 * (25 / 36)" by (intro mult_left_mono ln2_le_25_over_36) auto
  finally have ln_3: "ln (3::real) ‚â§ 25 / 18" by simp
  
  have "R / n = (‚àë(p,i) | prime p ‚àß i > 1 ‚àß p ^ i ‚â§ n. ln (real p) * (real (n div (p ^ i)) / n))"
    by (simp add: R_def sum_divide_distrib field_simps case_prod_unfold)
  also have "‚Ä¶ ‚â§ (‚àë(p,i) | prime p ‚àß i > 1 ‚àß p ^ i ‚â§ n. ln (real p) * (1 / p ^ i))"
    unfolding R'_def case_prod_unfold using n
    by (intro sum_mono mult_left_mono) (auto simp: field_simps real_of_nat_div dest: prime_gt_0_nat)
  also have "‚Ä¶ = R'" by (simp add: R'_def)
  also have "R' < 9 / pi‚áß2"
    unfolding R'_def using mertens_remainder_aux_bound[of n] by simp
  finally have "R / n < 9 / pi‚áß2" .
  moreover have "R ‚â• 0"
    unfolding R_def by (intro sum_nonneg mult_nonneg_nonneg) (auto dest: prime_gt_0_nat)
  ultimately have R_bounds: "R / n ‚àà {0..<9 / pi‚áß2}" by simp

  have "ln (fact n :: real) ‚â§ ln (2 * pi * n) / 2 + n * ln n - n + 1 / (12 * n)"
    using ln_fact_bounds(2)[of n] n by simp
  also have "‚Ä¶ / n - ln n = -1 + (ln 2 + ln pi) / (2 * n) + (ln n / n) / 2 + 1 / (12 * real n ^ 2)"
    using n by (simp add: power2_eq_square field_simps ln_mult)
  also have "‚Ä¶ ‚â§ -1 + (ln 2 + ln pi) / (2 * 3) + (ln 3 / 3) / 2 + 1 / (12 * 3‚áß2)"
    using exp_le n pi_gt3
    by (intro add_mono divide_right_mono divide_left_mono mult_mono
              mult_pos_pos ln_x_over_x_mono power_mono) auto
  also have "‚Ä¶ ‚â§ -1 + (25 / 36 + 25 / 18) / (2 * 3) + (25 / 18 / 3) / 2 + 1 / (12 * 3‚áß2)"
    using ln_pi ln2_le_25_over_36 ln_3 by (intro add_mono divide_left_mono divide_right_mono) auto
  also have "‚Ä¶ ‚â§ 0" by simp
  finally have "ln n - ln (fact n) / n ‚â• 0" using n by (simp add: divide_right_mono)
  have "-ln (fact n) ‚â§ -ln (2 * pi * n) / 2 - n * ln n + n"
    using ln_fact_bounds(1)[of n] n by simp
  also have "ln n + ‚Ä¶ / n = -ln (2 * pi) / (2 * n) - (ln n / n) / 2 + 1"
    using n by (simp add: field_simps ln_mult)
  also have "‚Ä¶ ‚â§ 0 - 0 + 1"
    using pi_gt3 n by (intro add_mono diff_mono) auto
  finally have upper: "ln n - ln (fact n) / n ‚â§ 1"
    using n by (simp add: divide_right_mono)
  with ‚Äπln n - ln (fact n) / n ‚â• 0‚Ä∫ have fact_bounds: "ln n - ln (fact n) / n ‚àà {0..1}" by simp

  have "r ‚â§ prime_sum_upto (Œªp. ln p * 1) n"
    using less_imp_le[OF frac_lt_1] unfolding r_def Œ∏_def prime_sum_upto_def
    by (intro sum_mono mult_left_mono) (auto simp: dest: prime_gt_0_nat)
  also have "‚Ä¶ = Œ∏ n" by (simp add: Œ∏_def)
  also have "‚Ä¶ < ln 4 * n" using n by (intro Œ∏_upper_bound) auto
  finally have "r / n < ln 4" using n by (simp add: field_simps)
  moreover have "r ‚â• 0" unfolding r_def prime_sum_upto_def
    by (intro sum_nonneg mult_nonneg_nonneg) (auto dest: prime_gt_0_nat)
  ultimately have r_bounds: "r / n ‚àà {0..<ln 4}" by simp

  have "ln (fact n :: real) = sum_upto (Œªk. mangoldt k * real (n div k)) (real n)"
    by (simp add: ln_fact_conv_sum_upto_mangoldt)
  also have "‚Ä¶ = (‚àë(p,i) | prime p ‚àß i > 0 ‚àß real (p ^ i) ‚â§ real n.
                       ln (real p) * real (n div (p ^ i)))"
    by (intro sum_upto_primepows) (auto simp: mangoldt_non_primepow)
  also have "{(p, i). prime p ‚àß i > 0 ‚àß real (p ^ i) ‚â§ real n} =
               {(p, i). prime p ‚àß i = 1 ‚àß p ‚â§ n} ‚à™
               {(p, i). prime p ‚àß i > 1 ‚àß (p ^ i) ‚â§ n}" unfolding of_nat_le_iff
    by (auto simp: not_less le_Suc_eq)
  also have "(‚àë(p,i)‚àà‚Ä¶. ln (real p) * real (n div (p ^ i))) =
               (‚àë(p,i) | prime p ‚àß i = 1 ‚àß p ‚â§ n. ln (real p) * real (n div (p ^ i))) + R"
    (is "_ = ?S + _")
    by (subst sum.union_disjoint) (auto intro!: finite_subset[OF _ finite] simp: R_def)
  also have "?S = prime_sum_upto (Œªp. ln (real p) * real (n div p)) n"
    unfolding prime_sum_upto_def
    by (intro sum.reindex_bij_witness[of _ "Œªp. (p, 1)" fst]) auto
  also have "‚Ä¶ = prime_sum_upto (Œªp. ln (real p) * real n / real p) n - r"
    unfolding r_def prime_sum_upto_def sum_subtractf[symmetric] using n
    by (intro sum.cong) (auto simp: frac_def real_of_nat_div algebra_simps)
  also have "prime_sum_upto (Œªp. ln (real p) * real n / real p) n = n * ùîê n"
    by (simp add: primes_M_def sum_distrib_left sum_distrib_right prime_sum_upto_def field_simps)
  finally have "ùîê n - ln n = ln (fact n) / n - ln n + r / n - R / n"
    using n by (simp add: field_simps)
  hence "ln n - ùîê n = ln n - ln (fact n) / n - r / n + R / n"
    by simp
  with fact_bounds r_bounds R_bounds show "ùîê n - ln n ‚àà {-1 - 9 / pi‚áß2<..ln 4}"
    by simp
qed

text ‚Äπ
  As a simple corollary, we obtain a similar bound on the reals.
‚Ä∫
lemma mertens_bound_real_strong:
  fixes x :: real assumes x: "x ‚â• 1"
  shows   "ùîê x - ln x ‚àà {-1 - 9 / pi ^ 2 - ln (1 + frac x / real (nat ‚åäx‚åã)) <.. ln 4}"
proof -
  have "ùîê x - ln x ‚â§ ùîê (real (nat ‚åäx‚åã)) - ln (real (nat ‚åäx‚åã))"
    using assms by simp
  also have "‚Ä¶ ‚â§ ln 4"
    using mertens_bound_strong[of "nat ‚åäx‚åã"] assms by simp
  finally have "ùîê x - ln x ‚â§ ln 4" .

  from assms have pos: "real_of_int ‚åäx‚åã ‚â† 0" by linarith
  have "frac x / real (nat ‚åäx‚åã) ‚â• 0"
    using assms by (intro divide_nonneg_pos) auto
  moreover have "frac x / real (nat ‚åäx‚åã) ‚â§ 1 / 1"
    using assms frac_lt_1[of x] by (intro frac_le) auto
  ultimately have *: "frac x / real (nat ‚åäx‚åã) ‚àà {0..1}" by auto
  have "ln x - ln (real (nat ‚åäx‚åã)) = ln (x / real (nat ‚åäx‚åã))"
    using assms by (subst ln_div) auto
  also have "x / real (nat ‚åäx‚åã) = 1 + frac x / real (nat ‚åäx‚åã)"
    using assms pos by (simp add: frac_def field_simps)
  finally have "ùîê x - ln x > -1-9/pi^2-ln (1 + frac x / real (nat ‚åäx‚åã))"
    using mertens_bound_strong[of "nat ‚åäx‚åã"] x by simp
  with ‚Äπùîê x - ln x ‚â§ ln 4‚Ä∫ show ?thesis by simp
qed

text ‚Äπ
  We weaken this estimate a bit to obtain nicer bounds:
‚Ä∫
lemma mertens_bound_real':
  fixes x :: real assumes x: "x ‚â• 1"
  shows   "ùîê x - ln x ‚àà {-2<..25/18}"
proof -
  have "ùîê x - ln x ‚â§ ln 4"
    using mertens_bound_real_strong[of x] x by simp
  also have "‚Ä¶ ‚â§ 25 / 18"
    using ln_realpow[of 2 2] ln2_le_25_over_36 by simp
  finally have "ùîê x - ln x ‚â§ 25 / 18" .

  have ln2: "ln (2 :: real) ‚àà {2/3..25/36}"
    using ln_approx_bounds[of 2 1] by (simp add: eval_nat_numeral)
  have ln3: "ln (3::real) ‚àà {1..10/9}"
    using ln_approx_bounds[of 3 1] by (simp add: eval_nat_numeral)
  have ln5: "ln (5::real) ‚àà {4/3..76/45}"
    using ln_approx_bounds[of 5 1] by (simp add: eval_nat_numeral)
  have ln7: "ln (7::real) ‚àà {3/2..15/7}"
    using ln_approx_bounds[of 7 1] by (simp add: eval_nat_numeral)
  have ln11: "ln (11::real) ‚àà {5/3..290/99}"
    using ln_approx_bounds[of 11 1] by (simp add: eval_nat_numeral)

  ‚Äï ‚ÄπChoosing the lower bound -2 is somewhat arbitrary here; it is a trade-off between getting
      a reasonably tight bound and having to make lots of case distinctions. To get -2 as a lower
      bound, we have to show the cases up to ‚Äπx = 11‚Ä∫ by case distinction,‚Ä∫
  have "ùîê x - ln x > -2"
  proof (cases "x ‚â• 11")
    case False
    hence "x ‚àà {1..<2} ‚à® x ‚àà {2..<3} ‚à® x ‚àà {3..<5} ‚à® x ‚àà {5..<7} ‚à® x ‚àà {7..<11}"
      using x by force
    thus ?thesis
    proof (elim disjE)
      assume x: "x ‚àà {1..<2}"
      hence "ln x - ùîê x ‚â§ ln 2 - 0"
        by (intro diff_mono) auto
      also have "‚Ä¶ < 2" using ln2_le_25_over_36 by simp
      finally show ?thesis by simp
    next
      assume x: "x ‚àà {2..<3}"
      hence [simp]: "‚åäx‚åã = 2" by (intro floor_unique) auto
      from x have "ln x - ùîê x ‚â§ ln 3 - ln 2 / 2"
        by (intro diff_mono) (auto simp: eval_ùîê)
      also have "‚Ä¶ = ln (9 / 2) / 2" using ln_realpow[of 3 2] by (simp add: ln_div)
      also have "‚Ä¶ < 2" using ln_approx_bounds[of "9 / 2" 1] by (simp add: eval_nat_numeral)
      finally show ?thesis by simp
    next
      assume x: "x ‚àà {3..<5}"
      hence "ùîê 3 = ùîê x"
        unfolding primes_M_def
        by (intro prime_sum_upto_eqI'[where a' = 3 and b' = 4])
           (auto simp: nat_le_iff le_numeral_iff nat_eq_iff floor_eq_iff)
      also have "ùîê 3 = ln 2 / 2 + ln 3 / 3"
        by (simp add: eval_ùîê eval_nat_numeral mark_out_code)
      finally have [simp]: "ùîê x = ln 2 / 2 + ln 3 / 3" ..
      from x have "ln x - ùîê x ‚â§ ln 5 - (ln 2 / 2 + ln 3 / 3)"
        by (intro diff_mono) auto
      also have "‚Ä¶ < 2" using ln2 ln3 ln5 by simp
      finally show ?thesis by simp
    next
      assume x: "x ‚àà {5..<7}"
      hence "ùîê 5 = ùîê x"
        unfolding primes_M_def
        by (intro prime_sum_upto_eqI'[where a' = 5 and b' = 6])
           (auto simp: nat_le_iff le_numeral_iff nat_eq_iff floor_eq_iff)
      also have "ùîê 5 = ln 2 / 2 + ln 3 / 3 + ln 5 / 5"
        by (simp add: eval_ùîê eval_nat_numeral mark_out_code)
      finally have [simp]: "ùîê x = ln 2 / 2 + ln 3 / 3 + ln 5 / 5" ..
      from x have "ln x - ùîê x ‚â§ ln 7 - (ln 2 / 2 + ln 3 / 3 + ln 5 / 5)"
        by (intro diff_mono) auto
      also have "‚Ä¶ < 2" using ln2 ln3 ln5 ln7 by simp
      finally show ?thesis by simp
    next
      assume x: "x ‚àà {7..<11}"
      hence "ùîê 7 = ùîê x"
        unfolding primes_M_def
        by (intro prime_sum_upto_eqI'[where a' = 7 and b' = 10])
           (auto simp: nat_le_iff le_numeral_iff nat_eq_iff floor_eq_iff)
      also have "ùîê 7 = ln 2 / 2 + ln 3 / 3 + ln 5 / 5 + ln 7 / 7"
        by (simp add: eval_ùîê eval_nat_numeral mark_out_code)
      finally have [simp]: "ùîê x = ln 2 / 2 + ln 3 / 3 + ln 5 / 5 + ln 7 / 7" ..
      from x have "ln x - ùîê x ‚â§ ln 11 - (ln 2 / 2 + ln 3 / 3 + ln 5 / 5 + ln 7 / 7)"
        by (intro diff_mono) auto
      also have "‚Ä¶ < 2" using ln2 ln3 ln5 ln7 ln11 by simp
      finally show ?thesis by simp
    qed
  next
    case True
    have "ln x - ùîê x ‚â§ 1 + 9/pi^2 + ln (1 + frac x / real (nat ‚åäx‚åã))"
      using mertens_bound_real_strong[of x] x by simp
    also have "1 + frac x / real (nat ‚åäx‚åã) ‚â§ 1 + 1 / 11"
      using True frac_lt_1[of x] by (intro add_mono frac_le) auto
    hence "ln (1 + frac x / real (nat ‚åäx‚åã)) ‚â§ ln (1 + 1 / 11)"
      using x by (subst ln_le_cancel_iff) (auto intro!: add_pos_nonneg)
    also have "‚Ä¶ = ln (12 / 11)" by simp
    also have "‚Ä¶ ‚â§ 1585 / 18216"
      using ln_approx_bounds[of "12 / 11" 1] by (simp add: eval_nat_numeral)
    also have "9 / pi ^ 2 ‚â§ 9 / 3.141592653588 ^ 2"
      using pi_approx by (intro divide_left_mono power_mono mult_pos_pos) auto
    also have "1 + ‚Ä¶ + 1585 / 18216 < 2"
      by (simp add: power2_eq_square)
    finally show ?thesis by simp
  qed
  with ‚Äπùîê x - ln x ‚â§ 25 / 18‚Ä∫ show ?thesis by simp
qed

corollary mertens_first_theorem:
  fixes x :: real assumes x: "x ‚â• 1"
  shows   "¬¶ùîê x - ln x¬¶ < 2"
  using mertens_bound_real'[of x] x by (simp add: abs_if)


subsection ‚ÄπMertens' Second Theorem‚Ä∫

text ‚Äπ
  Mertens' Second Theorem concerns the asymptotics of the Prime Harmonic Series, namely
  \[\sum\limits_{p \leq x} \frac{1}{p} = \ln\ln x + M + O\left(\frac{1}{\ln x}\right)\]
  where $M \approx 0.261497$ is the Meissel--Mertens constant.

  We define the constant in the following way:
‚Ä∫
definition meissel_mertens where
  "meissel_mertens = 1 - ln (ln 2) + integral {2..} (Œªt. (ùîê t - ln t) / (t * ln t ^ 2))"

text ‚Äπ
  We will require the value of the integral
  $\int_a^\infty \frac{t}{\ln^2 t} \textrm{d}t = \frac{1}{\ln a}$
  as an upper bound on the remainder term:
‚Ä∫
lemma integral_one_over_x_ln_x_squared:
  assumes a: "(a::real) > 1"
  shows "set_integrable lborel {a<..} (Œªt. 1 / (t * ln t ^ 2))" (is ?th1)
    and "set_lebesgue_integral lborel {a<..} (Œªt. 1 / (t * ln t ^ 2)) = 1 / ln a" (is ?th2)
    and "((Œªt. 1 / (t * (ln t)‚áß2)) has_integral 1 / ln a) {a<..}" (is ?th3)
proof -
  have cont: "isCont (Œªt. 1 / (t * (ln t)‚áß2)) x" if "x > a" for x
    using that a by (auto intro!: continuous_intros)
  have deriv: "((Œªx. -1 / ln x) has_real_derivative 1 / (x * (ln x)‚áß2)) (at x)" if "x > a" for x
    using that a by (auto intro!: derivative_eq_intros simp: power2_eq_square field_simps)
  have lim1: "(((Œªx. - 1 / ln x) ‚àò real_of_ereal) ‚§è -(1 / ln a)) (at_right (ereal a))"
    unfolding ereal_tendsto_simps using a by (real_asymp simp: field_simps)
  have lim2: "(((Œªx. - 1 / ln x) ‚àò real_of_ereal) ‚§è 0) (at_left ‚àû)"
    unfolding ereal_tendsto_simps using a by (real_asymp simp: field_simps)

  have "set_integrable lborel (einterval a ‚àû) (Œªt. 1 / (t * ln t ^ 2))"
    by (rule interval_integral_FTC_nonneg[OF _ deriv cont _ lim1 lim2]) (use a in auto)
  thus ?th1 by simp
  have "interval_lebesgue_integral lborel (ereal a) ‚àû (Œªt. 1 / (t * ln t ^ 2)) = 0 - (-(1 / ln a))"
    by (rule interval_integral_FTC_nonneg[OF _ deriv cont _ lim1 lim2]) (use a in auto)
  thus ?th2 by (simp add: interval_integral_to_infinity_eq)

  have "((Œªt. 1 / (t * ln t ^ 2)) has_integral
           set_lebesgue_integral lebesgue {a<..} (Œªt. 1 / (t * ln t ^ 2))) {a<..}"
    using ‚Äπ?th1‚Ä∫ by (intro has_integral_set_lebesgue)
                    (auto simp: set_integrable_def integrable_completion)
  also have "set_lebesgue_integral lebesgue {a<..} (Œªt. 1 / (t * ln t ^ 2)) = 1 / ln a"
    using ‚Äπ?th2‚Ä∫ unfolding set_lebesgue_integral_def by (subst integral_completion) auto
  finally show ?th3 .
qed

text ‚Äπ
  We show that the integral in our definition of the Meissel--Mertens constant is
  well-defined and give an upper bound for its tails:
‚Ä∫
lemma
  assumes "a > (1 :: real)"
  defines "r ‚â° (Œªt. (ùîê t - ln t) / (t * ln t ^ 2))"
  shows integrable_meissel_mertens:  "set_integrable lborel {a<..} r"
    and meissel_mertens_integral_le: "norm (integral {a<..} r) ‚â§ 2 / ln a"
proof -
  have *: "((Œªt. 2 * (1 / (t * ln t ^ 2))) has_integral 2 * (1 / ln a)) {a<..}"
    using assms by (intro has_integral_mult_right integral_one_over_x_ln_x_squared) auto
  show "set_integrable lborel {a<..} r" unfolding set_integrable_def
  proof (rule Bochner_Integration.integrable_bound[OF _ _ AE_I2])
    have "integrable lborel (Œªt::real. indicator {a<..} t * (2 * (1 / (t * ln t ^ 2))))"
      using integrable_mult_right[of 2, 
              OF integral_one_over_x_ln_x_squared(1)[of a, unfolded set_integrable_def]] assms
      by (simp add: algebra_simps)
    thus "integrable lborel (Œªt::real. indicator {a<..} t *‚á©R (2 / (t * ln t ^ 2)))"
      by simp
    fix x :: real
    show "norm (indicat_real {a<..} x *‚á©R r x) ‚â§
            norm (indicat_real {a<..} x *‚á©R (2 / (x * ln x ^ 2)))"
    proof (cases "x > a")
      case True
      thus ?thesis
      unfolding norm_scaleR norm_mult r_def norm_divide using mertens_first_theorem[of x] assms
        by (intro mult_mono frac_le divide_nonneg_pos) (auto simp: indicator_def)
    qed (auto simp: indicator_def)
  qed (auto simp: r_def)
  hence "r integrable_on {a<..}"
    by (simp add: set_borel_integral_eq_integral(1))
  hence "norm (integral {a<..} r) ‚â§ integral {a<..} (Œªx. 2 * (1 / (x * ln x ^ 2)))"
  proof (rule integral_norm_bound_integral)
    show  "(Œªx. 2 * (1 / (x * (ln x)‚áß2))) integrable_on {a<..}"
      using * by (simp add: has_integral_iff)
    fix x assume "x ‚àà {a<..}"
    hence "norm (r x) ‚â§ 2 / (x * (ln x)‚áß2)"
      unfolding r_def norm_divide using mertens_first_theorem[of x] assms
      by (intro mult_mono frac_le divide_nonneg_pos) (auto simp: indicator_def)
    thus "norm (r x) ‚â§ 2* (1 / (x * ln x ^ 2))" by simp
  qed
  also have "‚Ä¶ = 2 / ln a"
    using * by (simp add: has_integral_iff)
  finally show "norm (integral {a<..} r) ‚â§ 2 / ln a" .
qed

lemma integrable_on_meissel_mertens:
  assumes "A ‚äÜ {1..}" "Inf A > 1" "A ‚àà sets borel"
  shows   "(Œªt. (ùîê t - ln t) / (t * ln t ^ 2)) integrable_on A"
proof -
  from assms obtain x where x: "1 < x" "x < Inf A"
    using dense by blast
  from assms have "bdd_below A" by (intro bdd_belowI[of _ 1]) auto
  hence "A ‚äÜ {Inf A..}" by (auto simp: cInf_lower)
  also have "‚Ä¶ ‚äÜ {x<..}" using x by auto
  finally have *: "A ‚äÜ {x<..}" .
  have "set_integrable lborel A (Œªt. (ùîê t - ln t) / (t * ln t ^ 2))"
    by (rule set_integrable_subset[OF integrable_meissel_mertens[of x]]) (use x * assms in auto)
  thus ?thesis by (simp add: set_borel_integral_eq_integral(1))
qed

lemma meissel_mertens_bounds: "¬¶meissel_mertens - 1 + ln (ln 2)¬¶ ‚â§ 2 / ln 2"
proof -
  have *: "{2..} - {2<..} = {2::real}" by auto
  also have "negligible ‚Ä¶" by simp
  finally have "integral {2..} (Œªt. (ùîê t - ln t) / (t * (ln t)‚áß2)) =
                  integral {2<..} (Œªt. (ùîê t - ln t) / (t * (ln t)‚áß2))"
    by (intro sym[OF integral_subset_negligible]) auto
  also have "norm ‚Ä¶ ‚â§ 2 / ln 2"
    by (rule meissel_mertens_integral_le) auto
  finally show "¬¶meissel_mertens - 1 + ln (ln 2)¬¶ ‚â§ 2 / ln 2"
    by (simp add: meissel_mertens_def)
qed

text ‚Äπ
  Finally, obtaining Mertens' second theorem from the first one is nothing but a routine
  summation by parts, followed by a use of the above bound:
‚Ä∫
theorem mertens_second_theorem:
  defines "f ‚â° prime_sum_upto (Œªp. 1 / p)"
  shows   "‚ãÄx. x ‚â• 2 ‚üπ ¬¶f x - ln (ln x) - meissel_mertens¬¶ ‚â§ 4 / ln x"
    and   "(Œªx. f x - ln (ln x) - meissel_mertens) ‚àà O(Œªx. 1 / ln x)"
proof -
  define r where "r = (Œªt. (ùîê t - ln t) / (t * ln t ^ 2))"

  {
    fix x :: real assume x: "x > 2"
    have "((Œªt. ùîê t * (-1 / (t * ln t ^ 2))) has_integral ùîê x * (1 / ln x) - ùîê 2 * (1 / ln 2) -
            (‚àën‚ààreal -` {2<..x}. ind prime n * (ln n / real n) * (1 / ln n))) {2..x}"
      unfolding primes_M_def prime_sum_upto_altdef1 using x
      by (intro partial_summation_strong[of "{}"])
         (auto intro!: continuous_intros derivative_eq_intros simp: power2_eq_square
               simp flip: has_field_derivative_iff_has_vector_derivative)
    also have "ùîê x * (1 / ln x) - ùîê 2 * (1 / ln 2) - 
                 (‚àën‚ààreal -` {2<..x}. ind prime n * (ln n / n) * (1 / ln n)) =
               ùîê x / ln x - (‚àën‚ààinsert 2 (real -` {2<..x}). ind prime n * (ln n / n) * (1 / ln n))" 
      (is "_ = _ - ?S")
      by (subst sum.insert)
         (auto simp: primes_M_def finite_vimage_real_of_nat_greaterThanAtMost eval_prime_sum_upto)
    also have "?S = f x"
      unfolding f_def prime_sum_upto_altdef1 sum_upto_def using x
      by (intro sum.mono_neutral_cong_left) (auto simp: not_less numeral_2_eq_2 le_Suc_eq)
    finally have "((Œªt. -ùîê t / (t * ln t ^ 2)) has_integral (ùîê x / ln x - f x)) {2..x}"
      by simp
    from has_integral_neg[OF this]
      have "((Œªt. ùîê t / (t * ln t ^ 2)) has_integral (f x - ùîê x / ln x)) {2..x}" by simp
    hence "((Œªt. ùîê t / (t * ln t ^ 2) - 1 / (t * ln t)) has_integral
             (f x - ùîê x / ln x - (ln (ln x) - ln (ln 2)))) {2..x}" using x
      by (intro has_integral_diff fundamental_theorem_of_calculus)
         (auto simp flip: has_field_derivative_iff_has_vector_derivative
               intro!: derivative_eq_intros)
    also have "?this ‚ü∑ (r has_integral (f x - ùîê x / ln x - (ln (ln x) - ln (ln 2)))) {2..x}"
      by (intro has_integral_cong) (auto simp: r_def field_simps power2_eq_square)
    finally have ‚Ä¶ .
  } note integral = this

  define R‚á©ùîê where "R‚á©ùîê = (Œªx. ùîê x - ln x)"
  have ùîê: "ùîê x = ln x + R‚á©ùîê x" for x by (simp add: R‚á©ùîê_def)
  define I where "I = (Œªx. integral {x..} r)"
  define C where "C = (1 - ln (ln 2) + I 2)"
  have C_altdef: "C = meissel_mertens"
    by (simp add: I_def r_def C_def meissel_mertens_def)

  show bound: " ¬¶f x - ln (ln x) - meissel_mertens¬¶ ‚â§ 4 / ln x" if x: "x ‚â• 2" for x
  proof (cases "x = 2")
    case True
    hence "¬¶f x - ln (ln x) - meissel_mertens¬¶ = ¬¶1 / 2 - ln (ln 2) - meissel_mertens¬¶"
      by (simp add: f_def eval_prime_sum_upto )
    also have "‚Ä¶ ‚â§ 2 / ln 2 + 1 / 2"
      using meissel_mertens_bounds by linarith
    also have "‚Ä¶ ‚â§ 2 / ln 2 + 2 / ln 2" using ln2_le_25_over_36
      by (intro add_mono divide_left_mono) auto
    finally show ?thesis using True by simp
  next
    case False
    hence x: "x > 2" using x by simp
    have "integral {2..x} r + I x = integral ({2..x} ‚à™ {x..}) r" unfolding I_def r_def using x
      by (intro integral_Un [symmetric] integrable_on_meissel_mertens) (auto simp: max_def r_def)
    also have "{2..x} ‚à™ {x..} = {2..}" using x by auto
    finally have *: "integral {2..x} r = I 2 - I x" unfolding I_def by simp
    have eq: "f x - ln (ln x) - C = R‚á©ùîê x / ln x - I x"
      using integral[OF x] x by (auto simp: C_def field_simps ùîê has_integral_iff *)
    also have "¬¶‚Ä¶¬¶ ‚â§ ¬¶R‚á©ùîê x / ln x¬¶ + norm (I x)"
      unfolding real_norm_def by (rule abs_triangle_ineq4)
    also have "¬¶R‚á©ùîê x / ln x¬¶ ‚â§ 2 / ¬¶ln x¬¶"
      unfolding R‚á©ùîê_def abs_divide using mertens_first_theorem[of x] x
      by (intro divide_right_mono) auto
    also have "{x..} - {x<..} = {x}" and "{x<..} ‚äÜ {x..}" by auto
    hence "I x = integral {x<..} r" unfolding I_def
      by (intro integral_subset_negligible [symmetric]) simp_all
    also have "norm ‚Ä¶ ‚â§ 2 / ln x"
      using meissel_mertens_integral_le[of x] x by (simp add: r_def)
    finally show "¬¶f x - ln (ln x) - meissel_mertens¬¶ ‚â§ 4 / ln x"
      using x by (simp add: C_altdef)
  qed

  have "(Œªx. f x - ln (ln x) - C) ‚àà O(Œªx. 1 / ln x)"
  proof (intro landau_o.bigI[of 4] eventually_mono[OF eventually_ge_at_top[of 2]])
    fix x :: real assume x: "x ‚â• 2"
    with bound[OF x] show "norm (f x - ln (ln x) - C) ‚â§ 4 * norm (1 / ln x)"
      by (simp add: C_altdef)
  qed (auto intro!: add_pos_nonneg)
  thus "(Œªx. f x - ln (ln x) - meissel_mertens) ‚àà O(Œªx. 1 / ln x)"
    by (simp add: C_altdef)
qed

corollary prime_harmonic_asymp_equiv: "prime_sum_upto (Œªp. 1 / p) ‚àº[at_top] (Œªx. ln (ln x))"
proof -
  define f where "f = prime_sum_upto (Œªp. 1 / p)"
  have "(Œªx. f x - ln (ln x) - meissel_mertens + meissel_mertens) ‚àà o(Œªx. ln (ln x))"
    unfolding f_def
    by (rule sum_in_smallo[OF landau_o.big_small_trans[OF mertens_second_theorem(2)]]) real_asymp+
  hence "(Œªx. f x - ln (ln x)) ‚àà o(Œªx. ln (ln x))"
    by simp
  thus ?thesis unfolding f_def
    by (rule smallo_imp_asymp_equiv)
qed

text ‚Äπ
  As a corollary, we get the divergence of the prime harmonic series.
‚Ä∫
corollary prime_harmonic_diverges: "filterlim (prime_sum_upto (Œªp. 1 / p)) at_top at_top"
  using asymp_equiv_symI[OF prime_harmonic_asymp_equiv]
  by (rule asymp_equiv_at_top_transfer) real_asymp

(*<*)
unbundle no_prime_counting_notation
(*>*)

end
